description:
Tasty burgers and perfectly crisp fries. This joint has been on Ocean for years and I grew up in the neighborhood but honestly didn't try this place until a few years ago. Totally regret choosing McDonald's over Beeps!

I've gotten the normal burger, turkey burger, and chicken strips. They've all been good and the bun is much higher quality than other places. Kind of reminds me of a shake shack burger.

The drive thru concept makes this place a lot cooler and easier for parking (ocean avenue parking can be impossible).
author: Mary X.

description:
I love beep's burgers. I don't typically crave burgers or sandwiches but whenever I am in san francisco, I crave Beep's. 

Beep's is a drive in restaurant. They have plenty of parking and you order at the cashier. There are a few tables for outdoor seating.

The chicken sandwich is so amazing! I love the slaw since it's not too flavorful and complements the crispiness of the chicken well.  The onion rings are also super crispy and not too thin.
author: Stella S.

description:
One of the best burgers in San Francisco.

This place is a local legend and has absolutely great food and service.

Prepare to wait a while outside or in your car for your name to be called.

However the burgers are juicy, delicious and the chicken items are great as well.

Highly recommend the 1/4 burger with garlic fries.
author: Frida P.

description:
tl;dr affordable, probably the best burger I've had so far in San Francisco. Menu has tons including corn dogs, chicken nuggets, and milkshakes! Outside seating only.

I loved this place! Honestly I was blown away at how much stuff they have on their menu. Most places have some burgers and wings and fries with a couple options for toppings. Not Beep's! Beep's has corn dogs, jalapeno poppers, chicken nuggets, fries, curly fries, garlic fries, milkshakes, etc etc etc. Pretty much any typically American burger-and-hot-dog type food you can find here! You can also find lots of different types of 'burgers': chicken, fish, etc.

The burgers are great too. They're hot and fresh, and I ordered extra cheese so the burger was gooey and delicious. The patty is slightly crispy on the edges and meaty on the inside. The sandwich itself is huge and will leave you full forever, pretty much. I like my milkshakes almost too thick to drink, which is how they serve them as Beep's. The chocolate is delicious and doesn't taste chalky like a lot of chocolate shakes do.

I'd say the only thing I really didn't like about Beep's was that it's outside seating on bar stools around the stand, so it's kind of annoying because everything will blow away while you eat and your fingers are greasy and it's just kind of a mess...

But it's worth it!
author: Claire C.

description:
Good and yummy burger. We got crispy chicken n curly fries. Food was great. There is always a long line...also they have a small parking lot...for most part people come n go n it is easy to find parking. 
Good burger and will definitely recommend this place. Limited seating to eat onsite so either eat it in car or make it a take out.
author: Nidhi D.

description: This place was life changing. The crispy chicken sandwich tasted so high end and was so juicy. The chicken was very crispy and delicious. The garlic fries were delicious too ! Oh and the Oreo shake was to die for. I will definitely be coming back !! I already crave it and I ate it yesterday. Only down side is it is on the pricer side for a place with no seating and just a walk up diner
author: Kloe K.

description:
Beep's is the spot when in need of a bomb burger or delicious milkshake. I usually go for the Beep's 1/4 pounder as the 1/2 is a bit too meaty and gets real messy. Love the old school vibe of just pulling up right onto the parking lot. 

Only downside they close pretty early.

As long as they keep making flavorful burgers they can have my 5 stars.
author: Yuriy T.

description: A classic spot in Ingleside. Best burgers and jalapeno​ poppers I have ever had. You can't really beat the prices, it is​ absolutely​ worth it. Great for students living around there that don't want to break their budget. If you live close enough call in your order for pickup so you don't wait in the cold.
author: Mubaraka M.

description: This is my first review on Yelp and I'm glad to start with Beep's Burgers.Since I work at a fine-dining restaurant I know how a good burger should be done.And these guys make it AWESOME.Just take a look at lettuce and the color of fries and you'll see what I'm saying.I always try to leave tips.Definitely five stars.
author: Abdukarim A.

description:
I'm a doordasher and my last doordash brought me to area where Beep's Burgers resides. It must have been destiny. You see I've been out of the Yelp review game for quite awhile but as I took that first bite...I realized that there are still things in this world worth reviewing. Now without a further a do...Beep's Burgers, a humble burger shack, taking it's rightful place on Ocean. It serves as a reminder that sometimes it is the simple things in life that reveal the most beauty. A burger joint of humble beginnings yet profound results. No hipster twists, instagramable trends, or food network stardom. Strap on your seatbelts cause it's just you and the burger baby.

I ordered a 1/4lb Beep's Burgers (with cheese and bacon) with a side of curly fries for $13.02. And I gotta tell you as far as first bites go, that was the most memorable, fireworks in the brain inducing first bite I have ever taken of a burger. And get this, that first bite wasn't because the juicy quarter lb sweet baby jesus of a burger patty (which i'll get to later) it was because that god damn BUNS. Traditionally burger buns are toasted and I don't believe Beep's toasts their buns if not lightly toasted. But what it lacks in crunchy toastedness it makes up in divine texture. That first bite welcomed me to the buns of the most beloved angel of God Almighty, whos buns are the fluffiest, pillowy, and cushiony buns ever to land upon my taste buds. It served as the royal throne to its burger royalty. Ya kno sometimes the burger chooses the bun but today the bun chose the burger.

Now for the burger itself. I tell you Beep's Burgers gets it. It is a testement to how simple, fresh ingredients pay big dividends. The 1/4 burger was not lacking it was thicc, it was juicy, its a burger you wanna take on a nice date. The lettuce provided that nice thin layer of crunch. I dont usually like tomatoes in my burgers but I tell you that lovely slice of tomato gave the perfect sweetness and juiciness that meshed well with the burger and tangy Beep's Sauce. Look as a Californian I always slept,ate,breathed, and believed in In&Out as my favorite burger. Cant lie Beep's makes you question what you know as the truth. While In&Out may have the heart of the kid in me...Beep's Burgers resembles manhood's appreciation of the simple things in life. Oh Beep's Burgers until our paths intertwine again...
author: Adrian E.

description:
Would like to check the hype of Beep's Burgers! I ordered 1/4 lbs beep burger & garlic fries... My Score: Burger + American Cheese 6/10, Garlic Fries 8/10

Disappointed on burger... tasted like McDonald's Quarter Pounder... Maybe I came on the wrong day... I will get back and try them again one day...
author: Dedy G.

description: Beeps is hella good. I don't normally leave yelp reviews. But beeps deserves some positivity. Everything is pretty legit. From the fries to the burgers to the shakes. Beeps be goinnnnnn.  I like the additional toppings you can add to your burger. This was a burger I customize, and let me tell you it was big Lit.  Quarter pound beeps burger with American cheese, bacon, egg and a hash brown. I was craving brunch, and this was the closest thing to fulfill that taste. If your in the neighborhood beeps is a must slide (meaning go check it out). You wont be disappointed.
author: Jamerson H.

description: Just forget that other burger place that you drive "out-n-in" to in Daly City to get your fast food fix. If you're in your car, going to Daly City, you're wrong. Beeps will smoke the tastebuds off of your mouth and fire your endorphins like litebrite compared to most other fast food burgers in the city. Enjoy the wee slice of old San Francisco that you're helping to save and delight in the glory of toasty fried-ness!
author: Matt N.

description: Just wth?! Their meat looks disgusting and tastes disgusting Their curly fries is kinda hard/too crispy. I just wanted to splurge a little bit for lunch but was extremely disappointed by their burger. I believe any American fast food restaurant is better than this place, even the burger from my high school lunch is so much better than this. Seriously!
author: Yang W.

description: Beep! Perhaps one of the last things you'd expect to find in San Francisco is a drive-in, but Beep's Burgers has been here for as long as I can remember (my childhood home is just up the hill!). Their menu sounds so simple--just a variety of burgers, sandwiches, and sides, but some of the ingredients are almost gourmet. I tried the 1/2 lb Beep's burger, which came with lettuce, tomato, and zesty Beep's sauce along with two patties of beef. I also had the veggie burger with grilled mushrooms and jalapenos with Beep's sauce on a Semifreddi bun. Both of these were surprisingly tasty, and the both burgers were so juicy and warm. This is no fast food burger--the prices are definitely not the cheapest, but the food really hits the spot!
author: David K.

description:
17.12.13.  Finally tried it.
                  Thought it was a plain drive-in.
                   Surprise ... It's damn good

Burger -------------------- 4 - 4 1/2
Price ----------------------- very affordable

Taste like a Super Duper ... 
         Minus the excessive grease.
No indoor seating.
Either to-go or outside seatings.
The prices on the other goods are very reasoable.

Definately belongs on my top 10 burger in SF
author: S.K. Y.

description: Nom!!! Best burgers in the SF area. I get the 1/2lb Beep's Burger with cheddar. My husband adds jalapeño. They can lettuce wrap. It's roughly $10 per burger but worth treating yourself with.
author: Sara K.

description:
- Not only do they have great fried chicken sandwiches,Burgers, Shakes & Fries, but it's been around over 50 years.
- Flattop burgers cooked to perfection. 
- Ohheeyyy Goooey cheese and toppings everywhere. 
- The buns were perfect to handle the size of the burger 
- Thick cut Fries
- Milkshakes that require a spoon they are so thick and yummy. 
- Came here in late December & I still think about it.
- Parking is interesting 
- Outdoor seating only.
- Definitely a neighborhood spot. 
- Worth the easy drive from the Penn.
- Definitely a TOP 5? Top 10 Bay Area Burger Spot.
Can't wait to return.
- so cheap you feel guilty & wish there were a tip jar for awesome staff.
author: Patrick Z.

description:
Taste and price, definitely can't beat it. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but they have decent quality burgers and sandwiches here! It's a good spot to get your quick fix. Their burgers are big and tasty, their grilled chicken sandwich had a great charred flavor and was super moist. And their garlic fries!!! Mmmm they definitely hit the spot. Super garlicky and cheesy, generous portions. 

But hands down, their TWINKIE SHAKE!!! I love twinkies - I love shakes - I absolutely LOVE THEIR TWINKIE SHAKE!!!!!!! Highly recommend it, it's so rich and creamy and you drink tiny Twinkie chunks... yum.

Definitely a nice go-to spot for cheap burgers in the area.
author: Angelina Ariana A.

description:
If you're looking for one of the best burgers in SF, look no farther! Beeps burgers does NOT disappoint. Made to order, your burger comes out hot, juicy and dripping with goodness. The Beeps sauce is the perfect compliment. 

Today I also tried the garlic cheesy fries and OMG! I'm sure I'll be oozing garlic the rest of the day and I don't care! They are so delicious! (I've also had the onion rings. They're also ah-may-zing!)

If you've saved some room... try the Nutella milkshake. Need I say more. 

This little corner burger walk-up is charming and the staff is always friendly. Grab a seat at the communal picnic table and eat your burger while it's hot! Delish!! 

I always think I may order the crispy chicken sandwich but when I get here I just crave that delicious juicy, tender, hot burger. You got to try this place!
author: Colleen D.

description: Burger was Great! Juicy! Steak fry's! All good. Not much to look at, but they use premium meats and breads. I will definitely be back
author: Paul S.

description:
Looks can be deceiving.
I've passed by this place for years and never bothered to stop.
They make a pretty decent burger
author: Candace W.

description: This place has been around for years, I used to live in the area and my brother and I used to buy their freshly made hand cut friends for only $2.00! I think throughout the years there has been different owners but I remember their fries and burgers being great. I recently was in the area and decided to come by this place and order a burger added grilled onions and mushrooms and cheese with a side order of garlic fries, my husband ordered the chicken sandwich. The wait was not long, its a small place where you can park and eat. Our food came out pretty quick as well.  I have to say the burger was good, I mean you cannot go wrong with  a burger and the garlic fries were good as well, you can def taste the garlic. The chicken sandwich was cooked perfect, the chicken was not dry at all. All in all great place to come eat, but I am disappointed that its on the pricer side of things, all the add ons add up which is kind of an expensive burger. I wouldn't say I would go here all the time for a burger but every so often I would come back and have a burger here. The next time I come I probably would want to order a chocolate shake with my burger as I remember growing up it was pretty good. Parking is not hard since they have their own lot.
author: Tiffany K.

description: It was good. I mean I could say that's a fact. The onion rings are really good!! The seasoning they use on the grill chicken is fire! It's nice to go to a place that's better then other fast food chains especially offering onion rings!!!!!! The cheese burger was good and that beep sauce is good as well. It's definitely a must try!
author: Dorothy M.

description:
I am sooo happy with these steak fries. Even after calling-in our order and driving it home, they were hot and crispy with just the right amount of salt. 

My husband splurged and ordered the Oreo milkshake - definitely one of the better shakes we have had in the area, and made me jealous I didn't order one myself!

The burgers were basic, but good - and everything in our order was correct and thoughtfully packaged (plenty of napkins, ketchup, burgers were labeled, etc.). This is key in general, but honestly an unexpected level of detail from a side-of-the-road burger window. 

We will 100% be back!
author: Catie F.

description: Where has this been all my life? This might be the best burger in San Francisco. Easily top ten with a bullet. I shit you not. They use Niman Ranch beef and Semi-Freddie buns. The Beep sauce is delish. They have STEAK FRIES. I gotta say I'm impressed. Check it out.
author: Jay N.

description:
Beeps burger is a great place to grab a quick bite!! Burgers are tastey with delicious fries. The portions here are very generous as well. The location is also a plus since its located near Balboa Park and CCSF. I ordered the regular cheeseburger and I really enjoyed it. My only complaint was that the patty was a bit dry for me but it was good nonetheless. 

In terms of catering or eating there, seating is limited. But hey if youre in the Oceanview area or youre exhausted from a afternoon workout, feel free to come by.
author: John M.

description:
I have seen this place several times while conducting business tasks and never felt like trying it out. Due to the appearance of this place looking old and unattractive to have a meal. I was wrong and reminded to never judge a book by its cover. On 10/26 while in the area with a coworker I ended trying this place out and I do not regret it. 

I took a star off due to the limited seating area, not seeing a restroom and just the appearance and cleanness of the outer area. However, if you are willing to look over these elements you will enjoy a great meal. 

My coworker informed me their burgers were hefty, but I did not think I would think so. Once again I was wrong the burger is filling and taste just great. For being a burger joint with no elegancy this place gets pricey. I spent $20 on a burger, fires and a drink. Here is the break down: 

Turkey burger- $7 
Sweet potato fries- $4 
Pink lemonade- $2.25
Grilled mushrooms, cheese, bacon, avocado all extra- ranging from $.50 to $1.75 

I will be coming back due to the quality of the burgers but maybe will not add so many extra items so I don't feel that the I'm spending the amount of money I would spend at a higher end food joint.
author: Andre M.

description:
Its an honor, nay a privilege to be the 500 reviewer of Beep's Burger. This is a go-to spot whenever family or friend come to visit in SF.

If you enjoy any of the following: In-n-out, Habit Burget, Shake Shack then you will fully enjoy Beep's Burger. Great burger patty, excellent toasted bun, and the Beep's Sauce are just right. Usually, I need ketchup  and fries to enjoy my burger experience; however, it has happen twice that I forget both when I am enjoying my burger.
author: Abraham G.

description: Greasy messy delicious burgers. You can not go wrong trying this place, just make sure you have a ton of napkins
author: Raul S.

description:
honestly one of the best burgers ive had.
cost analysis:

the burgers themselves are super affordable.
they get you on the side dishes and toppings. a 7-8$ meal can easily turn into a 20$+ meal.

burger: great! 
fries: aren't made in-house and taste like the frozen ones 
Shakes: great as well! love the chocolate ones
author: Matthew P.

description: I have eaten here 3 times this month, the burgers are really good. I like that they post where they get there meat from, I believe it said grass feed and no hormones added. The onion rings are ok the fries are good. Service is good very polite and quick service.
author: Jimmy P.

description:
Best burger I had ever eaten.  Prices are reasonable .
Bring a friend or just yourself and enjoy it.
author: p l.

description:
I really miss this place !

The burgers were inexpensive and good quality, I'm drooling thinking about it. We also ordered a lot of slides because everything sounded so yummy. 

Onion rings were super crispy that I felt it cutting my mouth but I loved it.
Sweet potatoes were delicious but I wish they had chipotle mayo with it.
Fries were crispy and very fresh !
The 6pc mini corn dogs were crispy little wiener poppers. I couldn't stop popping them into my mouth, they were so yummy!
Jalapeno poppers had cream cheese in it and was not for my taste bud.

You can honestly taste the freshness and juiciness from the burgers and everything is super fresh! I believe everything may be made to order, because it tasted like it was.

Love,

Canadian tourist that really misses this place right now!
author: Sally W.

description:
My 1st and LAST time coming here !!!!
I'm from out of town and I was at some local bars last night and everybody recommended this place so I decided to try it earlier today and I ordered a cheeseburger with curly fries 
And the presentation of the burger was good but as soon as I took my first bite and I went for my second bite I realized the meat was red had no flavor no seasoning and I tasted more flavor from the bread than the burger itself so if you want to take a Gamble and have some for yourself go right ahead but this is what my burger looked like !
author: Eve H.

description: Whoa this place is awesome. Super friendly staff and the food was excellent. Normally a burger makes my stomach upset but all good here.  Either eat in your car or at the window. Quality is surprisingly excellent. Curly fries were perfect as were the 1/4 lb burgers. Fresh everything and well priced. Shakes are great too. Will be back for sure.
author: Danielle H.

description: Really great burgers (both vegi and beef) jap poppers and fries! Can't wait to try some of their chicken items!
author: Julianne O.

description: Cool spot, is only outside dining. They have a veggie burger & a few other veg options. Great place to chill & just have a bite to eat. Garlic fries were bomb.
author: Shakilo R.

description: My favorite Burger and chicken nuggets! The price cannot be beaten. Always responsive and fast!
author: Qichen G.

description:
I understand the price increase. They are using better beef, ground fresh. So okay, I've been eating there occasionally. 
Last time I was there, I had been diagnosed with anemia, among other things, and also losing weight. So I trade up to the half pound burger. Ordered it cooked rare, which I do like but only where I trust the meat. What I got was two quarter pound patties, each cooked very well done. 
I may go back when I get my mad calmed down and will remember to be very clear about wanting a rare burger, and will ask for my money back if they give me anything else.
author: Jane W.

description: Love this place! Yummy burgers with good steak fries! I always order ahead of time to pick up because I usually have to wait about 15-20 minutes if I show up to order around dinner time. There's only some outdoor seating, nothing inside.
author: Mandi R.

description:
Don't know why I was never taken here..their fries are damn crispy and fresh both times that I've tried. I had to wait for them to cool off! Their nuggets are also good and tastes a little less manufactured than McDonalds but they are sightly thinner. 

Really dig the private parking lot and availability of parking spaces for drive up and ordering. I'd say their Beep Burger tastes like Shake Shack lite with a nice spongy sweet bread. 

Definitely better than I expected from an old looking burger establishment.
author: Daniel C.

description: We decided to try this cute burger place. It reminds me of the retro diners in the past. I got the quarter pound Beep's burger and it was delicious. The steak fries were really fresh and hot when I got it. Did I mention the burgers are delicious? The price is pretty good for all the food!
author: Rachel M.

description: best burger in the city. I go to Beeps once a week and order quarter burger with eggs and Avocado.
author: Majid R.

description:
I've been trying to find a burger place in the city that is reminiscent of the 1:4 lb burger joints in SoCal. I was even discussing it with a guy from San Diego who knew what I was talking about...
I drove by Beep's and the neon signed screamed, STOP! Check it out... so I did... well it's exactly what I've been searching for and more! Incredible meat, excellent cheese, the buns are greasy as I imagine all of the ingredients are... I had the steak fries which were perfectly crispy and light brown...
It didn't cost an arm and a leg, just the arm but that's ok, I can do without...
I highly recommend this joint and they serve breakfast too!
author: Steve S.

description: After reading a very positive EATER review I decided to give Beeps a try. They were right. This little drive-in is a gem. Niman Ranch beef really makes a difference. Great burgers and exemplar onion rings.  Lots of chicken varieties also looked good. It really is a drive-in, with lots of stools surrounding the building. An impressive effort by the owner to re-imagine a fast food place with only top-notch ingredients. The neighborhood crowd seemed to know they were on to a good thing.
author: Lee P.

description: After some years finally got to return to this place after they revamped or new ownership.Was going to try Garaje but was lazy tonight but glad I went tonight! The burgers are BETTER! tasted and looked like they made their own patties! You get 2 options with the sauce, Mayo tasted like a garlic type sauce and the "Beeps" sauce was my fav. fries are good but not the best but combined with the cheeseburger and a DR. Pepper and oh Damn Gina!!! 4 stars since extra for cheese and price but soon fades as the burger is amazing!
author: Jay A.

description:
What a burger. 
This surpasses all the burger joints I've been to. 

Beeps serves full angus burgers at an affordable price. Each burger has basic toppings (lettuce tomato) but what makes it differ than most burger joints is the extremely juicy (*omg it was so juicy), cooked to a perfect medium rare angus 1/4 pound patty and their perfectly soft buns that absorbs all that flavor. 

There was no need for ketchup, ranch or bbq sauce to add to this burger, all that was needed was their secret sauce, which I am unable to describe as it was something I never tasted before. 

The burgers vary in price as they have patty options from 1/4 to 1/2 and from cheese to no cheese. I opted for the no cheese burger as the cheese was an extra .65 cents (cheapboyz lol) but the burger came out to be around 6 dollars, which is well worth the price considering this place serves better burgers than any artisan, gourmet burger joint out there (in my opinion). 

So don't waste your time dropping 12-15 dollars on a gourmet burger, just go to beeps and experience one of the best sandwiches you'll ever have!
author: James L.

description: What can I say...delicious food for a decent price. Not too expensive that you can't afford it either. If you are in the area and you're hungry definitely do give Beep's Burger a try. You won't be disappointed that's for sure. Burgers juicy not too big not too small right portion, garlic fries very tasty same like the ballpark garlic fries, and the fish and chips very delicious.
author: Tina L.

description: Beep's burgers is easy, delicious and the best spot to pick up a quick burger and fries on the way home from work on those nights that you don't want to cook. Everything on the menu is great, including milkshakes!
author: Cathal C.

description:
Garlic fries and cheeseburger hit the spot. 

Bomb value and so good I'm sure this place has really busy wait times. Came here Saturday at lunch at 1pm perfect. Waiting to try the Oreo milkshake next .. beep beep burger is beep beep bomb.com
author: Olivia L.

description: This place is the worst it was better when the last owner was owning better service great fud know it's not what it was I had to help her to make a milk shake she like well what do u think I was like go to this one buger place I go to they speak Chinese order thier milkshake and ask them thiers great but that's just mee. But still like thier burgers depending on who undercooking them.
author: Oso O.

description: Always good I've been to this place so many times and it's consistently delicious and good portions with premium ingredients. Love me some beeps go for the burgers or fried chicken sandwich.
author: Craig O.

description: I brought my child here last Monday. He ordered a burger, fries and chocolate shake. He liked his food and wants to come again. The remodeling of the inside and outside the building looks fresh, updated and it's well lit. They have a microphone to let you know that your order is ready. The fries and shakes are my favorite things to order here. It's not ver coward and I love it as one of the last drive up eateries in San Francisco. This place is a lifesaver for students at city college looking for lunch, dinner or a snack. You can park here in your car and wait for your order or walk it's accessible by public transit. I also ran into a childhood friend and his daughter when I came here. Beeps is part of my childhood of growing up in the City. I must visit more often. The quality of food and service remains as special and classic as Beeps has been for decades. This place is historical status and I'm glad it remains in the face of gentrification.
author: Kiana D.

description: Beep's no longer serve their pineapple shakes which used to be the highlight of the meal.  Everything else on their menu is just average so I bumped them down a star to reflect that.
author: Linda H.

description: Beep's burgers are truly delicious. They put on a spread which I believe is garlic aioli to truly make the burger flavorful. They give a nice portion of fries. They are really on the pricy side though. I paid about 42 dls for two burgers three fries and three drinks, so keep price in mind when coming here. Is it worth the price? I guess so, because of the taste and size of the burgers. The 1/2 lb burger is huge.
author: Lucia Z.

description: Wow I was literally at the McDonald's up the street and for  fries a McChicken and a double cheeseburger it came out to 970. I paid a dollar more at this place and got a way better meal. The quality of the meat is perfect and the fries we're so good and fresh out the fryer. I'm not the biggest fan of steak fries but for a cold chilly night like today this hit the spot. Definitely bookmarking this place. Will be a repeat customer for sure
author: Moath I.

description: I've been on a burger binge recently and Beep's has been a place I've been wanting to try out for just an old-school, nothing-fancy type burger.  I finally went last week and ordered the 1/4 Beep cheeseburger and it really hit the spot.  It's just your usual components of a burger with a  beef patty, cheese, lettuce, onions, tomatoes and pickles but everything was fresh and wasn't poorly constructed so it tasted great.  The bun was sweet and soft, but didn't break apart from the grease of the burger.  The fries were warm and crunchy with large portions.  For a cheeseburger and fries, it ended up being a little over $10 which is more than reasonable.  I can see why this burger joint has been around for such a long time.
author: David C.

description: I liked the fish and chips more than the burger, but the Twinkie milkshake was the most dreamy and memorable. I would go back for the milkshake alone.
author: B. C.

description:
Straight to the point burger joint. 

Who needs to pay premium prices for a good burger?

Extensive menu from burgers, fries, chicken nuggets and etc

Love the old school vibe. I just hope beeps doesn't close cause of the new condos building on ocean ace! Support your local!! 

Just FYI it's outdoor so if you are going to eat there wear a coat!

Get the fries---curly fries are soo good

Burgers were good but I still prefer in & out!
author: Carol Y.

description: Awesome burgers and chicken strips. No indoor seating only a few stools but its nice to watch the busy street. Watch out for the homeless though, one guy smelled so bad almost ruined my meal. Root beer floats a must.
author: Lori H.

description:
We live next to Beep's Burgers and we've tried their burgers twice already (take away)! 
I love their 1/4lb one (perfect size for me :-)). The steak cut fries are my fave too.  Meat is really tasty and well cooked. Fries are crispy as you'd expect them to be :-)
My husband chose the veggie burger and the potato wedges and was very happy with it too. 
The service was very friendly and quick. This place may become a classic for us ;-)
author: Caroline P.

description: great burger and fries, only problem is no indoor seating, last time we were there it was super windy, just pulled up the hoody, put on a beanie and enjoyed the meal.
author: Jane D.

description: It was later in the evening and the kids were asking for burgers and fries. The hubs and I didn't wanna do another UberEats McDonalds delivery so we opted to give Beeps a try since a few deliver services have them as an option. We weren't expecting much so we were pleasantly surprised when we got our order. The kids loved their cheeseburgers and curly fries. My husband and I were impressed with the size of the sandwiches. I ordered a chicken sandwich and my husband got a double cheeseburger with the works. We will definitely be ordering from them again.
author: Michi C.

description:
I miss the old Beep's Burger, straight from the Go Beep's Burger
At reasonable price Beep's Burger, could change your life Beep's Burger
I hate the new Beep's Burger, the gentrified Beep's Burger
The always expensive Beep's Burger, disrespect the OG Beep's Burger
I miss the sauce from Beep's Burger, the tasty wedges from Beep's Burger
I gotta say, at that time I'd like to meet the owners of Beep's Burger
See, I was a customer of Beep's Burger, not this new style Beep's Burger
And now I look and look around and there's a whole new different Beep's Burger
I used to love Beep's Burger, I used to love Beep's Burger
I even brought my good friends over to try Beep's Burger
What if Beep's Burger made a burger without the special sauce Called "The 1/4 Burger"? Man, that'd be so Beep's Burger
That's all it was Beep's Burger, we still love Beep's Burger
But this new Beep's Burger ain't nothing like the old Beep's Burger
author: Pablo B.

description:
Hi! I regularly come to this location on Ocean and typically the burgers are on point delicious and taste great! Fries are great as well since we usually for the fam and get the steak cut and curly fries. My favorite item hands down is the Nutella milkshake...amazing!

Yesterday though was horrible. I called in my order of a 1/2 pound Beep's Burger with avocado, steak cut fries and a small nutella milkshake. I was told it would be ready in 5 min.5 min later I got there. Got to the order window, paid my $21+ dollars and waited on the side. I waited for 10min after and asked about my order... the girl with dark brown hair with glasses on her head rudely said "I did not call you." I then waited another 5 min and went back to the pick-up window. I asked where my order was, and reminded her that i had ordered over the phone. She asked me if I had already paid and I said yes. She told me she had to ask the cashier to verify I had paid. I left the window and went to my stool to look up the transaction on my cell phone. I showed the girl the bank transaction at which point she then replied rudely again, "I didnt say I dont believe you. Here is your order. Here."

Again, I have never had any issues with any employee there but this person was disrespectful, rude, and made me feel unwanted there.
author: Joel L.

description: Their burger is one of the best I ever ate! Really really good! Don't forget to try their strawberry and Nutella milkshake, it's delicious! I have other burger options next to my house, but I rather drive 15 minutes to go to Beep's. I highly recommend it!
author: Amanda M.

description: My favorite place to eat when I lived in the city and now when I visit. Don't ever change Beep's, I mean not too much, but you are great lol
author: Elle E.

description:
Pictures are deceiving because the 1/4 lb burger looks way smaller in the picture I posted than in real life. Upon reading some of the mixed reviews, I was hesitant to come here, but my friend wanted to try it, so I obliged.

TLDR: delicious burgers, even better fries!!

THE BURGER WAS DELICIOUS. It was, I think, $6.35 for a 1/4 pound cheeseburger, which is fair for San Francisco pricing. In n Out is what.. $3? But it's also further out in Daly City, and a chain.

I got the Beep's burger which meant that it comes with their house sauce - I didn't really detect the taste of it, though I saw some orange, so I'll need to ask for more next time. Initially it looked pretty underwhelming as the bun top wasn't fluffy (this ain't a nice gourmet sit-down!) but they do use a good quality Semifreddo brand bread (a brioche?).
Fresh vegetable toppings (tomato, BUTTER lettuce(?), not the cheap iceberg shit that oxidizes hella fast, and onion)
The patty itself was perfectly grilled to a juicy, oily, meaty medium level and it was the perfect ratio of toppings, bread, and meat in one bite. Not too messy and very hearty, so I didn't feel 'ripped off' with the portion and quality. Definitely got a good 8 bites out of it or so - a good small dinner.

NOW.. even though this place is called Beep's BURGERS, their criss-cut fries are the best I've had! I'm fairly certain they don't use fresh potatoes for these, but they were extremely light, extremely crispy (haven't seen a crisp like this at a fast food joint), and not too oily. How the hell do y'all prep and cook these? I NEED TO KNOW!

A very solid place if you're in the area hankerin' for some good burgers and fries!!
author: Emily C.

description: Wow super delicious and simple burgers!!!! Order by weight, add the fried of choice and you get the best burger you had in ages.
author: Mathias Z.

description:
Ordered 1/2 pound burger with swiss cheese n Garlic Steak Fries. 
Food was a pleasant surprise.  
Burger - Meat taste like meat..Little too oily for my taste. Not juicy but oily. 
Swiss cheese not the highest quality more on the cheap side.
Bun was soft not crumbly n grilled on one side which holds the ingredients well not soggy.
.
.
Garlic Fries 
Definitely taste the garlic.  Better than expected.
author: Hungry K.

description: This is the closest burger to shake shack in nyc, so yummy. The bun they use is great! It can take a while to get your food so I wouldn't stop if I was in a hurry but it's definitely worth a try if you love burgers.
author: Ravina Y.

description: What a cute little drI've in, it saved the day when we were hungry but didn't really want to go for a sit down dinner, and then we went back for breakfast the next morning. All was delicious!
author: Terree S.

description:
for what it is, is PERFECT!
Good burger and fries. The latest owner really stepped up the game. Fixed the neon light, and made the food much better. Great place.
author: davide c.

description:
This place is the worse. I ordered a vegetarian burger and they gave me meat and bacon. I brought the burger back and they didn't not even apologize!!
Thy remade the burger, but the experience I had was not any better after I came back, I will not recommend this place, people who work here are a hustle
author: Ale B.

description: Will definitely be back again. I gave the bacon cheeseburger an 8/10 because bread fluffiness is important in burger construction to me. The meat is the main show while the bread needs to be a good supporting actress - don't steal the show, be a complementary. I felt the bread was slightly too dense and chewy for my preference. That being said, I liked the kind service, prices, and options. I would like to try other things in the menu too! 4 out of 5 stars but keep it up!!!
author: Carina L.

description: This place has great food - from the burgers to the crispy chicken sando and chicken strips, I have never been disappointed! I'm definitely going to miss this place when I move out of the area.
author: Jackie L.

description: Yum! Great burgers. Cool spot. Chicken sandwich is lovely with the coleslaw. Good garlicky garlic fries. I like this place. Not suuuuper fast but is super good quality.
author: R M.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever had in my life! This place is amazing! I took someone special out last week and we drove all the way from Woodland CA to come eat here! (about an hour and half drive) I was skeptical at first. Looks like your average whole in a wall burger joint on a corner in the big city but I'm glad I tried it. The service is subpar they could definitely step that up a bit BUT the burger is just soooooo amazing I had to still give them 5 stars! I will definitely be visiting SF weekly and I will be eating here as long as they are around.
author: Tommy P.

description:
OH GLORY!!

I've driven past Beep's for so many years, hesitant to try it until now, but man oh man, the burgers here are drool worthy. From their juicy patty to the crisp lettuce to the super smooth almost perfect bun and their sauce. I don't know what their sauce is, I can't even comprehend the magic. I honestly have no idea how to describe it. So definitely get their 1/4lb or 1/2lb Beeps burger! Add some bacon and yesssss 

The only con though is ordering the sides, portions are small for the price, but no biggy. 

PARKING: private lot, always spaces available 

PRICES: very reasonable and affordable! 

SERVICE: they're very nice and quick; and they call out your name on a microphone so you can actually sit in your car while you wait (it's usually cold in that area hahah)
author: Vivian S.

description: We got the 1/4 LB Beep burger, Steak Fries and the Crispy chicken sandwich! SOOOOOO good. Only thing was we wished the sandwich had a little sauce on it but other then that it was amazing. One of my favorite burger joints in the city.
author: Samantha K.

description: One of the best burgers in SF! Classic old school burgers and amazing steak fries. Only wish there was more parking.
author: Mike K.

description: A top burger choice in San Francisco, and a fun drive-by spot to stop and eat outside. Juicy! I like the shakes, too.
author: Captain C.

description:
I've been to Beep's Burgers a few times as my son's school is around the corner.  We've gone here on special occasions when it's just the two of us.  I've ordered the burger and it was really good.  My son enjoyed his hot dog and fries too.  But you have to get the swirly ice cream which is deinfitely a hit.

Casual spot with great food.  FYI, if you're looking for a place to sit it'll be outside.
author: Blake B.

description: Very expensive for a drive up diner. I have been to Beep's in the past and it's always been a go to for the quick value meal on the go. I felt rushed by the cashier while ordering my meal which was also annoying cause I'm trying to wrap my head around this new menu. I really wanted to give them a good review but as of now they have 2 stars it can go up or down I'm waiting on my meal.... After getting my meal my rating stands 2 stars but for rushed not rude service and over priced food. Proper pricing would've went a long way. The service I can deal with.
author: Weyland W.

description: I love Beeps! I have never received anything from here that I have been unhappy with my go to order is a beeps burger with garlic tater tots and it never disappoints.
author: Alexander D.

description:
Sometimes you want a high end burger.  Sometimes you just want a simple old school burger.  Beep's is for the latter.

Simple & solid.  The fries are steak cut, so I order the curly fries because I'm a skinny fry girl.  They make pineapple milkshakes.  There are actually little bits of pineapple in the shake!  It is this, not the burger, that I love here.

Definitely the nice price.  My man has picked up for us twice after I called in our order.  2 cheese burgers, 2 orders of fries, 1 pineapple shake...all totaled?  Somewhere around $15.  Yep.  Very nice.

It's a classic drive in.  I hear it's usually packed w students.  Bare bones, nothing fancy.  Not a noteworthy burger, but definitely solid & hearty fare.  

The young lady that took my phone orders was great.  She didn't rush me, & was actually nice.  I like that.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
WHHHHHHAAAT

Perfect place to go to after a night out drinking. Want some comfort starchy food? Having the munchies?

This. Is. The. Perfect. Place.

Just a store literally on the street, the seating is limited, and the place looks run down, but that's why it's so loveable. The wait staff are all very nice, even though they're working the late shift. The food also comes out pretty fast. Everyone ones in a while you'll see someone dressed in sweatpants driving in, getting their food and getting out, clearly venturing out for some comfort food while binge watching TV episodes at home.

In terms of food quality, the fish and chips at this place is awesome. The fries served Hot, and cut thick. There aren't extra salt or any bullshit like that, nor are there burnt corners--just pure potato fries, served thick with lots of potato inside, and just the right amount of crispness--not too hard and not too soft. The fish pieces were large, chunky pieces of fish, with and nice crispy exterior. On the side, they even give you loads of vinegar, tartar sauce, and ketchup.

Nothing beats fish and chips with crazy amounts of sauce. Nothing!

Or maybe it was the drinking before that made this all taste so good. Who knows?
author: Henry L.

description:
Good (not great) independent burger joint. It's a long-time staple for SF known for their large Hamburgers with a variety of French Fries, but also serve a few other diner style dishes.

They serve a "House Sauce" on some burgers which is tasty, but too garlicy for me plus they poured too much of it on the burger making it a bit soggy as opposed to juicy.  This took away from the seemingly good taste of the freshly prepared beef patty. Try it! You might love it. For me, not worth the extra bucks they charge. Great, friendly, efficient staff!!!
author: A V.

description: The bomb hamburger and onion rings.  Loved it.  Was a bit pricey though.  But I'm a sucker for a good burger.  Try this place out.
author: Pono A.

description:
Decent Burger.

The prices are a bit elevated for the what you get.

A 1/2 burger (which is a double), sweet potato fries, and coke was $16!

It's just a bit much for a burger stand, with no indoor seating.
author: mike y.

description:
They're a little pricey but worth it. These are good burgers and shakes. Their garlic fries are tasty, too. 
Their veggie burger, though, is nothing special.  It's good, but it's your average garden burger.  This is definitely overpriced, but not ridiculously so. 
I would definitely recommend this restaurant if those looking for a good burger.
author: Malcolm G.

description: The have a terrific fat boy chocolate shake. The garlic fries are extremely garlicky, but delicious. They have funnel cake fries that I want to try next.
author: Ha D.

description:
When I was a little girl, I always wanted to come to Beep's Burgers for their milkshakes. Leave it to my mom to shoot down any of my requests. *le sigh*

"Aiya, it's too expensifey...", she would say.

In my mom's eyes, anything over $1 for a drink and $4 for a meal was "expensifey" so we rarely ate out unless she was using a B1G1 free coupon. If you ever see an older Chinesey lady dressed like Peg Bundy with electric blue eyeliner and hooker red lips at Olive Garden in Stonestown, that's my mom...and next to her, you will find her bag filled with [endless] breadsticks. =/

25 eons later, Mr. NSS, Tater Tot, and I were passing through and decided to stop by Beep's for a quick bite since I saw they had one lone picnic table available (plus 4 counter seats). Come with patience as I learned this is not a place for a "quick bite". I was third in line to order and it took over 25 minutes to receive our order. At least Tater Tot got a nice bootie sniffing session with Rufus, an adorable chocolate lab puppy. Another customer who placed an order over the phone was quite irate when he was quoted 5 minutes but had to wait an additional 20 minutes.  

From what I read Beep's has changed owners several times since their inception in the 1960s. It's now Asian-owned so in addition to burgers (beef, salmon, turkey), sandwiches, fish & chips, corn dogs, chicken nuggets, shakes, they have teriyaki rice plates on the menu. Everything is reasonably priced under $8. CC's accepted. 

I ordered the ¼ Pounder Basket w/ cheese ($5.40 +.35) and Mr. NSS ordered Fish & Chips ($5.95) http://bit.ly/1EAD8x0. We also ordered 6 Mini Corn Dogs ($2.40?). 

Maybe we came on an off day but we found the food to be less than subpar and I wasn't expecting much either. 

My burger patty felt like it was flattened one too many times with a metal spatula. It was as thin as the tomato slices, overcooked, and very dry. Together with a heaping amount of iceberg lettuce, and a huge untoasted bun, all I could taste was the bun and lettuce. The special sauce was like a sweet & sour sauce which gave it an Asian flair that I personally didn't care for. Next time, I would ask for ketchup and mustard only. At this price point, J. Georgie's on San Bruno Avenue makes a much better old-skool burger: http://www.yelp.com/biz/jim-georgies-donuts-san-francisco. 

The mini corn dogs were overfried so the batter was cracked and was very hard. Another Yelper had mentioned that the hot dog texture was between a pencil eraser and a hot dog. I have to agree the texture was really weird; like funky mystery meat.

I'm a skinny fries girl but the steak fries were really good here. Crunchy around the edges and soft on the inside. Lightly salted. It was the best thing we had that day. 

I'm hoping our lackluster experience was just a fluke. There's no shortage of yipster spots with booty raping prices in SF so it's nice to see SF institutions like Beep's still alive and well.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I like the kind of burgers that remind me of warm summer barbeques, and this place has them! I usually get the 1/4 burger or the 1/4 beep's burger (with preference for the latter recently). It's pretty average sized, but filling, and a good $6-$7. What I like about the beep's burger is the beep's sauce, which sort of tastes like cheesy garlic mayo. The patties are juicy, the lettuce is fresh, and the buns are perfectly slightly crispy around the edges (that's a weird detail to include, I know). I've ordered their fries, steak fries, garlic fries and curly fries too. I wish there was some kind of combination deal, but it's all separate. Anyway, I'm a fan!
author: Sarah L.

description:
There's only 2 remaining old school drive-in places in the city, Whiz Burgers (corner @18th and South Van Ness) which is older (since 1955), and Beep's Burgers (since 1962). In terms of food, Beep's easily beats Whiz for quality and price. Overall, I give it 3.5 stars.

According to old rumors, both had carhop service back in the 60s. And also both places had multiple ownership changes. A newspaper article mentions that Beep's current owner is Samantha W., a former regular customer when she was a student at SFSU, now working to preserve this piece of SF history.

I love the crispy steak fries!!
I also like the milkshakes, but I didn't get one this time.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beeps-burgers-san-francisco#2ZEq6fA7N97gJwqfvfNBoQ

The burgers are okay. They put a unique secret sauce inside (passed down from the original owners, part of SF history, I've been told). It's sweet and orange, probably a ketchup mixture but it's not thousand island. It's not the best burger in the city but decent enough and satisfying for the price. In comparison, Bullshead Restaurant (a favorite of mine, in West Portal) uses a much better meat burger patty, but their burgers also cost a bit more. I crave the fries far more than the burger, so I got the combo.

Tips:

About the long waiting time...
It takes at least 8 minutes to fully cook a regular burger patty. Most fast food chains (McD's, BK, etc.) use a custom cooking press to cook their burgers on both sides at the same time, so that's why they're faster.

There's only 1 table on the side of this restaurant. People who drove here can eat inside their cars, and walking customers can use the metal counter surrounding the restaurant.
author: Luis C.

description:
Beep's looks a bit run-down, but don't be fooled. This little burger shack is way above average, especially their fried chicken sando. They use good Acme rolls and quality veg on everything, which makes all the difference. I don't mind paying the higher price for the consistent quality. Loves me some Beeps.

Pro tip: the FCS comes with a delicious, not-mayo-based slaw, which I love. But when I started asking them to put mayo on the bun, that created perfection in my book. Also, they have Crystal hot sauce in little to-go cups if you want to Nashville that sando up.
author: Jason M.

description: Don't pass them up, real good, authentic savory burgers, just had the garlic fries for the first time too and didn't regret it one bit. Easy top 2 of my favorite burger joints. Staff is super chill and helpful too.
author: Adam M.

description: If I had the option to give them 0 stars I would. Today I ordered a veggie burger and an incompetent Beep's burgers employee served me a regular burger. She didn't even realize the gravity of her mistake or make any effort to make me feel better about HER GIGANTIC mistake. I have never experienced such a terrible dining experience in my life.
author: CarlaGiselle S.

description: Excellent Burger Place for taking out!! The burgers smell very good. 1/4 lb got me pretty full already. Garlic fries are the killer not too garlicky but salty enough for you to enjoy!! It would be nice if they have combo like drink+burger+fries and some discount. Love It
author: Jee P.

description:
I read that the burgers were better a year ago but I was pretty happy with my food when I went a few nights ago. 

I got the 1/2 pound burger with cheese, grilled mushrooms, and an egg. They forgot the cheese but I think it is because I was talking really fast and my bf's burger was really customized. I didn't mind too much.

I thought it was juicy and moist (I hate that word but it works). Overall very good. A little messy but that's how I like my food. The fries aren't bad either!

I will be going back many times I'm sure! Stop by if you are in the area. It's a nice local joint I'm glad to have in my neighborhood.
author: Cicely T.

description:
If you're feeling lonely, tired,
  anxious , calm 
republican, democratic , 
wealthy, or poor,
Just have a "BEEPS BURGER "and life is 
GREAT. 
The best burgers around. 
Kmac
author: Kenny M.

description:
Awesome burgers, adorable "storefront," reasonable prices.

These burgers are my favorite in SF.  Simple, old fashioned, perfectly cooked, and affordable (about $5.00).  They are like the ideal combination of In-N-Out and Shake Shack.  The 1/4 pound burger patty is thin, crispy on the outside/edges, and juicy on the inside like Shake Shack.  It is clearly homemade and hand-formed.  The bun is more substantial than Shake Shack, more like In-N-Out, but still soft like Shake Shack.  The Beep's sauce is good, but I could go either way on that versus mayo.  The veggie toppings - lettuce, tomato, and pickles - are all fresh and good-quality.

The whole dill pickle side dish is surprisingly tasty.  Way better than the version you can buy at the movie theater.  Chilled, crispy, and fresh-tasting. The curly fries are enjoyable but not necessarily revelatory.

I love the old fashioned signage and styling.  I'll definitely keep coming back and supporting them.  I really hope they do well with all the new development going up around them and that it helps them rather than squashes them!
author: Tay H.

description:
The burgers are so juicy! This is definitely my favorite burger place so far. Beeps sauce I wasn't too much of a fan of since I don't like pickles (it has a hint of pickles in it) but even with the sauce, the burger was still ridiculously good. I recommend the half pound with Swiss cheese.

The area is super cute. I would totally come here for a casual lunch with a buddy or two. Next time, I'm trying the Twinkie shake ;)
author: Tran N.

description: Turkey burger - nicely seasoned, soft bun, crisp lettuce and tomato. French fries nice and crispy. We will definitely be back to try the new Beep's again when in the neighborhood.
author: Rey E.

description: They changed menu up since I came here last. 1/2lbs burger was huge, but super tasteful in every bite, think it was a brioche bun, well seasoned and sized patties, everything fresh -- def a pleasant surprise. The Twinkie shake was a first for me, it was really good.
author: John O.

description: A gem in the neighborhood. Excellent burgers. The area looks sketchy but thats only because some of us seems to have forgotten how to leave in middle-class population.
author: Franck M.

description:
As a local, who was raised on ocean avenue, I'm deeply saddened by the recent changes to beeps. This place will always have a special place in my heart, unfortunately these days it's only because of its nostalgic value. 

Ownership changed a couple years ago. At first they made modest changes to the menu, that was okay. It wasn't quite the same, but they got higher quality meat I guess, which I'm all for. 

Yesterday I went to beeps for the first time in a few months to find out that they no longer had the cheese steak. Seriously the best thing on the menu for the last 20 years that I've been going to beeps. That was disappointing. 

So I ordered a burger instead. Wtf y'all?! I know the city is becoming gentrified and there's a whole foods across the street that used to be a crappy auto parts store. But that burger was the most pathetic attempt to be a gourmet burger I've ever witnessed. Just because the block is changing doesn't mean you have to try so hard. Special seasoning and wannabe aioli type shit isn't gonna be popular forever, it's a trend. Once you've added that component, your no longer a drive thru burger spot. Your a trendy attempt to grab hipster dollars. As you may have realized, that business model typically does not last. 

The only reason I gave beeps 3 stars is because of nostalgia, which is now fading into a distant memory of what San Franciscan culture was. 

I sincerely hope you bring back the cheesesteak and knock it off with the crappy "attempted gourmet" sauce/seasonings. That shit won't be popular forever. However classic American food at a drive in, will always has a place in our local economy. Sincerely- A
author: adrian s.

description: Bomb. Idk how else to describe the cheeseburger. Not sure how they get the burger so juicy and I love how they use cheddar cheese on it. The Beep sauce tastes like raisin canes sauce so that's good too.
author: Barb T.

description: Their burgers rival In-N-Out and their onion rings are amazing. Staff is decent; not overly friendly or rude. It's a bit on the pricey side and they charge extra for additional toppings.
author: Mo S.

description:
I've passed by Beep's many times now, mostly on the way to Hawaiian Drive Inn...but today, I decided to switch it up. Pulled into the lot and ordered a 1/4 pounder with fries and I was not disappointed.

The burger is succulent and juicy. It had a bit of a teriyaki bite to it too...sweet, yet savory. They top each burger with fresh sliced onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and pickles. It's classic and totally delicious! The fries are steak fries...not my fave (I'm a shoestring type of girl) but I have to commend them because their fries were delivered piping hot. They were crunchy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside - just the way a thick cut fry should be. It could have used a little more seasoning though.

All in all, good lunch.

I'll definitely be back to see what else Beep's has to offer...and to try this pineapple shake people are talking about....!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Beep's Burgers was an unexpected pleasure but it wasn't great.  lots of eats to choose from.
just went for the namesake.

eats: 1/4# burger(5.75) ordered med. rare, wasn't. seemed near medium.
-juicy, tender, a little flavor, nice soft bun.
-lots of lettuce, a tomato slice or 2, condiments not noticeable, probably present,
-wasn't great, better than average.
3.5 stars

crumbs:
-prices higher than when cherylynn reviewed it in february.
-not a destination, definitely better than McD.
author: Victor G.

description: The best fish sandwich. I'm from the Georgia and it's pretty close. Very quick service even at 12:50pm/lunch crowd. I love this place
author: Bray B.

description:
Fried Chicken burger was fantastic. Bun was toasted and soft. The coleslaw was out of this world! Only complaint is pricing! I spent $20 on a burger, fries, and shake. Beware - if you fancy nutella and Oreos in your large sized shake, be prepared to pay $9 for it!

BTW to the person that mentioned there is always parking - try going there any day after 5 pm. I can guarantee you will not get a spot anywhere nearby ;)
author: Ishan P.

description:
Hands down the best burger I've had that wasn't home-cooked in years. I've been going to this place a ton since discovering it recently. They are super consistent, friendly accurate service, and handle phone-orders very well.

The meat on their burgers actually has a TON of flavor and is seasoned perfectly. It's also never overcooked, default is somewhere between medium and medium-well. They remind me of what Murder/Redrum Burger in Davis used to be 10+ years ago when they were still really good. 

Also all their fries are amazing, garlic, criss-cut, regular, all great.

You can also get a great crispy chicken sandwich, with perfectly cooked juicy chicken breasts.
author: John A.

description: My 7 year old and I agree- great burgers! Crispy chicken sandwich a good choice, and fries are nice and crispy. This is a nearby place, with a famous neon sign (but why is pointing the wrong direction?) and we want to go here more often.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Beeps Beeps like the Road Runner Beep Beep.
Ah, the Best Tasting Burger Ever!!
Heavenly at a price I couldnt believe. Under 4 Bucks.
McDonalds never stood a chance.

I use to go to CCSF for many years. I only ate there twice, and it was that good. Memories lasted me with satisfied cravings.

Today I happen to be on Ocean so excitedly I peddled my bicycle to the Best tasting burger ever.

Theres a fine girl with a ring ginourmouse enough to let yall know.
I noticed the new larger than life menue.

Eveey item is noticeable and legible in a categlory of its own.
But those Fish and chip, cozy value combos and Chinese food has been whipe away with their ne upgrades. 

But Im here for the Biggest Juicy Burger Ever!!
The Dream days are gone, inevitable with the overpriced new houses.
Im here for 1 reason only, the need to satufy mt Craving for their ridiculously delicious Burger!!

Ordered the Bigest one-Half pound! Havnt seen a half pound since Fudruckers.
at 3bucks more than the Quarter pounder, fit-Lets see if this half pound is equally as memorable.
I saw garlic fries so I ordered it without hesitation.

Order comes, employees happy-good sign.
Fries smelled good. 2 minutes later, no smell no flavor, just lots of grease. Looks better than it taste.
YOU CANT SERVE GARLIC FRIES without Big Fresh Chunks of Garlic.

So there lies my Burger in a small Box. At first glance the one thing that Stands out is Real Big Deli melted Cheddar Slice cheese.
The top of the bun looks flaen and dead.
As I pick it up and out of he box, golden tips of meat patty, and big fresh lettuce fan out and juices start to gush.
I take a deep breath and take my first Reunied Bite and ...
OMG
The great taste has now taken me to a heaven far in existant than I have ever known!!

Burger is Spectacular!! Juicy and packed with flavor. Theres a taste of Bacon in every bite. I lift off the bun to analize the patty. All I see is Melted delicious Cheddar Cheese covering chuncky surfaces.
Whatever the secret is, its working.
I cant describe how great the taste is.

This place is now up to competiting with my Irish Bacon Burger Craving from Fiddlers Green.

The Pepsi stool takes me back to the 80s.

In the words of the great Terminator.."I'll be Back!"
Looking forward to the pinaple shake i read about.
Wonders if this new management will make a pina colada or avacado shake?;)

Like the tunes outside. Nice selection of classic 80s.
author: Hung L.

description: The cheese burgers were so fresh and tasty. Perfectly cooked with soft, dense and airy buns. Their garlic fries are a definite yes!
author: Candice G.

description:
New owner, new food, yes it's way better!
Steak fries are great - cooked just enough and not crispy like they should be for a steak fry. I had the burger and I have to say it was pretty good as well. They have all these bowl options now - teriyaki,etc which are better healthy options for sure.
author: Tere C.

description:
Really good, fresh ingredients = really good food. Usual order consists of crispy chicken sandwich, onion rings, and a chocolate cone. The chicken sandwich is superb -- natural white-meat chicken with a nice crispy crust with a spicy (non-Mayo) slaw and very bread from Acme. The ice cream also seems really home made. The onion rings are good because they're onion rings but if I'm going to get nit-picky I'd say they're a little expensive for the size of the order and still oily. 

I like the retro look of the place. Would recommend more seating.
author: Marloes S.

description: A perfect place to get food out of the usual way. Has an old school diner feel, but with no inside seating. You drive up, park, order on the window, pick up at the other window and either on the bar stools or in your car sit and enjoy the deliciousness here. My husband and I ordered turkey burgers coz I was badly craving a good turkey burger and have to say, the burger here was soul satisfying. The turkey patty was a little bit salty but overall a damn good burger. Woke up next morning thinking about it. We also got the curly fries with the chicken nuggets and they were perfect, curly fries were flavorful and fried right, crunchy n yet mushy. Great prices too. Will definitely go back.
author: Subhadra D.

description: The best place in town for burgers! They have changed the owners and have improved the quality of their meat! I love their fries too. The wait is reasonable and the service is good. Small seating area on site (a bench) if you want to enjoy burger immediately while it's hot.
author: Kerry K.

description: This just might become my favorite burger place in San Francisco. The meat is so juicy. You need to pay extra for all the good ingredients like mushrooms, avocados, bacon, cheese, grilled onion, eggs, and jalapenos. I always want to put all those ingredients in my burger, but there is no way that would all fit. But besides building your perfect burger, you can also choose a crazy variety of fries to go with your meal. I like the crisscut, but I love the garlic and funnel fries. And their milkshakes are also super thick. This place is awesome!
author: Binh P.

description:
I was looking for the perfect place to get some fast food on Ocean and this was it. Much better than McDonald's! I got the Philly cheesesteak and it was pretty good, but there was this gross looking white gooey stuff(cheese?) that just fell off the side. The beef was good with some bell peppers. It was 7.50 without tax. The menu has a lot to choose from like hamburgers, fish and chips, chicken sandwich, fish sandwich, etc. I love the menu and the prices are decent too. I will remember Beep's Burgers. 

This restaurant has a nice young owner who bought the restaurant in 2014. She used to go to Beep's with her friends while a student at SFSU. She was in banking for 5 years before she decided to own this restaurant. Good luck!
author: Denise C.

description:
It saddens me to write this, because I used to LOVE Beep's burger.

Beep's used to be a nice little down-to-earth burger joint, where all walks of life will stop by and enjoy their burgers because they had huge values for their prices. For about the same price as a McDonald's Double Quarter Pounder Meal, you get a infinitely superior Beep's 1/2 lb Burger with hearty fries. Sure, it's minus the drink you'd get at McD's. But who's looking to get sugared up these days? Beep's burgers weren't gourmet, sure. Perhaps bought their patties frozen elsewhere (though, if true, they were damn good pre-made patties), who knows? But the value drew people to Beep's. You never feel cheated or ripped off when you leave.

And all that have ended last month or so. Just yesterday I've came to Beep's burger after a month long trip oversea.

Now, I'm not sure if this was due to a new owner or not. The burger patties had changed to the somewhat loose kind, the kind you get at those fancier hip burger joints. Which's fine, I do enjoy those. But what's unforgivable is that the good old 1/2 lb Burger has had a HUGE price jump from $6.75 with fries included, to $8.00 WITHOUT fries. And what I get instead is a burger with those loose patties, fancy thousand island looking sauce, and what looked like artisan buns. Oh, and NO fries.

The same thing have happened to other items on the menu as well. Bottom line is that you're now more or less paying the restaurant price for burgers at a road side joint. The value had been utterly destroyed at Beep's burger. Perhaps whoever runs the place now is looking to attract the hipster crowd that frequent the Whole Food store across the street. But it doesn't appear to work out well for Beep's, for obvious reasons. I was there this Friday at the time of this review. It was during dinner time, I barely see anybody there picking up their orders. I did, however see a few people looking at the new price listed on the window and then turned away. Or perhaps I was there during the wrong hour?

Look, I'm not against the whole hipping up the place. I even think their new 8 dollar 1/2 lb burger was pretty good (not nearly good enough to worth 8 bucks without fries, though). But name those new fancy burgers Beep's Gourmet Special Burger or something. And leave the good old fair priced 1/2 and 1/4 burgers on the menu for those of us who came for the value year after year. The same folks who gave Beep's their reputation to begin with.
author: Dan S.

description:
Burgers are getting carried away with some going for more than a hundred dollars, and yet I've found that spending more for ground beef (even when it's ground steak) topped with any of a ridiculous number of vegetables and other accoutrement are generally not good burgers, just expensive.   Brioche may have its merits, but on a burger it's usually stiff, covered with grease from the grill and not very soft.   Brioche also holds up poorly, often dumping much of the burger onto your plate well before you've finished with it.  Sour dough takes so much crushing power to tear off, the burger is often smashed out of the bun before making it to your mouth.

Sometimes Tradition is a virtue.

If I wanted to improve the Beeps burger, I'd use a sesame bun, as they use a basic hamburger bun without the seeds.  But that's it.  I compare Beeps to places similar, from It's Tops to Cable Car Burgers (on California) and Grubstake Diner, not the sit-down restaurants that tend to go for silly burgers that add junk to justify the inflated price.

I order burgers these days without the veggies, at least on the first visit, until I know what sort of bun they're using.  I also try to order American Cheese, although I'd never eat it in any other context.  Medium, not rare, but they usually come well done.  Didn't even have to ask about the medium, and American cheese was available here.  Pale pink center on a hot patty;  lightly seasoned full beef flavor;  soft warm bun.  Perfect.  One of the very best burgers I've had;  surpassing Burger Meister, which is very good, and possibly even Smash Burger (although this is more of a fast food chain-level burger) which means it's better than In N Out (again, also a chain burger but not like the BIG meat-product burger corporations)

I only had the burger so I can't comment on how the fries are.   Didn't take very long either.   If you're in the City College/Ocean Ave.  area, and want a burger, this is your best shot for a real burger that could be a standard for the form.
author: Paul T.

description:
When it comes to the food and shakes, bar none it's one of the best spots in the city. The prices have gone up since way back in the day but that's to be expected. 
Minus one star for the service. I know the place can get busy but I've seen it busier on Friday evening compared to 3:00 pm on a Monday afternoon, where the person in the window didn't even acknowledge us for a few minutes (a "Hi, I'll be right with you" would have been decent) and when I asked if the place served BLTs the person taking our order said no. Hmm, the place has bread, bacon, tomatoes and lettuce. Seriously? I was very close to ordering a burger with no burger and a side of bacon.
Although the service lacked the food has always been amazing per the usual.
author: J C.

description:
Excellent roadside/diner style burger! The bun they use is a perfect choice, nice buttery fluff

I wish it was like $1 cheaper than what it is but for having a San Francisco address it's still pretty cheap. Definitely recommend to stop by for a quick bite
author: John T.

description: Their crispy chicken sandwich, curly fries and onion rings are all awesome! They do it right everytime!
author: T L.

description:
Bumping it up to 5 stars-the burgers have been consistently great!

The mini corn dogs awesome.

Nice people and clean drive in. A little $$$ but the quality is super high - bun, burger, veg and bacon, free parking.
author: Rocco B.

description: Tuesday was going to be my second time buying food from Beeps and I had the nastiest experience ever! I was refused service because apparently I made an employee feel uncomfortable by standing there waiting to order some curly fries. I asked for the reason for refusal and the cashier (long straight haired girl, in her mid 20s, with fake eyelashes) said, with attitude and nasty faces, that it was confidential and that she couldn't tell me. Then she asked me to leave. I've never felt so discriminated, embarrassed and uncomfortable in my life.
author: Yeira D.

description: My boyfriend loves this place. Literally serve their breakfast sandwiches till 3pm. A lil expensive but very worth it for a burger joint.
author: Tattiana B.

description: Decent hole in the wall burger dive joyed popular with the high school set after school and adults in the evening
author: Mr V M.

description: Don't let the outside of this place fool you. The burgers and fries here are amazingly delicious. This is one of my top burger places to go to.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: Really good burgers at really good prices.  They have changed their offerings and likely their ownership over the years, since I first started visiting Beep's while attending High School near by in the early 1990s.  Definitely can't go wrong with any of the burgers (just pick your size) and the milkshakes are top-notch.  4 very solid stars, and I'll be back when in the area.
author: Andy S.

description: Literally the best burgers ever. I come here pretty often and the burgers are always super bomb. The patties and everything here in general is always super high quality and delicious and the employees are all so sweet and kind. Love this place!!!
author: Cee H.

description:
I just tried to eat the GREASIEST burger ever with a lettuce wrap rather than a bun.  There was SO MUCH MAYO that the it really felt like a mayo, lettuce, and grease lump with some meat thrown in.  Ya think the cook might have gotten a clue that the person ordering the burger was looking for the slightly healthier option?
Lord. THE GARLIC FRIES!  completely inedible!  A pile of mush from the grease.  Not one bit appetizing.  They won't give me a refund.  Their place looks all new and spiffed up with a new menu and Niman Ranch beef.  Good for them.  Now it's time to hire a real COOK!  Or since everyone else is raving about them, perhaps the cook didn't show today, Sunday?
author: Dana J.

description: This place is now under new management and I like it. First off, the owner is a cutie. Secondly, I can now use my card to pay for food which is a major plus if you don't carry cash, like myself. The menu is clean and legible. The seating outside on the side has been updated as well. It looks a whole lot better than what it use to look like. The food is cool. The menu is not that much different than then old one but there have been some modifications and updates. Kudos
author: Robert F.

description:
I love Beeps burgers! Burgers are juicy and have nice flavor, good quality patties at a more than fair price (grass fed for less than $6). I tried a decent number of smaller burger joints and this one definitely has one of the best!

They have a nice variety of foods for a small burger shack which include all day breakfast, hot dogs, chicken patties, jalapeno poppers, twinkie shakes, criss cut and sweet potato fries etc..  They do have a new fried chicken sandwhich which comes with jalapeno slaw so I'm curious to see how that pairs up next to bakesale betty's! 

Their sausage egg and cheese on english muffin is a great alternative to the lower quality mcdonalds without sacrificing flavor.

Nice spot near sf community college and worth the visit if you're in the city and wanting a more simple and humble burger experience.

UPDATE: tried the fried chicken sandwich!  It was pretty good but extremely dry sandwich wise.. no sauce and the bun they gave me tasted stale so I asked if I could get their brioche instead. They initially seemed irritated by my request (why would i want to eat stale dry ass bread?) and then explained that it came with that bread and I could request the brioche if I wanted next time.

I would order this again but would ask for brioche and some sort of sauce (I bring sauce to Bake sale Betty too). If wondering, the slaw is not nearly as good as BSB but chicken was cooked fairly well. 

TIP: Different sandwiches come with different buns and most are not labeled so I would ask them prior to finishing your transaction which bun your order comes with to see of that's something you would like

you can mix and match shake mix ins/ice creams. I got strawberry and oreo once and it was pretty good (=
author: Melissa C.

description: Avoided this place for quite a while as it looked run down.  Finally tried it on a friend's recommendation.  Wish I'd gone sooner.  Now I crave it! Great burgers...the meat is high quality and buns are fresh. Fries and onion rings are pretty good too!
author: Rae L.

description:
Not sure if there are new owners, sure the changes to reflect the demographic and overall economic improvement over the area. I remember the Kragen's across the street. The field is plentiful and the prices were cheap. It used to be a steal compared  to McDonald's. Now McDonald's is the steal to me. 

I moved here in 2003. Surely a price change justified, I hadn't seen once since 2003. However the absence of steak fries and random bowls/greasy plates were saddening. It seems the quality has been sacrificed. Strives to taste like off the grid, but the prices are the only similarity. 

Id rather get a McChicken for a buck than an $8 gourmet boutique Cole slaw chicken sandwich.
author: Byron L.

description: One of the best burgers in the city since urban burger closed. If you're from Ingleside you'll notice the prices have gone up considerably, but so has the quality. Old beeps was trash. Burgers are hecka good, fries are legit and staff is nice, wish they were open later but 10 ain't half bad
author: Taj P.

description: Support local business! I cannot believe people go to McDonald's a block away when this historical monument is right here.  Good burger, and the frosty freeze swirly ice cream cone is built something like two feet tall -- good deal! The milkshake could be better if they used real ice cream. Their tip jar always looks empty :'(
author: James C.

description: A friend told me to come here, was well worth it!
