They make amazing veggie burgers and their fries were so on point and so so crispy.. i give it 4 out of 5 stars because parking was terrible (i know im in the city so its whatever I walked some blocks) and the servers served two couples before me even though i ordered before them... doesn't really make sense how my food wouldn't have been ready but 4 meals after me would have been... but....overall the the food is amazing, priced fairly I suppose.. will come here again despite the wait, its very fresh!
author: Giorgio T.

description:
$16.50 for some burger and two sides or so. 

The food is 'Ok' but not the best. 

Hits the spot for your craving of a burger, fries, and shake without breaking the bank and if you're not trying to eat McDonalds. 

Pretty decent but nothing to rave about. The quality of the bun is lacking.
author: T. C.

description:
My husband and I are new to the neighborhood and finally made it to Beep's last night.  We LOVED it.  Generally our favorite quick burger spot in the city is Super Duper, and we thought Beep's was better.  The burgers were really tasty, obviously fresh ground and hand made patties, and they use Nieman Ranch beef.  The buns were soft and really tasty (note - some photos posted show buns with seeds.  These did not have seeds, seemed like a nicer bun than those in older photos).  Nice variety of toppings, all really fresh and generous amounts.  And the menu is big with a lot of variety - different kinds of fries, fried chicken sandwich, shakes, and breakfast sandwiches.  The order area is very clean, signs are nicely done, and I love the retro feel of the place.  

Burgers come with lettuce and tomato.  Onions and pickles are free to add, and then other toppings are available at different (reasonable) prices.

We had a 1/4 beeps burger with cheddar and with grilled onions and pickles added, a 1/2 burger (2 1/4 patties) with cheddar and avocado added, two orders of the regular fries (really good!!), an order of onion rings (very tasty), a root beer, and a large milkshake for $30.  It was too much food and in the future we would get 1 fry and a small milkshake instead.  We were completely satisfied after - everything a good size and generous portions.  Food came out pretty quickly and it looks like you can call in an order as well.  Overall I thought it was terrific and will be back again and again!  Next time I will get a cone too.

Please note that Beep's was taken over by a new owner pretty recently - so I don't think ratings from before the past year or so are very relevant anymore.  And despite some of the reviews saying this place is hipster or fancy, it certainly isn't.  The ingredients are high quality and the service is great, but it is still a low key take out burger joint (of the best kind).  So glad it is in my neighborhood!
author: Emily d.

description: The food is average honestly what's nice about the place is good customer service and the jalapeño ranch sauce. I used to go bout twice a week but ever since I went 2 days ago and paid $9 for a "cheesesteak" and saw that THERE WAS NO MEAT ON IT!!! Never going back. Never in my life have I ever felt so disrespected than when I opened that bread and saw nothing in there.
author: Don A.

description: You can't find another place like this in the city. Especially this place. Beeps gives a diner feel that you can't get anywhere else. They have seats outside to sit just like at diners or tables like a fast food restaurant. The fish and chips are bomb. The fish and chips are both crispy and when you split the fish, the inside separates perfectly, well cooked. The chips aren't soggy; they're well fried. The tartar sauce that comes with it is also delicious. Would always come back.
author: Dominique C.

description:
I went back to beeps Today.  Time honored drive in on ocean in San Francisco.  I used to go here as a kid in the 70s.   Here is what I know so far.

Ambience: This is a old drive in where you order at the window and eat in your car. The four stars is for this genre.  If you are looking for different, try elsewhere.

The burger:
Meat fried on griddle with wonderful browned exterior.  Juicy. 1/4 and 1/2 pound options. Several cheese options. Turkey salmon  and veggie also available 

The bun:
Fresh. Not too big. Heated on grill. Pretty sure buttered. No sesame seeds.  

Accoutrements:
Lettuce tomato.  Thousand island.   
There are lots of add ins available 

Fries: standard steak fries cooked to order and perfection.  

Other menu items include some Asian bowls dogs and other items.  Can't comment but burgers are legit
author: Phil N.

description: I had the new fried chicken sandwich with coleslaw and I gotta tell you the flavor was there. I asked the owner for mayo and he gave me some and said try it without first and boy he was right ! Flavor punch. I enjoy there awesome burgers normally but I like that they're expanding there menu.
author: Alan B.

description:
Paid $13.57 for an oddly sour burger, lukewarm fries, and a vanilla milkshake that was heavy on the milk. 

Apparently they were better in the past and I hope they find a way to go back to that. Truly not worth the money.
author: Ryean K.

description:
Since I have been a student at CCSF, I have always passed Beep's to go to McD.

Well, I decided to not pass it up and give it a try. 

Their burgers are delish1!! Fries were also great. Price matched.
Parking is upfront.

Staff and service was good.
author: Roger A.

description:
The Beeps Burger jalapeno and a side of fries  - yom love it
Not 5 star cuz of the prices & the tiny size of the sodas -
author: Robyn C.

description: Came to San Francisco for a concert and to visit my daughter at college.  She asked some of the kids in the dorm where to go to get a good burger, and this was one of the places recommended.  Was a beautiful day in the city so sitting outside was perfect.  Beep's is a walk up to the window, order and they call your name for pick up.  No indoor seating.  I thought the prices were reasonable.  Burger and fries were tasty!  One thing I was really impressed with was how clean the eating area and parking area were.  I honestly don't think I saw any garbage what so ever.  I would definitely come back!
author: Wendy H.

description: Got the 1/4 lb. burger with American cheese & an order of fries. I like that the meal sizes that they offered and the ability to completely customize your order. Price was on point for the size of the burger which was so juicy and cooked to perfection. Definitely beat my expectation!
author: Amberly J.

description: Had the 1/2 lb beep burger. It was delicious. High quality niman ranch patties and the price can't be beat at 8.50. Fries were solid as well. Will definitely be back.
author: William L.

description: I had a beeps burger with bacon and jalapeños it was a good burger, the service was awesome as well.  This is the second time I have eaten here it was good both times the root beer float was good also
author: Joshua P.

description: YESSSSSSSSSSS!!!!! This is the place to be for the juiciest burger at the minimum price. I got the 1/4 pounder and its cheap, they have a lot of variety on the menu. Quick place to stop and grab a burger after a long day. It's nice they have a little parking lot, and it's nice that I get a 70s vibe from this joint. Fries are good, mixture of crunchy and soft.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
I really wanted to love this place for its old-school charm but the food is only 3 star food, really. We got a fish sandwich and a cheeseburger with fries. The wait was a little longer than you'd expect it to be, maybe around 10 minutes. The fish sandwich was hot and fairly large although not anything special, just a frozen square fish patty that was then fried. What was a bit annoying was the fact that I was charged twice for extra tartar sauce without being told (once for getting tartar sauce instead of mayo which I would've been fine with if they'd just told me and the second charge for asking for extra.) I understand about being charged for extra things but how was I supposed to know that tartar sauce wasn't the norm?

Cool atmosphere but food is only okay.
author: Su-Yee L.

description: Yum! I really love a good burger and Beep's is fantastic. Beep's is an SF staple that many natives love and cherish. For burgers and fries made in a shack it is on the pricey side, but in its defense you can tell they're using fresh produce and bread and they use locally sourced meats. The 1/2 lb is two patties, which is quite heavy. So if you can't eat a ton definitely go with the 1/4 lb. It is hard to find good garlic fries, especially during AT&T's off-season. But Beep's is definitely the place to go if you have a craving for them. I did expect a little bit more from the nutella milkshake. It wasn't quite blended well and the hazelnut flavor was lost. But it's also Nutella in ice cream - so how bad can it be? If you want to spend a little money on burgers and do something fun with friends and/or family, Beep's is a classic choice.
author: Isabella G.

description:
The burgers here are delicious and addicting.

Juicy meat patties from Niman ranch, fresh and juicy tomatoes, good crisp lettuce, and good quality buns. Killer sauces to top it off.

I always get american cheese, which comes out melted and dripping off the burger - YUM.

Lots of ways to get potatoes but the crisscut fries are probably my favorite. Big enough to split one order. 

Breakfast sandwiches here are great, but they open pretty late so its kind of a tease. @Beeps MGMT: open earlier for those of us who need to eat breakfast before 11 AM!
author: James F.

description:
Burgers = great. Juicy, delicious, and I'm happy to say that they cooked it the way I ordered them.  Medium well, and 1/2 lb was well done. 

I'm not a fan of steak fries but I tried them.  They were good but I'll order 'em crispier next time. :) 

Pineapple shake! PINEAPPLE SHAKE! Thank you fellow Yelpers.  You've found one of my favorite things...and it's great!  Even the chocolate shake was awesome too.  (I usually hate the super sweet fake chocolate flavor, but this was NOT the case.)

Prices = reasonable.

Service = friendly.  Super friendly. 

I'll be back here.
author: Fannie S.

description: Burgers are good, spicy chicken sandwich is great and steak fries (when hot) are good.  The Oreo and vanilla shake are always a nice treat as well. Sometimes there are some spotty patrons out front,  however, I have never been bothered by them.  I think they take pride in their food and it shows.
author: Erich B.

description:
Solid eats and I like the variety.  
Totally understand the sentimental folks who miss the previous incarnation.

It's gotten upscale but hey, notice you're across the street from Whole Foods - and judging from the traffic and construction, Ocean avenue is going to turn into another destination neighborhood.

And... you can hit the Mcdonald's if you really think it's better value.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
I enjoyed my burger. It was a 1/4 lb beep burger with cheddar and some jalapeños. It wasn't anything amazing and it wasn't sub par. It was good. Just that. Good. It was kinda small. I got my daughter the mini corn dogs. She said they were OK, they were like the frozen ones you get at the store. The fries didn't have seasoning or anything to make them stand out, other than they were steak fries. 

I'll say this... I'd eat this burger again with absolutely no complaints. I just wouldn't go out of my way to come get it, and it penalty wouldn't stick out in my memory.
author: Monique C.

description:
**********The burger that I fell in love with is no more**********

They recently changed the way they make their burgers. They also increased the prices by a lot!

I've been coming here since 2007 when I went to CCSF. Since then I've continuously gone out of my way to travel up to Ocean ave (I live on the opposite side of S.F.) just to eat their burgers. I would purposefully choose Beeps over Red Robins, BJ's, Hooters, Elephant Bar, and all other fast foods within a 10 mile radius.

The changes I highly dislike:
-They changed their beef patties. Not from good to bad. They're just different now.
-They changed the sauce they put on their burgers.
-They changed the bun.
-I don't even think they used lettuce before, now they do and it gets in the way.
-They increased the prices (French Fries are now a separate cost).

I have no reason to visit Beeps again unless they revert their burgers. I'm sorry this is so dramatic but Beep's has been my go-to burger hot spot for 8 years now. Unfortunately I'll have to tell my friends that they've changed their menu...

Yesterday I ordered two 1/2 burgers + 1 order of fries = $21.45 after tax. Better off to just go to Red Robins if I'm going to spend that much. I may as well at least sit down and have a beer. And enjoy unlimited fries.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Been here twice and although most of my friends LOVE Beeps, I just wouldn't go here again after my second time. Being the biggest burger fan, I was expecting a really crazy good tastin burger at an inexpensive price at the convenience of your little local corner joint. I honestly thought the burgers could've been better. Finished feeling absolutely bloated and oiled up. The beef could've been cooked better, it was really chewy and a thin. Granted the two times I went were near closing possibly 830-9 but that seems to be prime time for all dinner munchies for customers nearby! The fries were good and potato-y but the onion rings were super small and scanty, over cooked and burnt.

Wouldn't go again. I'm not even sure I'd say this was good for a quick fix. I'd choose some in n out over this forshure.

Cash only.
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
This place lists itself as $$ but should be $$$. 
From 35cents to 75cents for cheese on my burger. Smh. What kind of cheese? Cheddar cheese. Not even Brie or some artisan cheese. Someone please open up a competitor burger place. This is a drive thru spot, a burger shouldn't cost 7 dollars.
author: Jane S.

description: Locally owned for hella decades, this burger drive-up is a one-of-a-kind relic of an older SF. Favorites in my family include crispy chicken sandwich, corn dogs, and crosscut fries. All made fresh with great ingredients and spices.
author: Joseph C.

description: I was utterly suprised, I know its been a while since I've come here but I was very disappointed at both the taste and value. So I used to come here at times to get the best value for my money, though to feed my family for what used to cost me $20 cost me $55. I honestly felt like,  I expected a lot more for spending what I normally would at a sit down restaurant and there isn't even a dining area to justify this. Then the quality of the fee I felt also deteriorated since I didn't sense any sort of flavor and I was acustom to having such favorful food. Honestly I hate the changes that have come to this business and I am suprised at those who complain everything is so expense were ok with the quality they got from this drastic change. What a joke you can charge what you do for something that is no where near even red robin standards.
author: Jay D.

description:
Love this place :) 

It's a great place to go to, especially if you're in the mood for a good burger and you go to CCSF. Their burgers are made to an exceptional perfection, but i really love their chicken strips. The fries are absolutely tasty, especially with the BBQ sauce they give you. And their fish sandwiches are irresistible!

Only thing that sucks is that you have to pay $0.25 for extra sauce, which comes in a super tiny container. And they don't accept card :/.

But nonetheless, I definitely recommend this place :)
author: Jerianne G.

description: I give this place 2 stars because their fries are bomb! And because it was fast service. One thing I didn't like were their burgers it is so oily and greasy. Like, the oil literally soaks up the bread. The bread doesn't even seem toasted at all. Other than that, I know I won't be coming here again.
author: Tupou P.

description:
BUMMER  beeps just isn't what it used to be anymore! As I've said in my previous review, I've been going here for YEARS on a regular basis. It was always that staple that reminded me of HOME. AND NOW....?!

I completely understand trying to keep up with wages and changing surroundings, but the recent changes feel like a slap in the face to all the long time neighborhood regulars. It used to be so comforting to get a burger basket at the end of a long day for a decent price. And I'm not talking years ago, they just barely changed the menu and pricing a few months ago. You go now... You end up paying double what you used to for the same amount of food. And I guess you can say the quality is slightly better. But seriously.. Not enough to merit the drastic price change. As the old saying goes... If it ain't broke, don't fix it. 

SUPER BUMMER... Beeps went from my once a week treat yo self meal, to a long lost friend that I have to cherish in memory. The same sad, sad story happening all around the city.. Businesses catering to the new yuppie crowd while ignoring and kicking out the locals...
author: Alexandria M.

description:
I think I ate too much here because 5 hours later and I am still extremely full!

This little place is basically a burger stand. There is no indoor seating. The sign is a little rundown but you'll be able to see it from a distance. 

FOOD
-1/2 lb burger was huge... basically two meat patties! Must get it with cheese, that was my favorite part of the burger. I had a hard time keeping everything together, let's just say my lettuce kept slipping out and I ran out of bread before everything else. Did I mention this burger was huge?
-Fries were meh. Large cut fries are not my favorite although I generally looove fries. These were not well seasoned either. 
-Onion rings. My bf ordered onion rings and made me wish I ordered those too! Tastier than the fries.
-Pineapple milkshake. Everyone keeps talking about their pineapple milkshake so we had to try it too! Not too sweet, subtle pineapple taste, with a delicious creaminess.  Can't get this anywhere else! I'm a fan. I would come back again for this alone. 

PROS
-Pineapple milkshake. Period.
-You get your money's with for the burgers! If you aren't too hungry, get a 1/4 on burger.
-Accepts credit card :) 
-Pro tip: ask for a ranch dressing! They have them in these cute little cups!
-Vintage Dr. Pepper glass bottles. With real sugar! Writing this makes me want one now :9
-Good place to go if you are HUNGRYYYY and/or if you're craving burgers.

CONS
-No indoor seating :( but they have 1 table outside and 4 stools for bar seating.
-It gets pretty windy outside so make sure your napkins and etc are weighted down.
-Me no like the fries here. Onion rings!!
author: Grace J.

description: I got 1/4 burger and garlic fries.  The fries and beef patty were tasty.  However, the bun was too dry and thick.  The bun should be more soft, tender and fluffy.  Also, Beep's sauce was too much mayo. I wish there are some pickles or onions in the burger to balance this oily mayo sauce.
author: EunJoo C.

description: How the garlic fries aren't a highlight is beyond me. Those fries are unreal! The fried chicken sandwich and the burgers are great too. Awesome cheat meal
author: Shan M.

description: They raised the prices but not the quality. Burger and fries now cost 10$. Rather go to in n out where the food is better, cheaper and healthier.
author: Seven R.

description: OH MY GOODNESS! This place is amazing! I tried their 1/4 cheeseburger and fries- just amazing! Their fries are so crispy and have amazing flavor! I also tried their fish sandwich WICH was pretty tasty also! And their ice cream is delicious! I love you, beeps
author: Diana N.

description: I went yesterday on a recommendation I recieved and let me tell you it was liiiit.I ordered the beep burger and onions rings.Everything was delicious.I will be back
author: Harriet A.

description:
This is what burgers should begin to start with! All ways toast both sides of the bun, char broil, and 1/4 lbs.of meat (cooked) and not dry. I had a bacon cheese burger only and inhaled it because I had past feeding time but 3 hours but what I tasted was great. 

SUGGESTION- BBQ grill your bacon w/ select wood. Cook it 50% in bulk and return it to the frig and it will keep just as long as raw. Pull it and cook per order for a "Hickory smoked bacon cheese burger" special. 

We; men, love bacon and I never meet a person that doesn't like bar-B-que flavor. FYI: turkey bacon (a mortal sin and oxymoron doesn't store right in the frig).
author: Lawrence F.

description: This in my book is the best burger I've had in SF to date (3years). Every time I come, I can expect deliciousness to happen and my stomach is all the happier for it. Not to mention fries how you like them and the shake to close the deal. Go here if you want good things to happen :), enjoy.
author: Ismar M.

description:
Tried to get a basket of chicken tenders and garlic fries and they do not allow that. It's makes no sense because I was willing to pay an extra fee to exchange the 3 dollar fries for the 3.75 dollar fries. 
Extremely inconvenient.
author: Zhenya P.

description:
Numero Uno - If you eat here or any other place on a regular basis that serves fried fat and sugary drinks, you will likely die a slow, painful death from diabetes, heart disease, and/or kidney and/or liver failure. Maybe once a week if you are healthy, but seriously, the prices tell you a lot about the quality of the ingredients. You are what you eat. 

Now that I've rained on your parade, I can heartily recommend the corn dog. Hot, crispy, and cheap (like me), it is the perfect between-meal snack, or cure for the munchies. Corn dogs are a part of the brown food group, and if you add mustard and/or catsup, you have your meat, your bread, and your vegetables; a complete meal! On a stick. 

A sharp stick, so be careful.
author: Joseph T.

description: Usually the camera eats first but it happened that my stomach is first this time. 1/4 burger with well placed avocado was really good. Garlic fries has the right amount of garlic on them as well. Good place to stop by and take a bite.
author: Nick T.

description: Negative poor service all the way, went this place get veggie burger when got my order I called on this fake blond Asian teenage girl on other side of counter she ignore me when came around, ask for different sauces like ketchup and other stuff she just gave me ketchup only and I have to get others by myself, which was hard to reach that ungrateful little girl just looked, turned around, walked away didn't want to help me while shaking her head, she didn't consider getting different kind of sauces for me to put on my veggie burger sandwich ordered from them.
author: Lorrie T.

description:
The seating area looks old and abandoned.

The food is mediocre. I still don't know why I went here a lot during my student days. Probably just hunger and being close to the bus where I wait.
author: Leslie M.

description: Tastes so good make you wanna slap yo mama! The sauce on the burger was smackin. Can't wait to go back to SF this is the burger spot there!
author: Leon A.

description:
Oh Beep's! What have you done?! Sadly this week is my last week of my weekly trips to Beep's. I should have written a positive review years ago as they really deserved it. As others have said, for a price less than a similar meal from McDonald's you use to get a good quality fast-food style burger and fries. I don't generally like steak fries, but Beep's was the only place I knew that made them delicious. Perfectly crisp and golden on the outside, yummy on the inside.

That Beep's is no more. I can't blame a business for wanting to "evolve" but they've priced me out. The new fries just aren't as good... more dry tasting and they don't come as a combo anymore. They just come separately and while that might not be such an issue the problem is they only have one size, huge. A 1/4 burger and an order of fries is now about $3 more than I use to pay AND way too much food. I can't justify paying more every week for additional food I don't have room for. I might start going again if they bring back combos or start selling several sizes of fries. But until then my weekly trips are over.

Some positives. The new burgers are marginally better than the old ones... though a lot greasier. The new "special sauce" is tasty, though its pretty similar to the sauce that comes with an Outback Bloomin' Onion. The folks who work there are still really friendly and the owner's have done a lot making it not look like a rundown dive.

I wish Beep best of luck with this new direction... perhaps they're hoping to bring in a wealthier clientele from the new condos being built across the street, but it looks like its happening at the expense of their old fans.
author: Andrew B.

description: I thought that the burgers from this place was not that good by the appearance and style of the place, but as everybody say don't judge the book by the cover, one day me and my girlfriend were looking for a place to lunch and we decided to give it a chance, its one of the tastiest burgers that i ever had in SF totally recommend it !
author: Joao Victor A.

description: Stop by bc i passed by this place a hundred times and i wanted a burger At 1st look at the prices i thought wow pricey maybe the burgers are that great Well the burger was ok but for $8 it was the size of McDonalds McDouble literally The fries was small cut So it was over cooked, very greasy and the portion for $3 was very small Similar to McDonals medium fries maybe smaller The options for a burger join is limited Jus burger and hotdogs Not a lot of options Burger wasnt bad but not good wnough for a $8 burger I paid $15 for a burger fries n drink and was kot satisfied Beeps is too expensive You will be disappointed if you want a real burger
author: Jay F.

description: Got a 1/4 pound burger with Swiss today and French fries... burger tasted amazing and fries were hot and fresh!! Highly recommend this place
author: Eric C.

description:
Really yummy food, some people complained of the higher prices but you can still get a milkshake, fries and veg burger for around $15.00 

Service is decent, one girl is very kind but the others sometimes look like i'm bothering them when I order food there.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Sadly Beeps is no longer the same. 
There have been some changes to the menu items. 
No longer are fries included with a burger. 
The quality of food has slightly increased but not enough to justify the new prices. 
Seems like they are trying to cash in on the gentrification of the area with yuppie condos and Whole Foods across the street.
author: J R.

description: Like other reviewers have already mentioned, the food is a bit overpriced. Nevertheless, the service is quick and the food is yummy.
author: Sergio M.

description: Since my last post they've made some changes and the burger was a ZILLION times better, even if they also upped their prices but that neighborhood is gentrifying FAST so can't blame them.
author: Sally D.

description: The burgers are phenomenal, but the garlic fries will change your life. Affordable, friendly service. This place has been here for decades, and I hope it never closes.
author: Jack P.

description:
Forget McDonald's the next block over, and go to Beep's instead! The quantity and quality at Beep's is definitely more worth it. The downside is that it takes a while (anywhere from 10 to 15 minutes) for your food to be made. But the long wait-time means freshly cooked food.

I'm not a huge fan of steak-cut fries, but their fries here are so fresh and hot (I always burn my tongue eating them). They're a beautiful golden brown with crispy edges and hot soft centers. And if they're small and thin enough, they're very crunchy like a kettle-cooked potato chip. Their cheeseburgers are very simple, with a hot beef patty, melted cheese, iceberg lettuce (yuck), tomato slices, onions, and pickles. I can definitely get full off one of their burger value meals. I've also tried their chicken tenders basket, which comes with four pieces of chicken tenders, fries, and BBQ sauce. Overall, food is nothing too special but relatively cheap.

Although their main attraction is burgers, Beep's also has fish & chips, shrimp & chips, chicken nuggets, philly cheesesteak, hot dogs, corn dogs, teriyaki bowls, and breakfast options. Most items range from about $4 to $6. And I have yet to try their pineapple shake!
author: Priscilla W.

description: Quality, fresh ingredients for a great price. Ninman Ranch beef and Semifreddi's buns.
author: Jess G.

description: Wow. These burgers are the best I've ever had hands down. There Beef taste sooo fking good that you will want to lick your fingers. I've had them 3 times now and I travel way from Bayview to get them.
author: Elijah P.

description:
This was my first time at Beep's. Good burgers for a reasonable price. Not usually a fan of the flatter patties, but it was still full of flavor and filling. Don't know why people on here are complaining so much about their price change. Minimum wages are rising guys. Prices unfortunately have to raise with it, so don't punish the restaurant.  
I'd definitely go here again. The food is worth it.
author: Justine H.

description:
Beeps burgers, is the last burger joint in the neighborhood. You have Mc Donnals, Quckly, and many other alternatives that would make this place absolite. The burgers, fries and shakes are made with little to no authenticity. For a buger meal i believe will cost you around $10.

The tables they have put out are very flimsy, dirty, and unbalanced. That aside, the cashier barely gives you any ketchup. If you dicide to dine inn, and want some ketchup, they wil hand you a ketchup bottle that taste like if its been sitting there collecting dust for years.

Its a shame that beepS, became this, mediocre service, food that looks like you get at a cheap ballpark, and lastly, keychup from hell. CHANGE IT BEEPS, CHANGE IT.
author: Steven R.

description:
I've loved Beep's since I moved to Ingleside 2 years ago and I felt the need to commend the new ownership to the changes that they have made. The quality of the food has stepped up significantly and you can really tell that the owner is taking real pride in improving Beep's while still maintaining its throw-back feel. I honestly feel it rivals some of the other burger spots in SF such as Pearl's. Great job on improving an Ingleside staple! 

P.S. I kinda miss the teriyaki bowls....
author: Eucalyptus J.

description:
The burger is always good. The one thing that I'm upset about they got rid of the tacos. It was a great item. Please Beeps bring back the taco.
Thats it. You guys are good. Keep it up. Please bring back the TACO!!!
author: Phil B.

description:
One of my new favorite burger places. I had the quarter pound Beep burger with special sauce and cheddar cheese. I also got fries and a Twinkie shake, that's right , the Twinkie shake. The patty of the burger had the right amount of juiciness while the edges were crunchy. The fries big prices and fried perfectly. 

My favorite has to be the Twinkie shake, it actually has a Twinkie blended into the shake. Definitely coming back for more. My whole order was about 14 bucks.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Oh wait I got a great little message that made my week.  One can still can get the steak fries! :) All is right with the world... 
Anyone wanna share some with me tomorrow?!?! Yippee.
author: Cheryl D.

description: You guys, I'm not just a real person, I'm a food critic. And I just went to a place that blew my proverbial socks off. That's right. It's called Beep's Burgers. I got a classic American Beep's Burger and it was everything I expected. Thinly paddied meat straight from what I'm assuming was a real cow. Crispety, crunchety fries with the perfect amount of chef-applied saltiness. A fountain soda that just made me feel good inside. Honestly, when I ordered, the counter server failed to ask me how my night was going (we are right in the midst of rush hour), but I'm willing to overlook that.  Overall, 5 stars. This one is not to be missed. Spread the word. Or not, after all I'm just a food critic.
author: Sean B.

description:
3 1/2 stars.     

I am a woman of many opinions (and strong ones at that, I am a Taurean) but I just can't put my feelings into words, so I decided to write my review in the form of a poorly written Haiku which represents how I feel about Beeps:


Beeps oh Beeps, my prize.
Burger, shake, and curly fries.
Ate all my food, sighhhhs.


Note: a sigh not because portions were small, but a sigh because I straight up ate it all.
author: Megan A.

description:
Chicken nuggets - lifeless thin excuses for chicken
Fries - if you have to ask if I want salt, that's not a good sign. Thankfully I said yes. Season your food prior.
Ranch - Yack. Go online and look up a tolerable ranch recipe, I know you use stuff out of a jug cuz your workers are pouring it into plastic cups in plain view of customers.

My ketchup was good but that was Heinz.

You should try to be a real food joint and serve edible options.
author: Kendra S.

description: While on a date with my boyfriend, I had the biggest craving for a burger and couldn't make up my mind on where to go. After asking a few friends they recommended Beep's and let me just say, my craving was SATISFIED!! I got a burger with fries, great juicy and full of flavor, and my boyfriend ordered fish and chips which were also very tasty. I enjoyed their hot sauce with the fish and chips!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
For many years, my family has been in search of the best of the best for two basic dietary "comfort food" staples: the perfect burger and the perfect slice of pizza. In our quest for the perfect burger, we keep a very tight judging criteria that allows us the best way to compare: burger, bun, cheese (optional), and condiments such as lettuce, pickles, etc..Our search led us to a drive-up off of Ocean Avenue.

Beep will not win any awards for decor although the take-out/sit outside-only establishment has a nice retro feel to it. But I have to say we loved the burgers. Here's why:

1. Soft, slightly grilled bun; perfect size for our double burgers
2. Well-seasoned and well-cooked patty to order--very tasty and cooked perfectly
3. Melt in your mouth quality
4. Condiments were fresh and they got them right on all the orders--not an easy feat.
5. Right price relative to quality

The fries were decent although we probably prefer the Acme Burger Haus fries as these may not have been hand sliced. All in all, if you don't care about eating outside or taking it home, this is one of the better standard burgers out there. Check out the other burger reviews for more hidden gems.
author: Peter O.

description: Best burger in the area. Yes, it's greasy. Yes, it's more expensive than McDonald's one block over. Yes, you have to order fries separately. But who cares, it's delicious. The staff are friendly and the food is ready in short order. Usually costs about $25 for two burgers, fries, and drinks.
author: Jake B.

description: My burger was fresh,hot and delicious. Enjoyed each bite. The garlic fries had so much garlic you could keep vampires away for a whole month. Overall it was great.
author: Melissa A.

description: Fried chicken sandwich so so good, the jalapeño coleslaw is perfection and not super spicy.
author: Mandy F.

description: Fast service  great burgers best quality  burgers in San Francisco  by far  has good menu options
author: Dale M.

description:
Pretty darn good. I got the fish burger w/ cheese - crust is crispy and it's juicy. 

Onions rings have great texture but my friend said it had too much batter. I didn't mind.
author: Julie L.

description: I love getting the fish sandwich and tater tots. The fish is crispy, white and moist. Your food is served hot as they yell your name from the window when ready nommm lol!
author: Isis M.

description:
I just LOVE BEEPS. 

Tasty Burgers, tacos, corn dogs. Actually my favorite is their Fish & Chips. Mnnnnnnn!

You can even phone your order in, if your in a hurry and it will be ready in 10 minutes.

They now accept Debit/CC's which is handy.

Everyone there is SUPER FRIENDLY.
author: Janet T.

description:
Beep's is still my favorite drive-in burger joint in the city to get a good 'ol fashioned 1/4 pound burger and strawberry shake mainly because of the nostalgic location/decor and great prices. Their burgers weren't as rich as Super Duper's or Joe's Cable Car (RIP) but they were what I thought of as an old-school American hamburger, and for around $5 their value was hard to beat. In the past year their owner has changed and the place may seem a little different but give it a try and you'll see why Beep's is still reminiscent of the classic burger experience I remember. The burgers are still great and I don't mind the increase in prices to match the minimum wage or the Niman's ranch beef, and I love their pineapple or strawberry shakes!

The service is much friendlier than before and their menu is easier to read. Make sure to ask for the manager, Christine, if you have any issues and you'll be taken care of! With everything made to order there's usually a small queue of patrons so expect to wait 10-15 minutes for your order. Still a great place to get your favorite taste of Americana before heading to Ocean Beach!
author: Phi P.

description: Need a burger with a little more heart than going to Popsons or Super Duper? Beeps is the plug. It's been here for years, and as of recently, the niman ranch meat has given all these other burger spots a run for its money. Take a 1/4 or 1/2 pound Beeps burger(has the classic Beeps sauce), and contribute to a true Frisco original establishment
author: Carlo P.

description: I haven't been here since high school (early nineties). Staff was friendly and sweet. Everything was fresh so it took some time. I am in LOVE with their chicken wings with ranch jalapeño dipping sauce. My husband ordered fish and chips and was equally satisfied - coming back soon!
author: stephany m.

description:
Beep's is AMAZING! I am so glad to live right around the corner from this awesome, old-school drive-in. I think my sister from the E. Coast said it best when I took her to Beep's: "Wow! This burger is exactly like I wished the burger from In-n-Out would be."

The burgers taste fresh and high quality, and not too fancy schmancy -- and from my perspective, that's a good thing. My go-to order is a 1/4 pounder with bacon, mushrooms, cheddar cheese, and curly fries. Maybe a chocolate milk shake if I'm feeling extra-decadent. Go to Beep's for a mini-vacation to simpler times. Waygu beef is a waste on a burger anyway. 

The super-friendly staff make every visit a pleasurable experience, too. They are awesome, and feel like a part of our little Ingleside community. Kudos to you all for making this neighborhood institution shine so bright!
author: Victoria C.

description:
This place is amazing!  I've gone after class at CCSF a few times and their cheeseburgers are the best!  Along with their fries... absolutely delicious!

I swear by In N Out, like any Californian, but these are totally different types of tasty!  I might be in the mood for one over the other, when it comes to the burger, but Beep's has the better fries, hands down!
author: Christine L.

description:
As promised, I did come back to try their burger and give this place a second chance. Their burger is fantastic! I ordered the the cheese burger with fries without realizing that there is a "deal" where its a little cheaper. Without me saying anything, the cashier automatically deducted the discount from the total which I really appreciate. 

The burgers here are quite big and filling. They are high quality and come with fresh lettuce, tomatoes and onions. The fries are also delicious. I still like the skinny fries over the steak fries but this place has perfected their steak fries. 

Overall, at a place called "Beeps Burgers" for a reason and you probably should order their burger and not their rice dish like me in my previous review. I would definitely recommend this place and I'll be back for sure!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
One of my biggest complaints with the millennial generation is their constant need for instant gratification and after eating this rather mediocre-at-best meal that sentiment still remains.

I'm a newbie to San Francisco and the Ingelside community and had happen to come across an article that Beeps was a rather well-known San Francisco establishment that was being taken over by some aspiring entrepreneurs who wanted to keep the old school spirit, but improve the menu. Now I have no idea how good the food was beforehand, but this afternoon's experience made me believe the owners don't understand that quality fast food is on the up and up. When you have franchises like In n Out, Shake Shack, Super Duper, etc then it's imperative for local businesses to either have a superior product or some "original shtick". This place had neither, instead it's "original shtick" was mediocrity. Here's why: 

1) I ordered a $5.25 chicken sandwich when I could've went across the street to McDonalds and got one for equal quality at $1. I was expecting chicken, not a frozen chicken-meat-product, but instead it tasted like a super-sized frozen chicken nugget sandwiched between two pieces of stale bread. Chicken isn't that expensive, even a Tyson frozen chicken breast slapped between two buns would have been a better effort than the embarrassment of a chicken sandwich that I got. 

2) My boyfriend ordered the shrimp and chips only to get skimped on the shrimp and to be bombarded with twice the amount of soggy fries. Supposedly the Richmond District has a similar place by the name of Buffalo Burger, which has superior shrimp and a nice 1:1 ratio of shrimp to fries. 

In the end, my beef with the place is you walk away feeling gyped. It's as if a couple of college students went on a shopping trip to Costco and raided the frozen section and started a business hoping the legacy of the restaurant will carry them through. NO, it doesn't work like that. It's like listening to a paint by numbers pop song like "Call Me Maybe" or walking out of a recent Arnold Schwarzeneggar action flick. In a day and age where chefs are coming up with new ways to make the simplest meals out of fast food you'd expect a place like this to step up their game, especially after pitching locals of injecting "new flavor" to the business. Instead, it feels like a lousy millennial youtube video made with minimal effort, in hopes of getting a viral audience without any thought behind how the story was going to unfold. Even some viral videos have some level of cleverness or inspiration, this experience leaves little to be desired.
author: Geraldine C.

description:
Another B.

This time for bowls with shrimp, homemade teriyaki sauce, steamed rice and veggies. 

Sauce was as sweet as before. Bowl as filling and enjoyable as the burgers. Reasonable $7 and change.

Another four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: I used to come here all the time when the place used to be a little more run down and mom and pop. Now that beeps got a facelift its just not the same. The menu is unrecognizable and more expensive now, and lord curse any burger place that charges you extra for standard toppings like cheese. (They don't have a cheese burger, rather all their burgers are plain and you have to pay for extras) Looks like new/old owners sold out to Pepsi pretty hard too, as the entire place is plastered with logos. Such a shame.
author: Brad M.

description: The fish and chips wasn't that impressive but the burger was great. Love the sauce and lettuce tomato ratio.would totally make another late night run for burgers here.
author: Tamika C.

description: This is my favorite place to go when I cheat on my diet!! The burgers are fresh and they use quality meat! The chicken sandwiches are great too!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Their burgers are so juicy and the criss cut fries were amazing! The chocolate milkshake was a little thick but still good. I will definitely be back!
author: Katie P.

description: Diggin' the upgrade, as is the rest of the family. First rate burgers, very good onion rings, good fries, and good shakes, all at reasonable prices. I'd say this place beats most of the burger places in the area.
author: Michael S.

description:
I'm loving their 6-piece chicken nugget basket with french fries and vanilla milkshake. This place makes good food. If you want something that is a substitute to fast food, then I'd highly recommend you to come to Beep's Burgers.

Here are their new business hours:
Monday - Saturday 10 AM - 10 PM
Sunday 11 AM - 9 PM
author: Bennett W.

description:
First time here and I am officially a fan!  I've tried a fair share of burger joints in my lifetime and Beep's Burgers is one of the best.

I got the 1/4 pound burger with Swiss cheese and a Nutella milkshake.  The mayo was amazing.  It was reminiscent of a garlic aioli. The meat was tender and juicy and the buns were puffy and perfectly cooked. 

5 stars for me!
author: H. C.

description: Goodness on goodness. You can tell this place has been around forever, and it shows, in a good way. Tender burgers, excellent shakes, crisp fries. Can't complain. Decent amount of parking too. Yummm.
author: Samir K.

description: This place is great. Awesome food with a good price. What I like about this place is it's compact but yet the food they serve here are really good and it also brings you a different environment so its worth the experience. Theres convenient parking in the front so you can always order and sit in your car while you wait for your food. Definitely worth a try if you decide to grab mcdonalds or a burrito a couple block radius away.
author: Fredrick T.

description: I enjoy the 1/2 beep burger. This place have change since the last time I came here. The original owner of the place sold the place. Before a burger order come with some fries but now it doesn't include fries. The 1/2 beep burger with sauce cost eight bucks! I understand that they have fresh ground beef and cook to order but how can justify charging eight buck just the difference is they put sauce on the burger. I think this time is the last time I would go to this place for lunch. The place lost some character when the original owner sold the place.
author: Chris Y.

description:
I wouldn't say cheap burger as I only ordered a 1/4 pounder with cheese and a fries for close to $8. (no drink) 

My order took about 15 mins to get and there were one person in front of me. I like how they have top 40s music blasting in the background.

Burger were ok, nothing to rave about.  I think the meat is similar to a frozen patty style, as the girl who took my order never ask me how I want my meat cook. My bread started to crumble apart so you know it's probably going stale. however I did like their fries which is a steak cut (my favorite type) 

I might come back if I am nearby and definitely better than McDonald.
author: DVS A.

description: Their Sundae's are literally just Ice cream with Hershey's chocolate syrup. What is this????
author: Genevieve R.

description: I still come here out of habit, but the Beeps Burger of today is nowhere near how good it was in the prior years of being bought and renovated. I dont care if the sign is repainted or if they take credit card, just give me a god damn 1/4 burger with fries for $4.90
author: Nathan T.

description:
I suppose it was inevitable that this final bastion of good-ol fashioned eats would eventually succumb to the overpriced and over-complicated menus that plague The City. Beeps was the neighborhood grease joint where one could expect an honest, no frills burger and a combo deal for under $8.
Sadly, it seems that new management has greedily seized on a course of modernization which has effectively destroyed the many qualities that were so loved by the locals. Firstly, it used to be cheap. No one ever went to a forgotten drive-up for the ambiance. Beep's serviced the needs of the community for an alternative to McDonalds. Now, the fries are sold separately and cost $2.75.
Secondly, the menu used to be barely legible and was posted behind the counter. Now, it has been redesigned and placed in front of the window, grossly printed in a faux-hipster, Courier derivative. 
Thirdly, they play loud, upbeat, top 20 music, which reminds one of a boba teashop. 
Finally, the place has been cleaned and repainted: the many years of grease and aging that gave Beeps an air of legitimacy has vanished. As I sat eating my 1/4 pounder (without fries), which was sandwiched by some sort of spongy bun that I'm sure the owners think classifies as 'artisanal', I reflected on the sad fact that this is no longer the Beeps that I had grown to love, but a trumped up imposter parroting the outrageously priced burger establishments which litter the city, providing only such weak defense as the ode to Neiman Ranch beef that takes up the center of their menu.
Honestly, it's not even that good. So if you're going to pay an arm and a leg, you might was well go buy an actual $15 burger on Valencia somewhere.
author: Stephen D.

description: Great Old School Burgers for a OG! One of the last great burger joints in SF. Give it a try instead of the near by McD's. Keep local  restaurants in business.
author: David T.

description: So I just went back and ordered my burger medium rare and, oh man oh man, what a difference, enough to give this place another star.  My burger was super delicious.
author: John G.

description:
Less than $5 for a juicy, delicious burger and steak fries? Can you get a better deal than that?

Beep's is conveniently located near my house and it has become my biggest guilty pleasures. I always stick with the 1/4 lb basket and have never left disappointed. My tummy is always happy as well as my wallet =). I love In N Out, but I would rather get a Beep's burger over it.

The people who work here are always super friendly and engaging. I haven't tried anything else on the menu but the workers have highly suggested the salmon burger. If you want a quality style burger at a cheap price that triumps over any fast food joint, Beep's is the place to go.

*Cash only
author: Surge C.

description:
I love the half-pound Beep's Burger and Steak Fries.  
Thank you to Samantha Wong for saving this landmark.
http://www.ielightsf.com/2014/11/11/the-start-of-a-comeback-for-beeps-burgers/
author: Geri S.

description: Beep burger with cheddar and bacon was delicious! Todd off with a great shake. Good service and great location
author: Bob S.

description: Good old fashioned drive in. (When I was growing up these places with the neon signs were all over San Francisco) this is one of a couple still surviving. Food like back in the 60s with 90s prices. If you stick to burger's and Fry's you won't be disipointed.
author: David U.

description: Really good burger and criss cut fries. Not sure if it was a fluke but I will def be going back to give it another try. A little on the pricey side but almost anywhere you go for burgers now would have about the same price.
author: Reginald A.

description: I love this place. it recently changed their menu and the beeps burger is off the chain. i also put grilled onions and my mushrooms with onion rings on the side and a milk shake soooooo good!!! & cheap!
author: Fred K.

description: I always used to drive past this place when I used to live here so it was nice to get an opportunity to try it out. Walked up and ordered a 1/4 lb burger along with fries. The seating is all outdoors. I almost finished my burger, but I was full between that and the fries.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I'm staggered that McDonald's is still in business, with Beep's just a couple blocks away.  Beep's burger might be a little shy of sirloin, but it does not taste overly fatty or filled, and you'd pay far more anyplace else for comparable.

Blissfully, there was plenty of parking.  I went up to the window to order, and was torn between fries and onion rings, so I asked the girl which she'd recommend.  She didn't offer much in the way of guidance, just a 'they're both good, and a shrug.'  What she should have said to me was, "Start with the Fries. You'll definitely be back and can try the onion rings later."  

The fries are worth stopping for all on their own.  

Beep's may not be a destination per-se, but if you're in the neighborhood, you can go here with confidence that you'll get a classic American meal at an outstanding value.  

Note:  Cash only, and not much in the way of seating (a little outdoors, only).
author: Theresa B.

description:
I ordered the 1/4 with grilled onions and the fries
That was just so tasty and the patty has a unique touch to it, definitely coming back
author: J. V.

description: I've been going to beeps since I was a kid for about 20 years. One of my favorite items was the pork chops and eggs with rice and cabbage. Well I just ordered this and my pork chop was dry no sauce no cabbage which is pretty much the main reason I ordered this for years. It was just a bunch of rice dry pork chop and a small fried egg which was dry also. I'm very disappointed, I don't know if it's a new owner of this newly remodeled place but I won't be going back anytime soon. Get your ish together Beeps!
author: Mario H.

description:
WTF happened to the old beeps?! Over a month ago i came here and i noticed they upgraded the menu signs. No more saying the shortened #12. Instead - quarter pound burger with fries. BUT.. food was still the same as it always was and still affordable. 

Fast forward to today. My God.I feel like Im reliving McDreamy's death again.  I come here with that same loving feeling/craving I usally have for Beeps, and I already knew by the price hike and their NEIMAN RANCH BEEF! sign that the world had ended. No longer is there the simple goodness of a charbroiled burger made with frozen beef patties topped onto a sesamie seed bun (what is it now, buttered Brioch?). I never noticed if grilled onions was an additional charge but they charge you for that. And their steak fries are now anorexic and flavorless. 

They give you too many options, what kind of cheese you want, and fries..they have the new regular, curly, and garlic. I'm thoroughly disappointed because the burger taste like most burger places and even though they use better meat, it's actually less flavorful and kinda dry. 

I don't know if the change is because of what San Francisco is becoming and if they're trying out the whole ..your food is raised locally and all natural, but Beep's has been the one place I would go to to get away from restaurants like that because they all taste the same and sometimes you just want an old fashion drive in burger...BEEPS! 

They might as well change the name because the Beep's we all love and know is basically dead. Don't fix what aint broken. At least give us the option for what a lot of us know as the original burgers.
author: Mila B.

description:
I used to rave about this place and always recommended to friends and coworkers but after today's experience I am not going back.
First of all it is OK to raise your prices but don't lower the quality of the food.
What happened to sesame bun? Why did you change from Iceberg lettuce to Romaine lettuce (not cool)?
The fries are different and not as tasty.
The burger patty used to be full of flavor and juicer, now they just drip fat.
Second don't be like oh we raised our prices so takes it or leave it.
the best place on ocean ave to eat just became like the guys down the street
author: Ned T.

description:
Why go to McDonald's when Beeps is just a block away?

Retro drive-up joint with piping hot greasy goodness to back up that throwback feel. The food is cooked - or should I say "fried?" - to order, and the staff is quick, efficient, and pretty no-nonsense. The pricing is really affordable, and it's just a great all-around value with a nostalgic feel.

If you're in the area, definitely check this one out. :)
author: Audrey J.

description:
My dear friends family lives off ocean and when we need a quick fix theres no other place around s.f. like Beeps! Great old school burger joint. I love Onion rings,& a yumeye vanilla malt every now and then and they do it right. 
Fast, friendly service with a smile.....
author: Connie B.

description:
Beep's was great, and should be 5 stars. They recently changed a lot of their recipes, and now it isn't. I applaud the efforts to fix things up, and try different stuff out, but I'm not happy with Beep's the way things are now.

I miss the steak fries. The new burgers are dry. Some more sauce could help that out, and I can ask for more sauce, but I don't want to have to do that every time.

I can live with the increased prices. It's SF, and you gotta do what you gotta. I'll still probably go occasionally, but I no longer go with any regularity.

Also, I love the people. Great service.
author: Steven B.

description:
Not So Grate value!

Still Nice people

Increase of 57% in one shot.

1/4 lb Burger & Fries
Last month = $5.40
This month = $8.50

This *WAS* a cool food for students. I guess they don't consider students an important customers.

:(
author: BigJohnS F.

description: When you pass by Beep's you may question yourself about that small little window where people place their order, that big parking lot.."is it good, is it a nasty burger, i'm hungry what should i do" that's why i decided to write this review, because despite the first impression that may not be a big deal when you look at beep's, the food is REALLY GOOD! The fries are fresh, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside  the burger has fresh ingredients and the meet is well done. Really worth stoping by if you want a fair priced and tasty burguer
author: Nicole M.

description: I've been coming here a few times a year for many years. I just stopped on my way home and discovered the 5.75 burger fries combo is no longer and if you buy it separately is now $9 its still tasty but way to expensive for a burger stand. Apparently there are new owners who are driving away there customer base and too stupid to realize it. Alas I will return no more.
author: Bill K.

description: I'll start this with "I used to love this place!" I understand new owners took over and things change, prices go up, etc... I can live with that.. What used to be a great deal for a damn good burger is now an expensive, average burger that doesn't come with the fries any more. That's still not the worst of it. The last 3 times I've been here, over the last few months, I've been short changed everytime. I caught it at the counter. Each time was $1 or $2 short. Not a lot. But if you do that to everybody, I bet that adds up to a good chunk of cash at the end of the day. I'd be curious to hear if anyone else has noticed the same thing since the new owners took over. And it wasn't the same girl all 3 times. One did it twice and a different girl the other time. Avoid the cheats at all costs. If you do go there, ASK FOR A RECEIPT and COUNT YOUR CHANGE!
author: Dave M.

description: No longer have the combo fries and burger and smaller burger prices are way up I want the old French Fries I will not be returning was a customer sense the late 80's
author: Kevin S.

description:
The new owners have done an incredible job at streamlining the menu and increasing the quality of their ingredients. Their service is also better with brighter more attentive staff. I'll pay the added cost any day of the week for this kind of service and tasty high quality ingredients.

Ps. I'd like to challenge anyone who dares to call their food over priced or mediocre. Where can you get a burger this quality at the price tag of $6 in this day and age? Most restaurants serving low quality burgers charge $10 at the very least and if you want high quality, you're looking at $20. It's San Francisco people. It's a bargain and please don't compare them to McDonald down the street. It's a crime punishable by death. Oh wait, you are already dying slowly from eating McDonald's lol
author: Gregory W.

description:
I used to think this place was an awesome part of this neighborhood, but with the new management, I think some of their changes are for the worse. 

They got rid of the basket meals, and their fries changed from the classic, thick-cut steak fries to generic ones that you might find at burger king. The prices have shot up -- a meal to feed my fam used to cost me about 24 bucks here, but with the baskets gone and the price for a rather small basket of fries at 2.75, my total shot up to 37 bucks last time I went. 

I appreciate that they have added veggie burgers and such, so for a while I had hopes that the changes were for the better. But making the prices this high and removing a feature on the menu is a big no-no. The only thing that hasn't changed at this point about Beep's from the place I remember from 10 years ago are the local homeless folk. (They are very polite).
author: V L.

description: Veggie burgers are actually good. They definitely don't taste like the pre-frozen patties that other places throw on the grill for non-meat eaters. Place is outdoors, and not much seating area available, but it's still a good stop.
author: Sandy P.

description:
This place is pretty unassuming. It has a cool old sign that I suspect is the same as when they opened in the 60's. The food was pretty good, but nothing amazing.

I got the half-pound special (#11). It is a very straight-forward burger with thick-cut fries. I think there is a special sauce on it, but I wasn't sure - something orange-colored. If there was, I didn't really taste it. The burger tasted good; the meat was fine; the bread was fine. The fries were nice.

This was about what I expected going in, and the price is low. I would take this over most fast food burgers, but I would pick In-n-Out over it.

Cash only, by the way.
author: Ryan C.

description: A bit pricy, but the burger was delicious and was worth it. The Twinkie milkshake was amazing as well! Flavor, speed, and service were all great. Had a 1/2 pound beep burger with egg bacon and cheese.
author: Ricky L.

description:
The french fries! They are the only reason I come here! They are so delicious. But other than that, the food isnt so great at all.

Pros: parking lot, french fries, nice cashier lady, reasonable prices

Cons: food takes a loong time, so eating spaces, poor tasting food(other than french fries) 

Bottom line: the food is worth what you pay for.
author: Belle Z.

description: Beep's has provided me with some reliable clutch meals over the years. They remodeled recently and look cleaner. Their salmon burger was really delicious and the menu is cheap compared to other SF restaurants. Definitely a go to if you're on a cheap budget.
author: Dan G.

description:
OK. This place is a drive up restaurant. Luckily there was parking. My friend had recommended it when he had dined there after his night class. I went and got what he and the cashier recommended which was a 1/2 lb burger. I got it with fries and a fruit punch drink. It took about 5 minutes but when I got it I brought it to the city college parking lot and was pleasantly surprised that the fries were steak fries.

Obviously steak fries are bigger and tastier than normal fries. I should have asked for more napkins, and the 4 ketchup packets was barely enough. The burger though, was really good, especially for the price. The burgers were well done, lettuce, tomato, pickle and some sort of sauce I couldn't put my finger on. I believe I only payed 7.50 so I gave a $1 tip. For the price, this place deserves 5 stars. You get solid bang for your buck. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but if I want to put on calories after burning them at 24 hour fitness or eat before a night class, it is the spot to go. Definitely better than Ocean Pizza.

Next time, I will try the Philly cheese steak or the chicken sandwich.
author: Marty J.

description:
Can anyone say "helllla good?"

Awesome burgers, chicken nuggets, awesome fries, etc! Good shakes, good prices. Just a great place to get your fast food fix. Yum!
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
Seeing the reviews, and having had good food from here as a kid, I thought I'd give the place a shot. 

No wonder I hadn't returned since my childhood. 

At $2.40, I got what looked like onion rings straight out of an Ore-Ida bag, and the pineapple milkshake...for SHAME to call such a weak concoction worthy of $2.90. 

Never coming back, until a substantial change occurs. 

Person at the window was friendly and courteous, such that it was noteworthy.
author: Mar R.

description:
It tastes fine. y fine i mean it was food and it was swallow-able. The food is obviously frozen byproducts deep fried or stove fried. It's not great. it's not even good. it's just mediocre. But that's not why this place got 2 stars. It got two stars because when I went their they had a huge fly infestation inside it. Workers were swatting flies while cooking my food. They did not wear gloves either. It was very gross and unappetizing.
I don't know who said this was French , but they lied.
author: Vinny T.

description: This place has been my go to burger jam for a while now, and it never lets me down. I would give it 5 stars if not for the fact that they're slightly overpriced. I read some reviews saying they're trying to grab at hipster dollars, which is a fair assumption, but the way I see it is that they are keeping up with food trends to stay in business. If not, they would most likely have been bulldozed already and turned into another stupid condo unit with some kind of craft toothpaste emporium on the bottom. I hate bougie food, so I don't say something like this easily: they changed for sure, but all the changes were still not enough to keep this place from being what it authentically is: a drive in burger place with no indoor seating. If you want to get a lot of food for a better price I recommend not getting a soda, I think they are particularly stingy on prices with that. Also they do that thing where they assume you don't want it with cheese so you have to pay extra, so that's kind of annoying. But the meat is really bomb and I really like whatever the sauce is that they use. For sure in my top 3 eating establishments on Ocean Ave
author: Charlie T.

description: It's way too greasy, it's probably not something you want to eat every day if you're young. If you're older you don't eat here at all!! The burgers actually pretty good, but it's way overpriced almost $9 for a burger, there's no combos so you can't get burger fries and drinks, you have to buy each thing separately which ends up to be around 15 16 bucks.
author: Ray K.

description:
Erm. I get food here when I'm too lazy and poor to buy an actual meal.

Beep's is super greasy and super fast food-ish. Their shakes are pretty good but a little on the sweet side.

Burgers, nuggets, and plates are all pretty greasy. Albeit, it tastes pretty good but I really question what I'm putting into my body.

I would go to this place but I think people are rating it just a little high.
author: Winè C.

description: Prices rose up the last time I went there. I respect the place very well because I know two workers that work there.
author: Michelle K.

description: Pretty good burger joint. Burger was juicy and toppings tasted great. Fries were well seasoned and crispy. Small fountain soda comes with just enough to wash it all down. I love the outdoor counter seating too.
author: Hill E.

description:
Came by to see what the hype was on this pineapple shake. 
It was ok...reminded me of a sherbert. It wasn't cold enough...I will have to try the burgers next time.
author: Ron P.

description:
This place is so good. The fish and cheese sandwich is tbe best ive ever had and the fries and onion rings are good as well.  

You have to eat outside or take it to go but if you need a quick bite this will provide you a delicious meal on the go.
author: Petey F.

description: Food was great, although it wasn't southern great but it was still good. The ranch dressing could have been better but the wings were good and so were the potato wedges
author: Ashib R.

description:
I was hungry with a craving for something fried... all I thought of was the food that I was making up in my head. I had a budget so I didn't want to go too far so I opted to go out and not too far. I passed this place quite a couple times but never actually ate here. To my surprise this place is more like those drive-in's that are severely in need of justice. I came down there by review of the others but I decided... in order to take the actual test you would have to go there personally and try out. 

What to expect / what did I get:

- Double fish sandwich /w cheese & steak fries


Think about it guys this stuff is made to order. So basically they won't make it until you're ready. This is a typical for a diner also but since its not-so-late and I was starving I needed to get a bite. Originally I wanted to get an extra order of onion rings but this tells me that I may have to make another trip back here sometime soon.  The Dbl fish was great, the steak fries came out crispy and hot!! It wasn't missing much and the lady that I took my order from was really nice. good 10 or so minutes to wait for my food but if you're patient you reap the reward. by far... I'm gonna go old school at this joint and get a shake to go next time. 

I recommend this place to anybody that is in the general area.

*RANT* 
 I try to steer away from mass produced meals like McDonald's because usually their stuff nowadays lack taste and since much of the major food chains need to have a stamp of approval of the calorie content and nutrition its starting to become a health fanatic type of deal now. I dislike how its starting to trend out. The difference in a meal is probably the quality or 'taste'. Those are two factors that come up when eating much.. 

Anyways, hope this helps and happy food hunting all :3
author: Xeirhen V.

description:
Beep's has a plethora of burgers/sandwiches, fried items including chicken nuggets and fish and chips, milkshakes, teriyaki bowls and tacos too.  

Their cheeseburgers aren't the best but considering the price and pretty large size of the burger, it's better than your average fast food burger joint.  I do like the soft sesame seed bun of the burger.  As mentioned, try the pineapple milkshake.  It can be a bit sweet as it tastes like straight up vanilla ice cream and blended pineapples but its definitely a nice treat.  

Service is generally good but food can take longer than expected even when you're the only customer there.  Beep's has its own parking lot but is easily accessible by public transportation.  While you're waiting for your order to fry up, feel free to sit in your car and wait or you can even stand outside and watch all the bustling people and buses/streetcars pass by.
author: Maya S.

description:
This place is just okay. Everything I have had here has been between being just edible and pretty basic. 

Chicken teriyaki bowl: dry rice and the chicken was very fatty
Philly cheese steak: tasty but not mouthwatering. Needs more cheese and less dry meat.
Burger: very sub par
Fries: just okay

For the price you don't get much and there isn't much seating. (Outdoor seating)
author: Brie S.

description: This place has a new owner and had some renovations. The new menu includes Niman ranch ground beef. Big improvement! Yummy sweet potato fries and even the bun on the hamburger tasted fresh and gourmet.
author: D M.

description: After an evening news segment about Beep's remaining open (but with different management), and on my way to Pineapples, I decided to check this place out.  Instead of a burger, I ordered a Philly cheesesteak, which includes beef, melted cheese, onions, and bell peppers. After the sandwich was done and wrapped in parchment paper, then wrapped again in foil, and placed in a bag, the melted cheese still leaked out and spilled on my passenger seat; kinda gives you an idea of how cheesy the sandwich is.  Aside from the mess, the cheesesteak was still very tasty; the beef: tender.  A bit messy, but I'd recommend it nonetheless.  There is only 1 picnic table if you wanted to sit; otherwise, find a spot at the counter or take it to go.  A classic, nostalgic place; I will return to try their burger and strawberry shake.
author: Jessica S.

description: Excellent.  Burgers.  Chicken nuggets.  Onion Rings.
author: Sarah w.

description: I love Beeps Burgers. Their chocolate milkshake is so good, their chicken nuggets are the tastiest and their fries are great. I love Beeps. Staff is always nice too. Very clean place.
author: Calli J.

description: Haven't tried the burgers but hear they are good.  What I keep coming back for are the twinkie milkshakes.  Nice little chunky twinkie goodness in a delicious fresh milkshake.  Sooo good!  Tried nutella one and couldn't really taste it so now am an exclusive twinkie man...and I don't even normally like twinkies!  Only one negative: bunch of scums like to hang out nearby on Ocean Ave.
author: Desmo K.

description: I can honestly say that the burgers are good. girl at the window wasn't to pleasant . My son got the chicken strips with curly fries and that was okay. I was bothered with the girl handing out the food. I thought long hair had to be put up when handling food...
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I wasn't hungry but I wanted to be fat. So I ordered...

1/2lb special(1/2lb burger with steak fries):
- burger was juicy but not very well seasoned
- veggies were fresh
- buns were pretty boring but they held up nicely 
- fries were HOT and pretty damn good actually

and I also ordered 6 mini corn dogs:
- batter was thick and crispy
- almost reminded me of funnel cake, delicious!

To my surprise, the food is good for the price but it was any more than that then I would rather just go to in-n-out

They have a table and a few stools outside so I would plan on eating in your car or taking it home to eat.
author: Harry T.

description: Good burgers and fries, great customer service, not bad at all...............................
author: Johnny D.

description: I don't if I am the only person feel something in my stomach after I finish the Berger, sandwich, flies... Big proportion of food, oily a little bit. The favor was ok. If you have time, please go further.
author: Yu F.

description: Beeps, one of the last old school burger joints. You gotta love it. Where else can you get a burger and steak fries for unde $5? And a freshly made burger and fries, not premade and sitting there like a fast food joint. They also have other stuff like tacos, fish sandwiches, cheesesteaks, and chicken nuggets. But my favorite is the teriyaki. I love getting the combo teriyaki: beef, chicken and shrimp. Yum.
author: Dom L.

description:
I basically moved to this neighborhood to be closer to Beeps. My crew comes here all the time, and we have never been disappointed, and we get disappointed pretty easily.  OK I get disappointed pretty easily.

Anyway, Beeps is.... swell.  Just stick to the burgers, because they are fantastic.

UPDATE 4/29/15:

Beeps has switched to higher quality meat, and the results have moved Beeps from swell, to fantastic, to MAGICAL. They are a tad more expensive, which is fine by me. They also now have fried tater-tots and curly fries, so I'll be moving into Beeps any day now. I don't need much space. Don't make this weird Beeps.

Nicely done, Ms. Wong. I also appreciate the face-lift on the sign. It has cleaned up Ocean Avenue while maintaining the retro spirit. I will continue to recommend Beeps as a delicious and convenient burger joint.
author: Farrell W.

description: Their veggie burgers are the best I ever had. I believe they're made out if brown rice ( maybe I'm wrong), but they're moist and seasoned to perfection. Tomatoes, onions , pickles and the regular condiments are slathered on the buns. American , Swiss and another kind of cheese can be added for a little more. Their buns are flavorful and I believe add to the overall greatness of my favorite veggie burger, ever. I've been coming here for ten years. $6 can get you fries with that! Even though management changed the food remains the same and the staff is friendly!
author: Natalie B.

description: I recently just moved into the neighborhood and saw this place. I immediately thought to myself...this place is either going to be horribly greasy sliders or amazingly delicious under the radar burgers. I was very pleasantly surprised to find the latter. Love their fries, love their burgers and their shakes are good too. An awesome pleasant surprise.
author: m p.

description:
Had a friend pick me up a burger, fries and coke while I waited for the shop to come and fix my bus. (49 Van Ness)
Ehhh it was ok I guess, something to eat during my layover the next time I drive that line.
author: Shaun R.

description: This is a good all American diner for burgers and malts. American food at it's best. America!
author: S C.

description: I love there burger and fries!!! Soooo good. And also, you guys should try their ice cream and milk shake too!!!
author: Tien T.

description:
burgers and fries are cooked to order so you get them hot.  low pricing includes fries.
would be a cool place to eat outside if it weren't for some questionable folks hanging about.  last time we were there - my son didn't know what to think of the half open robe-wearing guy wearing absolutely nothing underneath.
author: n y.

description: Great burgers and location. You get that fresh feeling when you eat there. Pricing is a little high. But it's business. The staff there are pretty welcoming as well as friendly. I'd recommend this place easily.
author: Mike H.

description:
Beeped again. After my duty as taxi service to pick up my student @ City College. 

Yes, you get to dine among people some of  which are of undetermined gender from City College (one of whom was shouting obscenities into their cell phone, not in an angry way ... just another conversation, at Beeps) , as well as the "reflective vest" crowd who work and hang out along highways. Don't even think about tossing a piece of bun or french fry to the bird who is stalking you..... did so and a flock  of pigeons (maybe 50 of them) descended. 

Mostly a "to go" joint although there is "counter" seating (normally where the peep's of undetermined gender "hang") and a cheap plastic park bench thing that services as their dining area.

Ok, I am a hamburger fan. The best hamburger in the world ... ahh no.
Fresh ... yes ( onion & tomato slice, served on a sesame seed bun).
Not a joint for Kobe beef burger on foccacia, with heirloom tomato and a side salad of arugula. But hey, this is Beep's, NOT Michael Mina.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
fresh patty, tasty

fries were delicious

cheap
author: Long C.

description:
Beeps Burgers is delicious & cheap. Their burgers are huge, they'll fill you up. I love their French fries cause I could actually taste the potato, not just oil & fried outer shell. 

Sucks that there's really nowhere to sit, just a bench outside & some high chairs.
author: Connie Y.
