description: i love this place. good and relatively cheap. good for late night cravings for some burgers, fries and chicken wings.
author: p f.

description:
Stay away, don't bother. You're better off getting a Big Mac.

With four out of five stars I had to give this place a try. I was not happy at all with my first visit a few weeks ago, so I went back today with same disappointing results.

Burger is nothing more than a frozen patty that lacks any taste. Looks like they don't know the word seasoning here. Frys are the wedged kind that are limp and soggy, fried in the same oil they fry everything else so you can definitely taste the fish patties in there, hate to see what those taste like.

By the looks of this place it has been many years, it's a shame that a place with a great location and plenty of parking is now serving this atrocious food.

CASH ONLY signs everywhere make you wonder why they don't take cards?
 
I just want to find a decent greasy burger with that meaty taste is that so hard to find in this city?
author: Raw W.

description: Best burger in the hood and you know why! Gotta love the old-school drive-up burger joint across the street from a Whole Foods. Tasty, in expensive and worth every gooey bite. There are only a few outdoor places to eat so consider sitting on the hood of your car!
author: Tim H.

description: First timer. Delicious and delicious. Split a 1/2 lb burger w my husband for an afternoon snack. With fries and a pineapple shake we were very satisfied.  Everything was solid, the staff was friendly, and the outside benches were kept clean.  Kudos to everyone at Beeps!
author: Maxine C.

description: Absolutely love their chicken sandwiches. I've lived in the area for awhile and its hands down the place to go for burgers and delicious fries. Go get beeps !!
author: Brittany B.

description: I need more stars!! Ok so I'm a burger fan and I love a good medium rare burger that is hot and juicy. Beeps is literally the best burger I have ever had in my life. 1/2 lb burger medium rare with a fried egg on top!!! You guys rock
author: John B.

description: I gave the new Beeps a try. They except credit cards, very good start. I had a 1/4 pound burger and added swiss cheese, mushrooms, onions, and an egg. With french fries and a small chocolate shake. Total was about $15. Everything was very good. Few dollars more then old owners but food to me is better and they except credit cards, I will be going more often now. Lets see if they keep up the 98 health score :)
author: Justin A.

description: Beeps,  It has gotten even better!  New owners have taken this to the next level.  Juicy burgers cooked to order, and steak fries, (my favorite) + 3 other choices. Garnish, tomato, lettuce-very fresh.
author: Robert S.

description:
Beeps has that traditional drive-in appeal, with a kind of dirty, old-school look. Sadly they don't quite live up to the hype.

It's another cash only establishment (part of its vintage quality?) and is sadly slow on orders. McDonald's is right across the street, but really, who wants to eat McDonald's - not me. The veggie burger is definitely something I could make at home, and though the fries are ok thanks to the BBQ sauce, there's nothing that really standardizes their prices to their food.

On the one occasion that I ordered the fish and chips, I found that my fried fish pieces consisted of mostly breading... Luckily I like the breading, aside from the health factor, and enjoyed it anyway. 

Eh. No more Beeps for me, thanks.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Although the chicken teriyaki burger that I picked up here was very good, about an hour later, I was visited by a horrible headache. I wouldn't have associated the two if my boyfriend, who also had a burger there, didn't come down with the exact same headache. 

I did really like that they serve steak fries though.
author: Mariko F.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  It was a cold and rainy morning. And for the $7.73 for the 1/2lb cheeseburger with fries, I could have went next door for a bowl of pho, or I could have had shacks at Quicklys.  Big mistake Dave. What were you thinking?

I ordered from a lady whose vocabulary lack the words "thank you" and "you're welcome."  It doesn't need to be a heard felt "thank you," it could be from a script for all I care, but it would be a welcome gesture none the less.  The gentleman who gave me my food is a piece of work.  He was cleaning the soft serve machine, and when my order was ready, he seemed annoyed that he had been interrupted.  He slid the food across the counter, "Here you go," all the while with a look of nuisance, as he addressed me.  No smile, no "Thank You."  Since I wasn't raised by wolves, I said "Thank You,"  to the gentleman, to which he didn't even say you're welcome, or acknowledge receipt of this courtesy.  Rude.

Now onto the food review.  I liked the spread they put on the burger.  The fries were fine for being Restaurant Depot fries.  The burger, I hated.  The double patties were burnt.  Not just a little burnt, which would actually give the meat a pleasant charcoal taste, but it was bitter and crispy burnt around the edge.  The lettuce was soggy.  

If it's poor service, and good food, or good food and poor service, I might give this place another shot.  Being what it is, I will not be coming back.
author: David M.

description: Burger appeal 5 stars, taste almost the same. You cannot go wrong here getting the burger and steal fries. Took about 10 minutes to cook up. Chicken nuggets on the other hand don't make the cut! Get em outta hereee
author: Brelin P.

description:
This place is so so great on prices and food. I've been here so much during my years in high school, especially with a best friend that lived right up the street from it. I would eat here almost two to three times a week. It was so delicious. You can even call in to order if you don't want to wait out in the cold. Yeah, the only sad part is that it is a drive-in. But everything else was good.

Things I would definitely recommend is any of their burger baskets, their fish and chips, the salmon burger, and their onion rings are pretty good too. Their fries are fat steak fries but so so crisp and aromatic, if you can even call it that. They're just addicting.

I wouldn't go for their drinks though, they don't rinse out their milkshake cups in between orders of them. It's pretty grody. But also, there's a Quickly's right next door with cheaper drinks. So perfect combination!
author: Kindley W.

description: We stopped off here to grab some food to go. Truth be told we didn't really check out the reviews so when we got here we were pleasantly surprised that it was reminiscent of an old drive-in burger joint. The menu is a bit varied so it seems somewhat suitable for different tastes. I had the turkey burger with fries and my BF had the pork and rice. We got them to go and enjoyed them at home (cause it was cold outside) -- both of them were delicious. The pork and rice was a rather big portion whereas I felt like the burger & fries was just the right amount. Overall it was great food and swift service.
author: Shauna S.

description: I heard good thing about this place so I decided to give it a try. I ordered cheese burger and the cashier said that its going to take 10 min. Thats is a long time just for a burger. Anyway, while waiting I peek through the pick up window and saw how the person behind the kitchen assemble the burger. What a surprise, he did not even wear any gloves. I hope he wash his hand beforehand. Overall its not as good as I thought. the rating definitely too high.
author: Ciyinta B.

description:
Originally I was suppose to have a study session after class with a friend but she bailed on me. It was still early in the day and my flight wasn't until 1pm. So i decided to head over to City College since my buddy who was driving me to the airport didn't get out of class till 11am. Lucky for me i have a friend tat lives around there and i called him up to see if he wanted to go eat wit me. We couldn't decide where to go at first. I pondered, I wanted something that would keep me full for a couple of hrs at least. mmm oh yea i haven't had Beeps in a while!!! Good ole Beeps hasn't changed much since when i was going to City College which i used to frequent quite regularly. 

I got the 1/4 lb with cheese and everything http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/FtNp4mjumMItQcM8paKXSw/l  and my buddy got the Philly cheese steak http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/99hUa31kAbwVNUQyVdTAzg/l and we also got the Chicken Basket http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/tF-haHhm8thrwj7oZ_yU7w/l The burger was yummy but i forgot how messy they can get if it has everything in it. I bit into it and my hand got flooded with ketchup -___-. I didn't care and proceeded to destroy tat burger!!! The Chicken Basket was only ok, nothing special so I would pass on that. My friend was saying that is Philly Cheese Steak was too scrawny and it was compared to the picture in the window however he said it was good. 

Overall beeps is still a good place to grab a burger and probably one of the places close by to City College that a lot of College students frequent. I know i did, i will probably drop by for a burger when imma in the area again. 

Note: its all take out, they have a small seating area tho. Alot of people drive up and eat in their cars.
author: Jonathan W.

description: They are not known for their salmon burgers but this is what I eat there and Im addicted.It is sooo good!The picture says it all. The avocado is extra and a must.
author: Yvette M.

description: My to go for chicken nuggets...nice and crispy and juicy inside.
author: Sandra S.

description:
A drive and park type of diner that serves great burgers! Literally, it's a grab your car, drive up there, park in front of the diner, and grab your burger kind of place. They have burgers and misc things like fish and chips.

I ordered a double quarter pounder cheeseburger with fries and totally loved it. The burger buns are regular restaurant style buns that's larger than normal. The meat they use is above average quality. It's not really fresh, but it's definitely good. The lettuce, tomato, onions, and pickles are fresh! There seems to be some kind of orange sauce they put on the burger. It tastes like ketchup with something else. The fries they have are thick cut fries and they're crispy good. The fries aren't good reheated... I suggest finishing these before they become cold.

Overall, I would say this place is a solid place to grab a burger when you're in the mood for one.
author: Steven B.

description:
It's cheap. It's delicious. It's filling. What more can a student ask for?! I love coming here to get a burger since In N Out is so far away from me. I love coming here when there's very little people. :] Food comes out so much faster, though I wonder about those milkshake cups, it doesn't seem like they ever wash those things. lol.

Anyways, I used to always get the nugget basket, it has NINE nuggets with FRIES!! c'monnn! And/or a quarter pounder with fries for what? FOURish dollars! 

Its affordable and great. (: It sucks that they have bad seating. It's usually littered with crumbs and unidentifiable stains everywhere. I try my best not to look around when I decide to dine there instead of walking home or sneaking into Quickly's. haha. Overall, if you have a car or you do not plan on eating there, it's definitely recommended as a locally-loved spot.
author: Chia W.

description:
A small burger stand/shop located near CCSF has a good reputation for good reasons. 

My friend who lives blocks away recommended I tried the place and I am glad I took him on his offer.

I ordered a  pound cheeseburger with bacon and an order of fries under $6. The wait time was mentioned 10 minutes; I was in no rush so I was ok with it. A nice juicy burger with melted cheese, strips of bacon with fresh lettuce, tomatoes and onions all on a bigger than normal bun. Only gripe is that I wish the bacon was more crispy, but its bacon so I can't complain that much. Maybe if they can grill the onions, I would fall in love with this place.

Steak fries are crispy and yummy, sprinkled some salt and a helping of ketchup I couldn't get enough of those bad boys. 

I do love pineapple so I'll be back to try that shake that some people rave about.

Treated as a drive-in I've seen multiple people drive up and order and eat in the car as outside sitting in very minimal.
author: Casey L.

description: Been going to BEEPS for many years. Always  good burger, froes, shakes, reasonably priced. Went last night. Cheese is now extra, bacon is extra. 1 cheeseburger, 1 bacon cheeseburger, 2 fries and milkshake $27.00. Got home, took a bite of byrger, long brown hair in it.......DISGUSTING. Burger went into garbage.... NO MORE BEEOS.
author: Donna S.

description: This establishment has decided to make a move that has and will continue to turn its customers away. They have raised their prices tremendously at least a 60% increase overnight! And the quality hasn't increased! I understand that minimum wage has went up but does a restaurant put that increase on its customers! With Pizza Joint just a few doors down with all the same offerings people will start to head there. The fries at $3 a basket are far few to be charging that much. The food is average. So when I get a burger fries and shake and pay $13 in that neighborhood I just feel I rather drive the extra 1/2 mile and go to In & Out for 1/2 the price!!  And just in case the new management reads this...the 2 customers that were ahead of me waiting for their order complained about the prices and the new fries. Listen to the people!
author: Samantha B.

description:
When I went to City College, this is the place I would visit even though McDonald's was nearby.  I heard this place has been here awhile.  

It would be nice if Yelp added the date of when a business was established.  This was here long before me and it seems to be one of the San Francisco favorites.
author: General P.

description: I've been coming here since high school. As a child I always passed by this place but it wasn't until high school until i got to try it. HMMMM DELISH. Their burgers, steak fries, and omfg if you are a fan of FISH AND CHIPS - then Beeps your place! It's hard to find a good fish and chip place so I'm glad Beeps is nearby and consistent with the food. I wish the fish was bigger but that would be wishful thinking. It's a decent size for a pretty good price - $5 something for 2 fish and some steak fries. I like to go home and toast it with salt for a crispier taste. I didn't realize they had milkshakes... I will need to try that sometime.
author: Kristina L.

description:
BEEP YO HORN IF YOU LIKE BEEP BEEP BEEP's! 

No joke sonny buns! Beep's Burgers has been around since my pop's attended college at City College of SF. At the time, Mickey D's wasn't even down the street either! 

There's some weathered down stools which sit right in front of Beep's which is located on the corner of Harold and Lee Street. Most of the time, I see a lot of old folks rolling up here for lunch. 

Dad and I ordered a burger since the Mickey D's establishment wasn't to our favor. We support the local mom and pop shops more than we do corporate chain restaurants. 

Beep's burgers makes McDonald's Big Mac look like slider snacks. Like for real! The chicken nuggets are good here too! I went off of one of my little sister's Yelp reviews! Thanks mui mui! 

Mind you, this place is also really old school. So its CASH ONLY!!!
author: Jason C. J.

description: Beep's Burgers is the spot. As growing up as a youngster this was the spot. Today ain't nothing changed. Luv the old school burger spot feel. A true part of Frisco history
author: Jesse C.

description: Best chicken burger and Philly cheesesteak in the area.
author: Juan W.

description:
So every time I pass this place, I'm thinking, dude, I never see anyone here, but the day I decide to try it out, I stand corrected....

So after dance practice a few friends and I walk to Beep's and I'm thinking, it's going to be quick plus all of us were in no need of Plastic-Donalds (micky d's).  As we turn the corner there was already a line and I'm thinking, ooooooh-kay, but the staff here had it down, people drove up ordered, got their food and drove away.  After 5 mins or so we got our food.  That was pretty much the pace at Beep's, car's drive up, order, drive away, so i'm thinking, Beep-Beep like a car horn...maybe that's how they got the name?

So I ordered the nuggets and fries.  It kind of reminded me of how your mom cooked nuggets and fries at home and didn't want to deal with the chain restaurants.  Actually, I would rather go to Beep's than Micky's, Beep's is A-O.K.!

Disclaimer:  Cash only
author: Edrian D.

description:
Sometimes I like a greasy cheeseburger and a lot of fries. Beep's hits the spot when that's what I want. I do like the shoestring fries better than the wedge or big fries. But whatever, they're still alright fries, and they give you a ton. 
Reading other reviews, it sounds like I need to try the milkshakes some time.
author: Rikki M.

description:
Finally tried this place after going to CCSF for over 3 years. Too embarrassed to say 4 years so I will keep it at 3.

This place is good. Burgers are fresh and they are made to order. Steak cut fries and fresh tomatoes/lettuce. Can't go wrong with the 1/2 Pounder with cheese and Fries.

In n Out got it beat by a just a tiny bit, but it's pretty close.

Would come back.
author: U L.

description: I can attest to the changes they made to this place. I used to come here a lot for their fries, which used to be really crispy. They don't make it crispy anymore unfortunately.
author: Mark Y.

description:
When I see a 4-star rating for a take-out burger stand, I think, "gotta try it." Beep's isn't located too far from 280 and thus my place, so the trip was easy and worth my time. Not quite remembering the intersection on Ocean, Beep's sign stood out in its age and size. Luckily it served as a beacon to the parking lot. Ever since I bought a car out here, a little over a year ago, dedicated lots have become really big deals to me.

I got the #11, double cheeseburger & fries, adding bacon. The occasional detailed description of the pineapple shake didn't look appetizing so I passed. With a $1 tip, I spent $8.18....a good deal though not the best I've had for a bacon cheeseburger in SF. The wait was only 10 minutes, and 5-10 was the promise. Had 9 people not ordered immediately after me, I might have received my order a minute or two sooner but it wasn't a big deal because all the food was still hot.

The burger and fries were both good. The patties were cooked to medium well or well, which is more than I want but perhaps for a volume shop and/or meat quality they want to avoid the hassle. Can't say I blame them, especially after reading some recent news reports about ground beef. Otherwise I've been a fan of steak fries ever since my mom threw that first batch of OreIdas on a baking sheet. 

I'm glad I tried Beep's in order to add it to my list. I won't be back but their core market is traffic from the CCSF and the K on Ocean Ave, where folks are willing to strip out everything but food for a strong take-out value.
author: Mike H.

description: Love this place when I went to City College this place was a must every week maybe even twice a week, they put a special sauce on all of their burgers and it is very delicious! They now accept debit cards but they do charge a little more, but they are delicious
author: Carlos F.

description: Beeps has been apart of my life for as long as I can remember. I'm so glad the taste is consistently good. 1/2 lb cheeseburger, fries and a vanilla milkshake. Mmmmm!!!! How can you go wrong with that.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Don't ever underestimate how much joy and happiness a little hole in the wall can give you. One of the cheapest places around town for some Fish 'n' Chips, it's the best bang for the buck around Ocean. A healthier alternative than McDonald's while still retaining the fast-food satisfaction that only high-cholesterol fat can give you. They've got the recipe for instant food coma. 

Sure the place lacks a dining facility entirely, but eating on top of your hood with a couple of friends every now and then builds character, especially after a long day of school. Or during school hours for that matter. 

If you can overlook the sketchy exterior and the nutrition labels, you'd be surprised at how satisfying a quick snack at this place can be. Just remember, Good health is merely the slowest possible rate at which one can die. With that said, 24 is also conveniently right down the block!

4/5 because I wouldn't be caught dead bringing a date here.
author: Andrew A.

description: I went there last week for a milkshake. Beeps is now under a new ownership.  The prices have increase, most of the great foods is gone. It was the WORST MILKSHAKE I've had in my life, It was watery
author: Denise D.

description: I've eaten here before the good was great. Ate there yesterday got a 1/2 hamburger with cheese no onions. What I got was a dried out hamburger with the meat on top of the lettuce which made it soggy and up edible with so much grease. Is this the new way to eat. Teach your employees to cook. Not just make a buck. Terrible food
author: Robert M.

description: Great place to grab a bite. Big fan of their fries with ranch dressing!
author: Nathan W.

description:
Drove past Beeps today and decided to them a try.

Ordered the standard quarter-pounder with everything and a side of fries. 

The total was less than 6 dollars which is nice for SF standards. 

Beeps also serve a lot of other food now which worries me because when you try to be a jack of all trades you usually end up being a master of none. 

Waited about 5 mins to get my food (only two people working today).

Overall the food was A-Ok. There was nothing bad about the burger, but there's nothing amazing about this place. 

Most likely will not make a trip just for Beeps, but if I'm hungry and I'm by it I'll stop by. IT's a little better than MacDonalds but not by much.
author: Steven Z.

description:
For everyone that really knows me, you'd never find me eating from a dive like this ... that's why I brought the husband.  I had to see this place for myself, since this seems to be the widely acclaimed burger joint. It attracts many locals and students, located near a residential area and across City College. 

It's a drive-by (no pun intended) fast food spot. You drive up and park (there's about 5 parking spots in front of this "take out restaurant"), and give your order to the lady behind the bullet proof window. They have combinations, such as burger/fries, shrimp/fries, terriyaki/rice, etc., each averagely priced at $5-6. Their steak fries are the best. 

And folks disputing the joint is located in a ghetto area, they're merely referring  to: (n.) an impoverished, neglected, or otherwise disadvantaged residential area of a city, usually troubled by a disproportionately large amount of crime.

Who says Lakeview is ghetto? ;)
author: Rochelle B.

description:
My family has been coming here since the 70's, and they can tell you that the management has changed more times than a hooker's panties on a busy night. I even remember when a big bag of fries was $1 here, but those days are (sadly) over. The old-fasioned wedge fries are still the same, just more expensive.

The Asian/Polynesian dishes that have been added to the menu are SCREAMIN'. I really think adding them to the menu put the "beep" back in Beep's, because they stay busy until closing! The best times to avoid a crowd and long lines is after 6PM. During the day, it tends to be a hangout for the CCSF crowd and ghetto hoodrats with nothing to do. I live across the street, so I know!
author: Maurice R.

description:
Definitely a fan of this place. Went here a few years ago and had a good experience and now that I'm attending City College I tried it out again and will probably become a regular here. Pricing is very good. Food is very good. Make sure you put salt on your fries!

Forget the McDonald's that is one block away!! Beep's is the way to go!
author: Randy C.

description: Ignore the haters. The new menu is great. Vast improvement over the old version. We live up the street and will be back. Kudos to the new owners.
author: robert h.

description:
Really good prices, and really good food! A good place to get munchie food and dinner as well! Me and the hubby finally went and tried them the other day and was very pleased that we did! Hard to find a mom and pops burger stand in sf that is actually good!

I had the fish and chips and the hubby had a double cheeseburger mine was good! And he wouldnt let me take a bite of his so it was probably equally as awesome! I like the old school vibe of eating in your car after you get your order, or you can also take it to go and enjoy it at home! ;)
author: Miriam H.

description: I was excited to try this place. I had a bacon burger and onion rings. The meat was dry. The buns reminded me of cheap elementary school cafeteria bread. You can't even taste the onion in the onion rings because there's so little onion in them. If all you want is something to take up space in your stomach for a while. This place will do.
author: Luke W.

description:
One of the last old school dives - a drive-up! Been eating here for around 30 years.

Burgers are solid old school american, and the fryer is a place of wonderment.
Special mentions:
Hot Dogs; one of the two best grilled hotdogs in town - I like me a double dog w/cheese!
Shakes - thick & delish.
Mini-corn dogs. Yum.
Fries - I get 'em crispy style for maximum enjoyment. These are my favorite fries in SF, even more so than Frites. It's a big order for the price, too.

Pass on:
Cheese steak is pretty sub-par.

Oh, very reasonable prices, but it's cash-only, so run into the bubble-tea place next door & use their ATM.
author: Jamesy T.

description:
This place is old-school.  A real throwback.  A throwback to a time I can't remember because I'm young, not old, and being young rocks.

I ordered the half-pound burger basket.  Two beef patties, two slices of american cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, on a bun.  The burger was decent.  The beef was good, not great, and in my opinion they overcoook their burgers.  After biting into the burger, I saw no pink, and I love the pink.

The fries are steak fries and were mediocre at best.  They probably came from a bag of frozen fries that had been sitting in a freezer for a cool minute.

The service wasn't that good, but what do you expect, it's a roadside hamburger stand.  Low prices and lots of menu options.  If I come back I may have to try one of their fish sandwiches.
author: Brad R.

description:
Beep's for me is def. a hit or miss. Sometimes when I come here it is ok and the fries are crispy not soggy and other times their mini corn dogs taste like someone pulled them out of the freezer.

If your getting drunk at the local dive bar across the street then this is the place to go. If your trying to impress someone steer clear....
author: Lisa W.

description:
I used to come here every so often when I was in high school with an ex-boyfriend (he knew how to impress a young and googly-eyed 15- year old). Beep's is one of them hole-in-the-wall-joints-that's-kinda-in-a-dodgy-area-but-not-really-cuz-city-college-is-around-the-corner-so-there-are-a-lot-of-students-around-so-really-there-is-nothing-to-be-afraid-of-and-you're-just-weaksauce-cuz-look-at-all-these-elderly-Chinese-folks-walking-around...

Anyway, I always (used to) get the steak sandwich or the beef/chicken combo plates. I dunno if it's under the same ownership still, but if it is, they're Asian, so the rice plates are mighty tasty! Food is dirt cheap, too :)

And yeah, they've got a small lot for parking and some outdoor benches and tables. But I never ate there. I always took my greasy grub back home to the boroughs of South San Francisco ;)
author: Julie B.

description:
This place is good if youre looking for some quickly made cheap food, that isnt from Mc Donalds. The portions are pretty big for being so cheap-- Like, 4 dollars for a burger and fries, which is what i usually get. Milkshakes are pretty good too-- the only time ive ever had a weird one was when a new girl made it.

Its not the best burger ive had, but for the price, I will return soon. If you dont want to eat outside of this place, call your order in before picking up. And make sure you have cash!
author: Alison A.

description:
Have not been in years but from what I remember: Yuk - They Suck!
I know some of my friends that enjoy this place weekly, I just can't do it.
This place makes me cringe when I drive by because it is so ghetto. But I have been to some places IN the ghetto that are better than Beeps. So I can not give them more than 2 stars. I would rather pay $15 for a Joe's Cable Car burger ANY DAY than go to Beeps!
author: Bella B.

description:
Beeps is bomb.  Cheap, delicious, and made to order.  It definitely beats going to a fast food chain.  

This place doesnt only have burgers and fries though.  they also have chicken teriyaki bowls, cheesesteaks, fish and other random things. 

It brings an old fashion feel to ocean ave.  

Go there!
author: Jason D.

description:
Beeps is a really good Burger place.  Their food has that burger joint quality that keeps me coming back.  Large meat patties, big buns, grilled food, crispy fries.  Man, it makes me want to go back right away.  Their pineapple shakes are great!  Pricing is surprisingly low for a shake.  

The only way Beeps could improve is if they had inside seating.  When you go, you have to plan it as take out.
author: David L.

description:
It's a fast food joint; fast, cheap and easy. It's not a five star restaurant at the Marina. I find it a bit ridiculous for those one-star ratings to complain about the food, seating arrangements, location, etc. You should know what you're getting into when you approach this place.

I LOVE Beeps. 
It's cheap. Beep's takes into consideration the budget of the starving students' from City College across the street. You want a drink? Pay the extra buck for it. I don't know of ANY restaurant (fast food or sit down) around SF that doesn't charge for a drink. Hell, McDonald's meal without a drink would still be cheaper than if you were to by the extra value with the drink. 

It's fast. 10 minutes? Come on; it's a bit of a stretch. 5 minutes, yes, but 10? You must have been starving for what you perceived to be an eternity.

It's filling. I don't need to have a 5 course meal to fill me up. A veggie burger and fries goes a long way for me.

It's delicious. Condiments, salt and pepper work wonders, and everyone knows that's the key to good flavor. Without them, EVERYTHING would be bland.

What more could you want? Seating? There's a park bench nearby. It's full? Well make a new friend. They'll make space for you. Perhaps you like the bar atmosphere. Find a stool or stand at the window. That's why it's there. To set your food. Perhaps it's a bit too cold for you. Eat in your car (for those who have one). Or simply take the food "TO GO" and eat where you feel most comfortable.

All things considered, Beeps meets my expectations of what a fast food joint should be. Therefore, 5 stars!
author: Noemi P.

description: My legs were shaking as hunger hyper-encroached my gut that afternoon, as I approached this retro burger-stand. Their cheeseburgers and thick-cut steak fries were pretty good. The prices are of good value. It was windy that afternoon, but it did not affect the rating.
author: Derek N.

description:
I grew up in this neighborhood and have passed Beep's time and time again, always curious but never ate there. It always just looked so ghetto. The other day, I finally gave it a try. I figured it's a burger joint, go with the standard - a 1/4lb burger w/ cheese, fries, and the pineapple shake. 

I liked the pineapple shake. If you've ever had one of those large sheet sponge cakes with the fruit and whipped cream like frosting from a Chinese bakery, imagine that in a liquid form and that's what the pineapple shake tastes like. 

The fries were fresh and hot when I got them. They are big thick fries, fried to that nice golden color, very crispy on the outside, almost like potato chips, and soft like mashed potatoes on the inside. I liked the color and textures, but I thought the flavor was just very potatoe-y...I mean which is understandable since they are potatoes, but I like more seasoning on my fries. Though some of the mustard from my burger got on the fries and that was quite tasty. 

I made the mistake of waiting until I got home to eat the burger, which was a 20 minute walk. So of course the burger was cold. But I still enjoyed it. The burger had a very nice charbroiled aroma and matching flavor to it. A good proportion of pickle, tomato, and onion to meat and bread. Not too much ketchup or mustard. I thought it was a decent burger overall. 

It was good. Not great. Not bad. and being that it's so close to city and in my neighborhood, I'll probably go back again. The guy before me had ordered the fish sandwich and that sounded quite tasty. Maybe I'll try it next.
author: Katherine T.

description: This little spot is an oldie, but goody!  Still serving fresh foods made to order, gotta love BEEP's in the year round wintery/fall'ish seasons that SF has to offer.  Especially, while in transit you can pick up food to go and be on your way!  Every time we go ... we normally get the same items off of the menu... which is the link and fish sandwiches, and the french fries (((all to go))). Typical city food, and both excellent choices on the menu!  Link sandwich is a nice size, but probably quite small.
author: PureClass M.

description:
Solid place to get a great burger or my favorite, the philly cheesesteak. Not really much to go from beyond there, except that i really wish that they had some other cheese selection than fuxin american cheese. Puke. If they had swiss or something, i'd be there at least once or twice a week.

Don't both with anything with rice, it's a burger joint, and their rice sucks.
author: Spencer T.

description: A gem here in the Oceanview district of San Francisco. Its been original for years and always have good service. right acorss from the community college in san francisco so expect it to be busy sometimes....CASH ONLY...Good size burgers and other goodies like fish n chips and fish burgers....
author: David C.

description: I ate here for the first time and found it quite good. I ordered a 1/2 lb burger, chicken strips, and fried shrimp for the family.  The fries were crisp and fresh. The hamburger was pretty good.  Definitely better then what some reviewers suggested.
author: Bjj P.

description: OH Beeps, My favourite place to go when I'm trying to keep it simple, be cheap and not go to McDonalds. Is the food amazing? No. Do I expect it to be mind-blowingly good? No. When you can get a quarter pound burger and a side of fries for less than $5.50 I'm not really going to complain about quality of food. Super convenient if you go to CCSF Ocean Campus to grab a bite after class or  on your way home. A great alternative to Mcdonalds a block away; makes you feel less guilty. The staff is great, they listen to your order and remember your face. The wait can be a little long if there are a bunch of people in front of you waiting for their orders but be patient, the staff is normally less than 3 people and I've never waited more than ten minutes. Now would I ever venture off to ordering the new things they offer? No, keep it simple (burgers and fries) and you wont be let down.
author: Leah C.

description: Great burger spot! Very low key but they serve their purpose and definitely delivers. There's nothing I love the most when I have a good burger for a really good price. Conveniently located right by city college of SF.
author: J C.

description: Perfect fast food burger and decent fries. I was so glad that I took that wrong turn and ended up on ocean ave. I would definitely come here again.
author: Mark S.

description: great!  reminds me of old drive ins back home on the east coast.  price has gone up lately because of the minimum wage increase but i will pay anything for the best milk shake in SF!
author: Skindy B.

description:
Beep's has been an Ocean Avenue landmark for a long time. It's success is attributed to its tasty and inexpensive food! 

I usually get a char-broiled 1/2 lb burger with perfectly crispy think cut fries for $4.80. In addition to burgers and such they also sell teriyaki rice bowls 

The only place to sit down and eat is a lone table which is usually occupied by some neighborhood youth. Most people eat in their cars or take their food back home or work

I forgot to mention that the pineapple milk shakes are pretty damn good!
author: Bumble B.

description: love this spot! It's been here forever! Just an old fashion burger joint!
author: Catherine K.

description: Deliciousness!!!!!!!!!!!! The Quarter pounder is the way to go. This old time burger stand is definitely a hidden gem. Burger are delicious and the fries are always on point, especially since they serve steak fries. The best part is that everything on their menu is pretty cheap so you definitely get your moneys worth!
author: Rene L.

description: I stopped by here and got myself a beef burger and some fries. The portion is good and I had a great time chewing on it. I was a bit surprised they had fish and chips here too.
author: Serena Z.

description:
Consistently good food at really great prices. The staff has always been super friendly, and they are pretty quick at getting your order to you. I like the fish and chips and the burger and fries special.

There are a couple of seats at a bar that faces into the kitchen and one picnic table for seating, but most folks order to go. Limited parking in the immediate area but the K streetcar and several buses stop right next to the store on Ocean and at the Phelan Loop.  Cash only!
author: Matt N.

description:
Beep's is a classic.  For people too young to know, this is what all "drive-in" fast food places used to be like -- no "drive-through" lane; you walk up to the window the old fashioned way and talk through a tiny screen.  There aren't many of these around any more (the only other one in town I can think of is Whiz Burgers, in the Mission).

We used to go there all the time like almost 20 years ago.  We went back last weekend for the first time in at least 5 years, and everything important about Beep's is still the same -- the very tasty burgers are individually made for each order, the lettuce and tomato are fresh and more than perceptible, and the fries don't taste like they've been frozen for weeks beforehand.  

Actually, I take back the part about nothing important about Beep's having changed:  The sign, which must be a holdover from the Sputnik era, used to have the space capsule outlined in blinking green neon, but it isn't anymore since the sign got repainted.  Can the ownership fix that, please?
author: moosedog i.

description:
I always go to Beep's to get fries and a milkshake. Though the place may seem super shady, given its a drive-in and all, the food to fresh always, and made to order.

Fries are always HOT when I get them, and are super crispy. The milkshakes are super thick, and creamy.

I wouldn't recommend this place is you're trying to watch your figure, or if you like salads. Beep's is your good old fast food joint, except for the fact that your burgers and fries look like they haven't been sitting around all day.
author: Jessica H.

description: Besides no indoor seating, the fries and burgers are great. I usually stay away from this stuff but I just got this crazy craving one day. They're really slow for some reason but the food is good =)
author: Tiff W.

description: Awesome Burger place. They have some of the best burgers around, no joke. They have a ton of different ingredients to make your burger, and every time I have been my burger has been cooked to perfection. This place really does specialize in making fantastic burgers.
author: Jose D.

description: Burgers good hot and fresh, but the wings is ok if that.
author: Nicole B.

description:
When I went to City College (when they were ACCREDITED) and we would check out BEEPS.  Beeps is equal - if not better than the old TICK TOCKs.  
I did go there with a friend because we were hungry.  My buddy is whining, man you take my wife & I to a place like this to eat in a car.  Snobby?  I told him, "You and her are hungry and you wouldn't make a DECISION and you left it up to me.   I LIKE this place.  Is the food good?"  She nodded "YES."  If you wanted @#$%@ng atmosphere  , you should have said something.  Man!  BEEPS is number one for a quick meal on the run.  No FRILLS, just good food!
author: Aprams C.

description:
Woohoo! As good as it gets! 5 Star for the price and the taste. 

This is alot better than mcds, you cant even compare the two. this is my second time ordering the 1/2 pounder special because its soo good for the price. Not only do i love the burger, the fries are on point. With all these customers they better not raise their price.
author: Allan W.

description: Divey and delicious. This is my kind of place. The burgers are juicy and they don't skimp on anything. They don't do anything fancy here so don't come looking for anything gourmet. Beep's Burgers specializes in basic burgers that will fill you up and they do it well. The burgers actually taste good and flavorful without being extremely greasy. The fries are perfectly crisp and thick! When I want to indulge my inner piggy, this place hits the spot. It's a much better option that the McDonalds down the block. Take your food to go though because I imagine it'd be sad and cold eating at the lone dirty picnic table that gives my ass splinters just looking at it! I wouldn't want to sit there. Also, this area is always freezing cold so you're better off taking your food home.
author: Nancy C.

description: salmon burger w/grilled mushrooms & avocado. sweet potato fries & pineapple milkshake. it was all great!
author: Juan L.

description: About two months ago, Beeps got new owners. Cosmetically, the place looks better with a new menu board, etc., but the food has gone downhill. I've been a frequent customer for about 2 years, and I usually got the pork chop rice bowl, salmon burger or the 1/4 pound burger with fries. The steak fries were the best - crispy on the outside, soft and yummy on the inside. The last two times they have been terrible. Once I think they refried some that had been fried before or they're not changing the oil often enough or something. Those were gross and inedible. Once they were barely warm and not crispy at all. The last burger I got was so burned that it had shrunk significantly like burned food will do. I haven't tried the pork chop bowl since they changed owners, but will give an update when I do.
author: Reynolds L.

description: I stop by at this burger joint when I'm in the neighborhood because the food is quite good. I don't usually sit on the stools and hang out on the corner because there's too many college students around and they can get rowdy sometimes. The staff is nice and the service is good. The price is also reasonable. It's the type of burger joint where you'll satisfy your hunger but you'll end up with heart-burn later. That's my kind of place!
author: Wayne P.

description: In an ever-changing world, it is so comforting to have a place like Beep's in town. I started going here when I was a teenager.  It was good then and it's just as good now.  I'm not a carnivore any longer, however, so I've turned to veggie burgers. Beep's veggie burger is up there with the best of them.  Their fries are also very good and I like their shakes.  I've heard the pineapple shake is killer so I really need to try it.  Prices are still reasonable and service is good though it can be a little slow at times. One thing I wish the owners would do and that is give the place a little makeover.  It's a little on the shabby side, unfortunately.  Anyway, I hope Beep's stays in business forever.  I love driving down Ocean Avenue and seeing that famous Beep's Burgers neon sign with that great rocketship.  Brings me right back to my childhood.  I mean where else can you find a great sign like that these days?  It's just so freaking cool.
author: Rabbit B.

description:
I hereby approve of the pineapple milkshakes.

Sizes are small, large, and extra large. Where's the medium?? But who cares about medium when you can get large! :D

I haven't tried anything else. And I don't really care to, when I have my pineapple shake. I mean it has little bits of pineapple in it, so that should be enough solids to forgo spending more on actual food, right? Right? Who needs actual food when you're a poor college student with pineapple milkshake in your tummy?
author: Cindy L.

description: i have been around Ocean area for the longest time, but i had never actually step foot at Beep's Burger. well that was my mistake. Cause This place got Burger that taste 10x better than mcd and healthier. when my friend first told me have i ever had beeps i was like na i rather go mcd. But after i tried Beep's, screw mcd i rathergo beeps. just have to pay alittle bit more, but u get something that taste 10x 20x better than mcd.
author: Johnson C.

description: Love their tacos and burgers!!!!!! I come here atleast once a week. Always freshly made.
author: Loreen L.

description:
I came here a couple times after school.

The prices are really cheap and affordable. Only thing I get from here is the double cheeseburger with fries. The burger itself is pretty big, but also pretty bland haha. It fills you up though, and for the price you can't beat it. There's no where to eat here so take it to go or eat in your car.
author: Ronnie P.

description: i was born and raised in this neighborhood. i never ever tried this place!!!! i finally did, and man was i missing out!!! i got a 1/2 burger and fries and the pineapple shake!!! the prices are good, friendly service. don't take my word for it!
author: Robert E.

description: Beeps has been there forever and the first burger and fries I had there was 1982, it's still and will always be the best burger I've ever had. It amazes me that they can consistently make these amazing burgers for all these years. Fries are also very good. Treat yourself once in awhile totally worth it.
author: Thomas L. G.

description:
Can I say "Welcome to the Suck?"

Beep's makes a terrible burger.  Completely tasteless.  But how is this possible you ask?  Their prices are so low!  And their location so ghetto and fly-ridden!

I think you just answered your own question, my friend.

Their fries totally suck too.  The only positive part of my experience: they put an adequate amount of chocolate syrup in their shakes.
author: Gabriel D.

description: I love this place especially after getting out of class. Their fries are the best! I usually get the chicken basket, so good. But I've notice the chicken has changed, it looks different from back then, now it looks like tyson's chicken tenders. Anyways, the wait time is okay except when it's super busy. And as for the quality of the food, sometimes its cooked perfectly but some days it's overcooked. However, I'd still come here because it's that good!
author: Nancy T.

description: It was a cold rainy Saturday night with the boy and after a less then stellar pizza delivery the night before, it was time for a "change up". As I poured over Eat24 and yelp I wasn't finding anything exciting in the burger department on Ocean. Until my oh so handsome fellow goes,"What about that beep place?" First impression: That really old looking funky joint by that BRAND SPANKING new Whole Foods? Ehhh I'll pass. However I decided to throw caution and my snob attitude to the wind for a whirl at beeps. We drive up on the wet pavement to first see,"Cash only"....hrmmm somewhat shady but I get it(Fight the man!). After finding a close ATM we order from this very nice Asian girl two bacon cheese burgers, fries and milkshakes. 10 minutes after being places and bang! Pipping hot burgers, tasty fries and milkshakes all neatly packed to head home. I had the chocolate milkshake first which was beyond Amazeballs! Each slurp of it was like Jesus going down my throat. Once we got home I tore into the bag, shoveled in the fries and then took a big fatass bite of my burger....holy shit! Was this even better then Burger Bar at macys!? Yes...yes it was! I would describe it but I ate it so fast I cannot recall what that sinfully delicious meal looked like. What I can tell you is: Funky looking burger joint, awesome customer service and EPIC food! Excited for my next burger craving to taste those mouth watering patties again!
author: Alex F.

description:
What the BEEP!
Can you take any BEEP'n longer to make my food?
I woulda gave it a 1 star but..2 because the only thing i liked there was the fries. But really, even when there is only 1 or 2 customers in front of you that ordered, you'll wait a good 15 minutes or more for your food.
Because i live near i had this place a few times, and one of the times, the burger..was almost tasteless..
I think i rather just go down a couple blocks to Mcdonalds. I bet if I had ordered from Beeps,  i could walk to Mcdonalds, order an angus or quarter lb'er meal..get the food, walk back to beeps, and i probably would have my order before beeps even finishes. For all i kno maybe even finish half the meal before i get the food =P
author: Ryan N.

description: Mmmm...meh. Nothing special about the burgers and fries, but the mini corn dogs are good.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I've heard really really good things from so many people about this place, but maybe I went on an off night...

It was good don't get me wrong, the fries are SO good, old school wedges.... reminded me of Fat Burger's fries...

The quarter pounder was just a little dry, but the strawberry milkshake made up for it... I'd go back, probably try the cheesesteak...
author: Chelsea D.

description:
(exerpt from munchmunchmunch.com)

I'm an American, which means I enjoy football, porno, monster trucks and movies where things explode. As any red-blooded American I enjoy greasy artery clogging food. This includes chicken nuggets, burgers and shakes.

Beeps Burgers is by City College on Ocean where I teach so when I'm jonesing for an all American artery clogging burger I will stop by. However to be honest the food is really only passable. If I was not stuck in the Ocean area I would not really come here. I feel that the burgers lack flare. There is no real juicy-ness or flavor. It's just meat in a costco bun. The fried food could be made by anyone with an industrial fryer and some costco chicken nugget bags.

All in all I would say Beeps is better and fresher than your average McDonalds, but not really on my list of places to get a good ol' American burger.

yups
author: david h.

description:
I can't believe I never came here when i went to City College.

Pineapple Shake - Wow, this shake is money! Vanilla with a hint of pineapple, and pineapple chunks. Delicious. I would come again just for this.

Steak Fries - Nice and crispy on the outside. Soft on the inside, not too oily. Very good.

Cheese Burger - Patty is just OK, but not bad. Lettuce, tomato, onions made up for it. Still a pretty good burger at this price point.

Total was about $7-8. Wait was around 5 minutes.

Why go to McDonalds? Go to Beep's!
author: Bill K.

description: Honestly, I thought it looked kind of sketchy when I first came by, but their fries are delicious: wedge cut, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and lightly seasoned. Mmm. Burger patty was a little dry, but was definitely better than McDonald's. Next time a fry craving hits me, Beep's will be my first stop.
author: Wendy S.

description:
Born and raised just around the corner from this place.  I've grown up eating the 1/2 pound burger with cheese and the chicken basket.

They provide a great meal at a decent price.  I would rather eat at Beep's then go to McDonald's down the street.

If you go, I'd suggest getting a 1/2 vanilla 1/2 chocolate shake.  It's won't disappoint.
author: Jesson d.

description: Darn tasty food at a good price.  1/4lb burger and fries with cheese under $5.00.  Been coming here over 20+ years and it's simple, basic and good.  They're hot link sandwich is quite tasty also.
author: Edward V.

description: great burgers, way better than the mcdonalds down the street. Food may take several minutes to finish depending on the line. Its worth the wait though, great fries and a square deal. They also have other food there too including fish n chips and food with rice to name a couple.
author: Alex C.

description: Love this place. We go pretty much every week because it is so close to home. The hotdogs are also great.
author: Alistair P.

description:
In a lot of ways, Beep's is eerily similar to Whiz Burger: the paint job, the faded food photos, the somewhat incongruous teriyaki bowls. And don't get me wrong, I like my Whiz, but it sure seems that wherever they fall short, Beep's is MORE than picking up the slack. 

For example, I cannot believe how affordable this place is! Like, almost half the price of Whiz, with way more selection to boot. Earlier today, we got a big basket of yummy fried chicken breast and fries, plus a breakfast sandwich and a soda, for $10. The low prices totally make up for it being cash-only.

I'd give them five stars, but I actually haven't tried a burger yet, so that doesn't seem fair.
author: Lynae Z.

description: The burger was a complete surprise, but what really impressed me is the way they cooked their steak fries.  Not sure if it was a good day or if they can consistently cook the steak fries with the perfect texture, but I will be back to check it out.  The burger was way above average as well.
author: Coach C.

description:
Bought a cheeseburger, pineapple shake, and steak fries for the boyfriend after he lost a tennis match.  His cravings for this place satisfied, he commented that the shake was particularly good and the burger was juicy and also pretty good --much better than chain burgers.  

Wait time is a bit slow, considering we were the only ones waiting for our food and there were two cooks, but the burger and fries came out piping hot, while the shake was thick and cold -not melted after the wait on the other food.

Perhaps next time I'll have to try some of their other offerings.. the pictures in the window looked pretty tasty as did their prices!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Really disappointed. I love a good burger and hole in the wall joints and this one was no good. It's never a good sign when the tomato and lettuce are the same anemic white color. Coulda gone to McDonald's for the same.
author: mars n.

description: If you're looking for made-to-order burgers and fast food, beeps is the shit! This is the only real burger joint i've been too that's super cheap and good. Their burger and fries combo for $5 is a good deal and they have a good steak sandwich! I definitely recommend this place to anyone instead of going to McDonald's down the street
author: Robert F.

description: I went to Beeps Burgers for the first time today. I always walk pass this place with interest.I am shocked at all the high reviews. This place does not warrant a 5 star rating. Yes, the price is good but compared to other burger places I've been to, this place isn't a stand out by any means. The wait for my food was absurdly long (20 mins) considering there wasn't a line and there were 2 cooks in the back that I could see and my order was not that complex. I ordered a hamburger. The bottom bun was over toasted. Would I go here again? Nope- not worth it. I am glad I can cross this place off my list of places to eat though.
author: Linh V.

description: Nice old-fashioned burger stand but with no place to sit (actually there is a picnic-style table for about four people).  The menu is pretty expensive with more than just burgers, including items like fish and chips.  I remember ordering the cheeseburger and it was pretty tasty.  I felt the service was a bit slow though given my feeling that the number of people with orders ahead of mine didn't really justify the wait time that I endured.
author: H K.

description:
When I was looking at the menu w/ pictures, I thought the basket deals looked a bit small. When I actually got the food, it was a lot bigger than I expected.

As other people said in their reviews, I think the pricing is pretty good.  

For comparison (both meals are around the dollar price range), 1/2 pound burger and fries combo (#11) vs McDonalds (a block or so away from Beeps) Big Mac w/ large fries *NOT THE MEAL OFFER

Beeps is definitely the better choice and cheaper. The burger is bigger than McDonalds Big Mac. The patty is a bit dry for my taste but it's still good. 

The fries are huge and kind of crispy. It tastes pretty good. You can probably tell by looking at the pictures.

There is a ghetto looking table for about 6 people to eat in the open. It looks like it's about to break in half but a table is a table.

Location could not be better... short walk from CCSF. They do have a small parking lot, which is nice since they have ONE table.
author: Vincent C.

description:
Pinaeapple Milkshake?


[whispers]
Thank you.
author: Elijah W.

description:
I lived on the block with beeps for 17 years of my life. French fries were my favorite from here, Nice thick hearty cuts really beat skimpy soggy ones from the mcdonalds down the street. 

Beeps is a fun and good hearted diner, the ghetto factor kind of sucks but they cant really help that. I mean its ghetto ghetto, one time a guy was shot in the beeps parking lot!! Still, you dont see many of these anymore, and hey, murders can happen anywhere! :)
author: Amy S.

description: For real? This is one of Yelp's top rated places? I live up the street and made it down to Beep's on day...It's three steps below McDonald's, it's only cool aspect is it's not a chain, but it tastes like one. Burp.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Love this place. I live around the corner and I'd rather wait am extra couple of Minutes for them top cook my food fresh than going around the corner to McDonalds for something fast. If tippy want you're stuff ready to go i suggest you call in you're order.
author: Shantall E.

description:
A half pound burger.  A generous order of fries.  Five bucks and change.  No Shit.

Beep's lies a scant 50 feet off Ocean Ave, hopelessly mired amidst the most tortured piece of asphalt that ever dared to call itself a parking lot.  It's drive-in layout has no indoor seating, and a single table near the pick-up window represents the only  dining area on the premises.

Fancy?  No.  Pretentious?  Not even.  Humble, spartan, and true to it's purpose?  Yes indeed.
  
A glance at Beep's menu reveals bargains aplenty.  What caught my eye was the "1/2lb Burger Basket" that came with a generous serving of slab-cut fries, all for the bargain-basement price of $5.50. And lo, this burger is one to behold, it's patties being devoid of mass-produced circularity, instead featuring a natural asymmetry that cometh not from the bowels of a machine, but only from the hands of mankind.

Rainy weather and outdoor seating guaranteed an utterly bleak on-site dining environment, but a neighborhood pub ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/k0tKfwVlJTzBC_dsbDuHrQ#hrid:XKpRV5YbfrONqkM3TIqm7g/query:Randy's ) beckoned from across the street.  Once inside, joy was mine when I found happy-hour priced pints of Sierra Nevada Pale that set me back less than four bucks....tip included.  
With a burger in hand and an icy pint before me, I prepared to take my first bite....

This not a gourmet burger. Nor is it a dainty burger.  This is a hearty burger whose ratio of width-to-height borders on even.  It's heft requires effort on the part of incisors that take each bite, and entails work for molars that chew.  Still, it's a tasty burger that *feels good*...in your hand, in your mouth, and in your stomach.

Great burgers.  Affordable prices.  The menu is beer-less and on-site dining facilities are almost non-existent, but a take-in friendly bar with a kick-ass happy hour lies just across the street.  If your looking for a gourmet sandwich, steer clear.  But by all means keep Beeps in mind of you're in the mood for a *manly* burger-and-fries combo that you can cover with a ten-spot, then pocket enough change to walk across the street and grab a cold one to wash it down with...
author: Mike W.

description:
This is how I know my husband loves me.

He calls me around lunch time, from Beep's Burgers on Ocean Ave, not far from our house.  He asks me if I want anything, and I say "No" because I am trying to be good, so I continue to eat my organic grapes from the Farmer's Market.  

He comes home and is getting ready to eat lunch.  He says, "Are you sure?  Half of my hamburger?" and I say "No", even though it smells fantastic.  I continue to eat my stupid grapes from the Farmer's Market.

He walks into the living room where i am working on the computer.  "Onion ring?"  Oh, Christ.  I love onion rings.  "No", I say, continuing to eat my motherf**king grapes from the motherf**king Farmer's Market.  

He goes into the other room to work and eat lunch.  His voice rings out "I have a mini-corn dog for you.  Want one?"  I smile.  "Yes!" and I go in the room to get my mini-corn dog, which is of course, delicious!  And then he asks if I want one more, his last one, and he only got 6.  He dabs it in Dijon mustard and hands it to me.

Anyone who would give you their last mini-corn dog and understand that sometimes "No" means "Yes" has got to be your soul-mate.

Beep's.  An old fashioned hamburger stand, serving people and the ones they love in the City College/Ocean Ave area.
author: Liz S.

description:
remember back in the day in grade school when you would get to have burgers for lunch.  This is the same food that I remember having in the cafeteria.  Boring and cheap.  

They have a few different types of burgers and a couple of rice choices.  If you are looking for food and to relive your favorite meals at the cafeteria then this is perfect otherwise save the cash and make a burger at home
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Oh Man!  Beeps is an old-time burger stand with a huge sign that sets the expectation of a giant juicy burger with amazing fries. When you pull up, you're ready to give your order to a roller skating waitress, knowing you're about to have a religious experience wrapped in a bun.

Wrong. No skating waitress and no holy hamburgers are in store for you.

My mother has always judged the quality of a burger by the number of napkins you need to eat it.  A good burger should be JUICY and messy.  Beeps burgers scarcely need more than the single microscopically thin napkin that they put in your bag.

Sadly, Beeps serves up cheap frozen patties that don't ooze at all.  The fries are just OK but desperately need salt which wont seem to stick.  The staff gives you a single packet of ketchup to go with them. On both my visits, the bacon was  cold, too!  GROSS.

They take FOREVER to get your burger to you and that sucks when you're starving. Hello?!? What part of FAST FOOD don't you understand?!?!

And another thing --I don't want my local burger stand to sell terriyaki chicken and rice bowls.  I have nothing against either, but I also wouldn't want a terriyaki place to serve burgers.  Beeps' menu seems to be made up of a hodgepodge of things that don't make a lot of sense.  Most items seem to come from Sysco or the Costco frozen section.

The signs in the windows are so old that they're sun faded and there are dozens of bugs stuck between the tape and the window.  Mmmmmm.... appetizing.  Makes me wonder just what's living in that kitchen.

If you're in the neighborhood and want a hamburger, go over to Mission and visit Joe's Cable Car.  Just pass up Beeps and don't take it further than appreciating their sign.
author: Amy A.

description:
Awesome name? *check. Hypnotic sign? *check. Great handfuls of greasy goodness? *double check.

A good Ocean Ave. alternative to McDamage.
author: Andy R.

description:
Beep's has me Beep-Beeping for quick, cheap and greasy local fast food.

Definitely a spot to hit up if you are a CCSF student.
author: Ron C.

description: No frills, but fair prices. I've only ever ordered the 1/2 pounder with cheese and fries, (and it's good stuff) but wouldn't recommend veering too far from the basics, ie a simple beef burger and fries. Truthfully, it's kind of a divey place; sorta' run down and standing on its last leg, tons of pigeons hanging around, too many home-made faded inkjet printed "specials" taped all over the windows ... But, it works for a quick burger. To me, they just seem to try to offer too much variety and it starts to complicate things. I say if you stick to the basics, you can't go wrong with Beep's.
author: Michael D.

description: cheap so don't expect too much. but i prefer going to beep's for burgers and fries (love their fries btw) than mcdonnald's. they sell lunch boxes too, ok to fill your tummy or in a hurry.
author: I T.

description:
I like Beep's!!!  I have found that I really have a special spot in my heart for small, run down, hole in the wall kinda places, and this is one of them.  Beeps is a drive up burger place where the burgers are greasy, the fries are salty, and the shakes ahve way too much syrup.  But I love it.  I have had most of the menu and I will say that the straight up burger with cheese is always a good choice.  
I think I especially like this place becasue it is walking distance from my house, and it only takes me one spliff to get here and back home.
If you are ever in ingleside, stop by and have a burger, or a shake, or both.  You will love it.
author: international super bert a.

description: awesome selection of the best fatty foods served on a bun with an asian twist. Consistent, and some awesome fries also. Only reason they don't get 5 stars for me is that the area can get pretty bad in the evening to night time so I would say go during the day and if even better if you can go with friends. Overall this place has been awesome to me over the years when I lived in SF and I recommend it to people when they want a good burger
author: Alex W.

description:
This is one of the few good places to go near City College and from what I could tell judging from the amount of people coming and going, other people think so too.  

As a Vegetarian, I'm always on the look out for a place that serves a decent veggie burger and Beeps is one of those places. Their veggie burger has a larger patty then you might find at most other places and it has a classic burger taste.  I got the basket for under $4.00 that came with fries. The fries came hot and they are the thick kind that I love so much, they don't salt them but will offer you salt to put on yourself. 

Their shakes are good too. I got the Pineapple shake, it tasted like a classic vanilla shake with pineapple. I watched them hand blend the shake with real pineapple chunks...yummy! 

They have rice bowls, but they didn't have any on the menu that were vegetarian, I didn't ask if they could make a vegetarian version, so they might be able to. They also have fish sandwiches if you want to go that route.

I do wish they would add another picnic table, one is not enough, but if you came by car you can always eat there.
author: Marcie L.

description:
Ahhh Beep's ...

What can I say about you that hasn't already been said?

Great Burgers.... back in the day, they used to grind their own Chuck fresh daily.  And you just can't imagine what a sign like that will do to the Weed-Addled minds of Post High-school/Pre-College slackers back in '95

"We grind our own Chuck Fresh Daily!"  .... 

Were the burgers Great? Hell yeah!
Were the shakes so thick that you can turn the cup upside down without the lid and NOTHING will move?  Hell YES!
Were the fries greasy as hell and made the brown paper bag transparent? Abso-Fuggin-Lutely!
Were we high off our asses from some Hunter's Point Bomb?  - OH HELLLL F******Ck YEAAAHHH!

Beep's ... I love you, man.   I'll see you again some day .... I promise.
author: Roo M.

description:
Gotta love the old-school drive-up vibe that Beep's brings. They also have quite an extensive menu, although I can't speak on the rice bowls, tacos, etc., as I usually stick with the basics here.

The #11 is the way to go: Double quarter pounder w/ cheese and fries for about $5.50. The burgers are really good. Nice fresh produce, fresh-baked buns, tasty. The fries are really good too. Thick cut, nice and crispy.

I also tried the #16 cheesesteak for $4.60. Doesn't come with fries and was a disappointment compared to the burger. Not nearly enough meat. I could eat two of these and still be hungry. It did have nice flavor with pieces of bacon chopped up with the meat, but just not enough steak to really constitute a cheese steak. More of a meat flavored cheese sandwich. Starvin Marvin down in Crocker-Amazon makes a much better cheesesteak. Better burgers too but Beep's ain't bad.
author: Brian H.

description:
March 22nd is National Corn Dog Day. A corn dog is not an easy find in San Francisco and StreetEats was hosting a celebration, My husband and I carved out an hour to go. I always look for an excuse to eat the tasty treat which is usually involves a thrice decade trip to the Santa Cruz Boardwalk. 
Well, there was a celebration of the batter wrapped psuedo-sausage-on-a-stick at StreetEat alright. The place was packed! There were more beards, ironic Ts and sundresses accessorized with toe-less boots (?) than I could count. Pabst Blue Ribbon in 16 ounce cans beat out the microbrews in mind-numbing numbers. The lines to get a teriyaki corn dog and bacon-wrapped delights were hundreds of devotees-long. 
Despite the discouragement at the crowd, my taste for a corn dog was not decreased. I did not want to wait in a huge line with the sun-scorched masses, but I did want the dog. The mister suggested a trip to the grocery for a frozen-type to make at home. No. That wouldn't do. He started suggesting alternatives: The Zoo? Carousel or whatever the last Doggie Diner became? He was trying to please his disappointed wife and I loved him for it. I started reassessing our home refrigerator contents in my mind for a sad replacement when he hit on the solution: Beeps! Did Beeps have corn dogs! Yes!, my genius mate, yes they do! We left South of Market with our quest in mind and made the trip to Ocean Avenue recounting our last visit to the iconic drive-in. It must have been 15 years prior. Luckily, Beep's still existed. My mouth was watering in anticipation.
When we got there, I jumped out of car to queue in the short line. I scanned the menu --yes, corn dogs were still part of the fare. A woman in front of me asked what I was getting. Corn dogs, I beamed! "Are you getting the kind on a stick or the mini-corn dogs bites?", she asked. I was almost overcome with the choice. Not only could I get the more familiar, traditional vertical presentation, I could get baskets of 6 or 9 mini-dogs! I knew my selection, but I had to leave the line briefly to see if my mate would like a variation on the classic. I was slightly relieved to hear that he wanted the stick version and returned to order. I was told it would take 10 minutes; I had been waiting for a week for the sweet, hot crunch of the crispy batter followed by the pop of the spiced meat product, I could wait. 
We did wait. I heard the story of the guy behind me in line of how he worked at Beeps when he was a teenager 20 or more years ago. I saw the surprise on the faces of the 20-something, dating couple on bar stools at the outdoor counter as they asked,  "How long has this place been here?" and watched the young family as their three daughters piped, "We want french fries!" 
The short wait, was worth it. The sweetness to meat ratio was perfect. The fry was light and perfect. And they cost $2.49 each! My husband and I were reminded that Beeps is a great value and an institution. We'll be back for other diner dinners soon. And I've already set a calendar reminder for Corn Dog Day 2015 at Beeps.
author: Ruth W.

description:
MORE PEOPLE NEED TO NOT REVIEW THIS PLACE AND KEEP IT A SECRET!!!

No matter what, I will always judge french fries ANYWHERE compared to Beeps Burger Fries. I grew up on the food from here!! I've lived LITERALLY up the street from Beeps my whole life! I ate food here coming from home from school and work, I ate food here coming home smashed, I've ate food here cuz I had the munchies, I've ate food here cuz I haven't in a while, hell I'd eat here just because!

This to me is the BEST comfort food. I forever cherish living so close to a SF landmark! Being one of the last drive up and eat places up in the city, I love it!!
author: Eric A.

description:
The fries are horrible - I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Apparently members of the Flamin' Groovies used to frequent here, for that alone, they should feature a flamin' groovy burger - it would be EPIC!

Also, the onion rings are really bad - but I STILL LOVE THIS PLACE!

Seriously, the actual burgers are pretty good, and the perfect place to roll up your '66 Galaxie, put the top down and chow down! Golden arches is right down the street - but why would you want that?
author: wayne s.

description: I had pineapple shake, it was ok, i didn't really taste the pineapple, taste mostly vanilla my cousin tasted a little, like a hint, maybe my taste buds aren't as good the burger was ok, not too bad, it was alright, i had the half pounder with fries. the fries were good, i like them steak fries. The meat was eh, too much for me, i rather get the quarter pounder, but i didn't get cheese though, maybe i should've. 8 total not too bad
author: David L.

description:
Cheap! Awesome! It reminds me of the Drive-Ins I grew up around in rural Southern Missouri out in the Midwest.

Except you can get a veggie burger here. :) With fries, the total is $4. YOU CANNOT BEAT THAT IN SAN FRANCISCO!

The menu is extensive and delicious, affordable, fun. 

And it's across the street from a great watering hole (Randy's Place). 

Make it a cheap, unique date. (Oh, and there's only a picnic table...it's a Drive-In, after all.)
author: Danyell K.

description:
This place is great. When you look at it, it looks like a greasy circa-1950's drive-in fast food joint. Oh, but what is this I see on the menu? Can it be true? A veggie burger? Fish and chips? You mean I don't HAVE to eat red meat? OM NOM NOM NOM NOM!

Awesome. Milkshakes rule too.
author: Courtney S.

description:
eat here if you want it to taste a bit more homemade as opposed to eating at mcdonalds.

their tacos are good which are basically the same as doing the jack in the box.

their fish sandwich is a bigger filet of fish at mcdonalds.

the chicken nuggets, well they're chicken nuggets, get to mcdonalds...lol.

their burger tastes fresher than a mcdonalds but the fries suck.

its a good place.  i learned about it from a friend and have always hoped it was faster.  it isn't.  i wish it was fresher.  it isn't.

its okay though.  it isn't worth complaining about but it worth mentioning.  go here if you want to try something in the fast food variety.
author: Bing D.

description:
This is a good burger joint. There burgers have a good taste with fresh lettuce and tomato. A little expensive but worth it every once in a while. There steak fries are decent and there shakes are good. I really liked there pineapple shake, real chunks of pineapple, thick and creamy. 
This is an old Burger place that's been around for a long time, since back in the 70's so there's gotta be something good about it that keeps it up.
author: Travis G.

description: I had beeps burgers for the first time last week and I fell in love with their food instantly! I tried both their cheeseburger and salmon sandwich and both were very tasty and filling. The burgers are really good size and not greasy at all which was very nice to see compared to other places. Only down side is that they only take cash, otherwise I would be eating here a lot more often. Also, there isn't really much space to eat since it's mainly a window order kind of place. The person who helped me was very kind and friendly. If you are looking for a quick lunch in the city, this place is definitely the spot
author: Derrick I.

description:
I found Beep's recently through Yelp and I LOVE it!

Cheap, delicious, and filling! My girlfriend and I both have stoner appetites and we both got full off 2 quarter pounders with cheese and 2 orders of hot and delicious steak fries for just over $8... that's unheard of. You CAN'T smoke pot and get full from any other fast food place for that cheap! Except maybe In-N-Out, but I digress.

Very, very little outdoor seating (like 3 stools and a table or something), but most everyone eats in their car, like a car hop. That part right there gives Beep's extra character.

Expansive menu, all affordably priced. I tried the pineapple shake after reading all the reviews, but I still prefer chocolate. It was interesting though. There's also a bar right next to it called Randy's Place, so that's a plus too.
author: Ramsey D.

description:
It was there when my dad was my age.That being said....there's a reason.Two words:PINEAPPLE SHAKE!!!!!!!
OMG
author: Laura S.

description:
1) lotsa students are here in the lunch hour

2) greasy

4) usually takes awhile for the food to be made (or maybe it's just me)

3) decently priced for crappy but dee-liciously addicting food.

i wasnt too thrilled with the onion rings or the fries, probably because they were REALLY REALLY greasy.

not sure if i'm a fan, so....

yeah.
author: Inari T.

description:
I'm always half and half about Beep's only because sometimes their food is at it's best and sometimes it's just a miss for me. I've gone here a couple of times for food before and I thought it was okay. I honestly rather deal with their lines rather than McDonalds (which are ALWAYS packed during lunch hours or when the kids get out school). It is at a convenient spot, seeing as how it's so close to CCSF, but what really makes me sad is that they don't have indoor seating. If anything, I always just get it to go because 1. they hardly even have any seats, 2. We all know how SF weather likes to change on us and I'm definitely not sitting outside in the rain while eating my burger.
The customer service has always been great though; they're really polite and the service is pretty fast. 
If anything, it's a great place when you're on the go. Most definitely recommend the nuggets over the burgers.
author: Michelley D.

description:
There's a bit of an odd system going on at Beep's -- select item from picture menu, give number to lady, pay in cash, wait in car, watch other people order then return to car to wait. 15 minutes later, retrieve food from opposite window.
