Not quite a drive-in, and not quite a drive through, yet has that old school retro burger thing that you can't get at a chain burger joint (I think its considerably better than Whiz burgers, but they have the same idea going on here). 

Cheeseburger is very decent, old-fashioned style (sometimes the meat can be dry, other times its cooked perfectly), and the fries are like old school steak fries -- soft n crunchy, and very satisfying. Bit of a cafeteria vibe/burger style here, but not school cafeteria, more like 1960s corporate cafeteria.

The thing I really love to get here? 9 piece mini-corndogs, extra mustard!
author: Sabine S.

description:
3 stars for food, 1 star extra for variety.  

If you don't want McDonald's and really want a burger made on an actual grill as my BF tells me, then this is a great alternative to McDonald's.  

They offer breakfast sandwiches, Mexican food (tacos and burritos), burgers (chicken, beef), fried shrimp, bagel dogs, Asian food (pork, rice and eggs, terriyaki bowls, rice bowls, etc.)  and pretty much something that probably could appeal to anyone.  

The food was okay. Burger was slightly overcooked for my taste, onion rings were gross, fries were the large elephant fries, which I'm not into, but my mini corn dogs were yummy.  

They only have 2 people working there, 1 at the front, and 1 in the back cooking, so if there is a line expect a little wait.
author: Denise B.

description:
Big, fat, grimy burgers. Old-fashioned, deep fried french fries. Extremely chocolatey, syrupy milkshakes. That's what you can expect from this place.

I'm going to give it 3 stars + 1 for being different, old-fashioned, and for milkshakes. 

I like it, and it's much better than McDonalds down the street, but I think I'd rather have In-n-Out in the end. Then I can feel like I live my life at least somewhat healthy.
author: Aaron M.

description: A nice reminder of what fast food joints were like 50 years ago, I like Beeps mom and pop vibe. I ordered a 1/4 lb hamburger w/ fries. Only thing that bugged about the joint was the owner was shiesty on ketchup packets and asked for an extra quarter per packet.. so you might wanna pack a lil bottle of ur own in ur bag or somethin. So thats a 1 star deduction. Other than that, flavor of the burger was great, and I love the thick cut fries, just wish there was more ketchup! Too bad the benches are outside, which exposes you to all the elements. I think I'd enjoy my meal outside once summer comes, so for now, take it home or huddle!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Great, old-fashioned greasy fast food at it's best. Upsides include friendly service and weird yet diverse, tasty menu selections. Downside is sometimes they almost 10-15 minutes to get your food.

Suggestions:
Classic burger with the mini corn-dogs. Teriyaki chicken was filling also.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
When I went to City College, Beep's was THE place to go for lunch. It still is whenever I'm in the neighborhood but back then, it was that or nothing at all. Their burgers are delicious, and everything else that I've tried - was just as good-tasting. 

See, now this makes me want to go back just for lunch.
author: Thea G.

description:
My previous review was simply based on having a fish sandwich from here.I thought to myself why on earth would I put this on my burger list for people to read if  "I didn't taste the burger".With that said,well we ordered 2 cheeseburgers w/fries.

Cheeseburgers: decent size,not too much of a thick patty,but just right and tasted ok.Nothing fancy,but just right to fulfill a hungry individuals needs and one who is craving a decent burger.

Fries: I say along the line of steak cut,but they were decent tasting.I am a fan of steak cut,so I appreciate the thicker cut that I get when I go to most burger joints.

Worth a try.
author: Dani D.

description:
Got time before your class at CCSF?  Are ya hungry?  Need something that's guaranteed to sit in your stomach for an extended period of time?  Then go on over to Beep's Burgers.

Their burgers really aren't the best, but they have lots of other warm meals that are bound to satisfy your peckish to make that 3 hour evening class a bit more tolerable.  The pork chops come recommended, as does the shrimp, chicken & beef meal.

It's kinda cool to sit at the side counter and eat, it kinda has that east coast hoagie restaurant vibe to it.  But honestly, you only need to go here if you're REALLY hungry and not a fan of McDonald's which is just a block away.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
This place is great if you have that deep yearning for bowling alley food, minus the smash of pins and funky two-toned shoes.   Giant burgers coated with actual cheese and awesome pub fries, and shakes that rock.  And they serve all kinds of other things if you're not feeling burgers that day!    

 The only drawback is that they only take cash!  It's 2009 people!
author: Nick H.

description:
So I have come to the conclusion that burgers and shakes are my comfort food... I went on the prowl today for some food, and it took me three hours of driving around the city until I finally came across beeps and got some food. 

I ordered the chicken strip basket, I believe it was no. 9. This combo came with 5 large and not oily at all chicken strips, nice large hot frys, and some bbq sauce. I really wanted a milk shake, and since I am not a huge fan of the standard vanilla or chocolate shakes, I ordered their pineapple shake... it was good, it was a bit strange... I liked the pineapple chunks... it kind of reminded me of the milk teas from the tapioca bubble drink shops... but filled me craving for milk shake and made me a happy camper. 

YAY FOR PINEAPPLE MILKSHAKES!
author: danny e.

description: Beeps What can I say... Beeps is like a drug you know you shouldn't have it but its just so hard to resist. Beeps is your typical all American Burger joint. The food is good but not great but hey their fries is what keeps me coming back. For the prices its a good deal on the amount of food they give. If your around the area and just happened to walk by then go ahead and try it out. But if your in need of a burger fix and your not around go ahead a just don't mind this place.
author: John B.

description:
Beep's was the place to go to during my lunch break at City College. Fries were great and their burgers are too! Affordable for an almost-broke college student.

I'm now at SF State but I drive by once in a while for their burgers during my lunch. Yup - it's that good!
author: Michelle B.

description: This place can't be beat for fresh burgers/sides and very good steak fries.  Prices are right.  Parking in front and there is usually a spot available.  excellent shakes too.
author: p w.

description: Me and my brother love the fries and the pineapple shake at Beeps. We've lived near this place since forever but I guess it never appealed to us until we decided to try it like a year ago? Now we go fairly often for the fries and the pineapple shake. They are both delicious and relatively cheap. This place is much better than McDonalds! It loses a star though because of 2 complaints: 1) you have to wait for your food but at least you know its fresh! 2)a lot of creepers hang around here. This girl in front of me got hit on by this weird old homeless guy and another time this guy kept begging for money. Waiting for a long time next to a creepy guy really sucks!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I just want to say that my uncles George and Steve Essaff started this business in either 1961 or 1962. I haven't eaten there in decades. When Mom used to take us, we would sit in the "back room". I mostly remember eating french fries. Eventually Uncle Steve went back to  his job as a photographer for the Examiner, and Uncle George moved to Arizona because they don't have earthquakes there.

Mom says (is this totally obvious?) that the restaurant was named after the sound of the radio signals coming from satellites, which were a huge big deal then at the dawn of the space age. Today (two days after 50th anniversary of Sputnik 1) I went to Wikipedia to hear a recording of the beep of Sputnik, because I'd always wondered just what that beep sounded like.

My dream is that someone will restore that sign to its original splendor, and get the neon working again.
author: Terry F.

description: This place is awful, I only had their fries one day, but that was ENOUGH for me to decide to never go back. I found a pubic hair in the fries. It was short thick and curly. AND no it was not from the servers head, he was asian with straight black hair.
author: Peeta B.

description: This place makes me feel like a true American.  Huge burgers, amazing fries, delicious shakes. This place has been around forever and I don't think it's changed at all....and I hope it never does.
author: Kim K.

description:
Yess, Beeps, good ole greasy bacon cheeseburger with steak fries, ya heard.  

Steak fries, I fuckin love steak fries.
author: Hen A.

description: beeps burgers are pretty good. Im not a total fan, but it is better than mcdonalds. i think the real star at this spot, are the shakes. PINEAPPLE shakes..gotta try them..
author: Cali L.

description:
Meh.  Reasonably hefty and filling burgers and fries, but they're pretty bland.   Wait times are a bit longer than I expected.

I don't have any tastier burger places on Ocean Avenue to recommend (and if you even THINK of going to Mickey D's down the street, I'll yelpingly disown you), but there certainly are lots of other tastier and probably healthier food options within a few blocks.
author: Adam L.

description:
Truly a throwback of its time. The place reminds one of the 50's but without the 50's prices.
Do try their thick ass burgers. It's pretty good and the fries are always over the top. I love their pineapple shake, and they make it fresh, the way they used to do back in the day.
If you come here during the heavy lunch or pre-dinner times, the wait does get a bit long, but the food is freshly made (not like McD's down the block). and there's plenty of parking since the entire lot is for Drive-In purposes. Much like Drive-In's of the past, you make your order at the window and then plop back down in your car for your feast!
All that's missing is a nice movie and I'm made!
author: Pauline L.

description: I grew up 2 blocks away from Beeps and it still doesn't get old. Their burgers with that sauce is better than any fast food joint hands down! I make sure to take my biweekly 45 minute drives just to get a taste of what a real burger should taste like.
author: Karen N.

description: I live right next door to this little gem! So cheap and so delish! I like how I can get a brown paper bag filled to the top with fries for around 2 bucks. Definately the best place when ya got the munchies!
author: Heather E.

description:
I used to see this place everyday when I was younger coming home from school. At first this place scared me and I wasn't sure it was worth trying. Then after years of ignoring it, I was sick of MCD and I wanted something new. 

I came out of the car not knowing what to expect. I went up to the counter and there was no line. A friendly cashier was behind the counter ready to take my order. Since it was my first time I didn't want to be too adventurous so I ordered a 1/4 pounder and fries. After ordering i took a look at the menu and they had quite a few things to order for such a small stand. After what seemed to be a 10min. wait, I got my food and was ready to go home.

The food was much better than MCD. The burger tasted fresh and the fries were some of the best that I've had. The wait for me always seems a bit long but I guess it's worth it.
author: Michelle L.

description:
4 stars for the food, 5 stars for the prices!

This joint might have you turning back and running away because its obviously a relic, but the burgers are tasty! Less than $6 bucks for a 1/2 pounder with cheese and steak fries (or 6 onion rings) and under $4.50 for the 1/4 pound version.

My friend and I ate here on the advice of another friend. We spent just over $13 with sodas. INSANITY, how can burgers that taste this good be this cheap??

BTW- CASH ONLY!
author: Josh S.

description: This is my go to place when I'm hungry and need some kind of comfort food. The burgers are huge, the steak fries are amazing. I'm not a fan of their fish and chips. Their milkshakes are pretty good. I was craving chicken strips one night and it is surprisingly hard to find chicken strips. So when I found this place and found the chicken strips were absolutely amazing I was thrilled. It's kind of weird waiting in your car for your number to be called but they have really good food and they're pretty quick with giving it to you.
author: Robin J.

description:
Driving down Ocean not seeing anything that looked worthwhile. We come up to to Beeps, passenger says it was somewhat of an institution back in the day. First good sign: prices seem like they haven't changed much since "back in the day." Wait at the window for a minute, read the note about no tomatoes due to salmonella epidemic. Chicken sandwich still available - my fears about the epidemic are stilled.
I get a 1/4lb burger, fries and a coke. Under six bucks is a beautiful thing. Short wait, food arrives in a brown paper bag. Burger is good, fries are thick cut and crispy. 
Filling, tasty, cheap, just like the good old days.
author: Jackson G.

description:
If you are a resident of the Ingleside neighborhood then this is the spot. I'm not even a resident and it's still the spot. My mother grew up just four blocks away which is why I have been enlightened with Beeps.

The prices are good, the burgers arn't the best you'll ever have but they are still scrumptious. The girl Kamie who works there practically every day is one of the nicest girls ever and always lights up when I come up the window saying "Hey Jason!" which makes me feel real welcome.

The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because they need to fix the neon lighting on the sign which now makes it look dull and the ketchup packets are too hard to open because they're the cheap kind from costco.
author: Jason M.

description: I truly have to admit; they have the best fries in town! Beeps Burgers takes a little longer than other fast food restaurants like BK, MacDonald's, but it is definitely worth the wait! Food is severed so fresh; you could taste it! You could even call (415-584-2650) in to make your order, so you could pick it up once you get there.
author: A L.

description: Rebecca M. and I head to Beep's for the convenient tasty low brow burgers and the awesomely crispy but thick fries. It is a drive in spot with few amenities but a good value. Seems to be family run.
author: Sam P.

description: Cheap burgers for on the run.  Burger was a lil dry, cooked all the way through.  If you're in the neighborhood, it's okay.
author: Rene C.

description: Hit or miss experience. Sometimes delicious, sometimes felt McDonalds could've done better. Fries are always great though. Staff is quite stingy about their ketchup supply.
author: Care B.

description: I'll just start off by saying that the chicken nuggets reminded me of something I've eaten before... the funny thing is, chicken nuggets don't ring a bell. It my opinion, it has an odd flavor but the barbecue sauce covers it pretty well. The fries are pretty good, once again, the barbecue sauce does wonders. The price is pretty good, you don't see a lot of large milkshakes that are less than $3 anymore.
author: Ryan L.

description:
when i get out of class and i absolutely, positively MUST get some food, i look no futher than beeps (i seriously cant even believe that the mcdonalds next to it even does business). its right across the street from campus and thanks to beeps ive never left not feelin stuffed. everything from the cheeseburgers to the corndogs to the fries are really good, and the milkshakes are delicious also. sure there is sometimes a wait, especially from 11AM-5PM when city college is running at its peak hours, but they realize that people need to get to class and therefore move as fast as they can to get you on your way. even at its worst ive never waited more than 15 min to get my food

This place delivers that old fashioned american burger joint feel, and the place even looks like its straight out of 1956. id even put it on the same level as bills in the richmond and the cable car spot on mission. if you're in the area and appreciate this type of food. this is your spot.
author: Andrew D.

description: I can't decide if it's awesome that their 4 dolla veggie burger is the best vegetarian meal near city college or if it's a travesty. Huge, super greasy, slathered in sauce on a bed of thick cut french fries, all of my aspirations of avoiding becoming a junk food vegetarian for convenience got thrown out the window today in the middle of a 5 hour language lab cram session. As a meat eater I'd probably give this place a 3 or a 4 but because of the lack of vegetarian food on campus (no, I don't want an avocado sandwich. I work at fucking Ike's Place.), the proximity of the best veggie burger experience in recent memory bumps Beep's up to 5. The fries are awesome, thick cut (probably frozen but who cares) and always come out well done with plenty of salt packets. PLUS ITS ALL 4 DOLLARS. Vegetarians of city college GO GET ONE SO THEY NEVER GO AWAY.
author: Nadia P.

description: The pineapple shake is pretty darn good, and the cheeseburger too, though I think I'm still more of a Whiz Burger type. Bonus for rock star sighting- Paul Kantner almost bruised my shin with his brand-new Ford, then sat there placidly eating his fries, perusing the NYT. Mellow times in the Ingleside.
author: Jonny A.

description: Wow. The times they are a changin! Beeps his somewhat historic in San Francisco. Not only have they been there forever and a day, but they're one of the few places that changes with the times to reflect the neighborhood. If you're looking for good ole burgers and fries, this is the place to go. They don't serve health conscience turkey burgers, new age California burgers with sprouts or fancy gourmet burgers with goat cheese. If you want that, go someplace else, but if you're looking for a classic American cheese burger or, in keeping with the neighborhood, a tasty rice bowl, this is the place to go.
author: Michael A.

description: So i NEEDED a burger today... like seriously needed one, and from beeps, i got one. It was good and tasty, cheese and catsup only just how i like it! 2 problems though... first of all, someone needs to take a bottle of bleach to the seating area out here, damn!! there was bird poop on the stools and yucky old condiments dried onto the bar area... so i moved to the table which is so warped and bent out of shape that i ended up eating sideways... they really need to invest in some new seating accommodations. My second issue were the fries... they don't even look good! they were completely tasteless and gross. I had to use so much salt and catsup to barely enjoy them! All in all, i would definitely go back for the burger and i am dying to try the pineapple milk shake!
author: A. H.

description:
Beeps is cheap, honest, not over priced, close to school, has the funky oil the good yucky unhealthy food I miss frm the south, its in the hood, questionable customers, and hood. but its ghetto good.

But Im a vegan chick, but I occasionaly relapse, and love to stick a huge stick off beef in my mouth on occasion
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: The fries were kinda stale, the burger itself was tasty but the actual meat used in said burger seemed  pretty bad, Its nothing special, but its not bad either.
author: Bruce W.

description: Just had lunch there with friends. No place to sit, only one outdoor picnic table, so we took it home. The fries got a thumbs up from all of us. The burgers we'll have to try again, this time asking for less ketchup! I only was able to taste ketchup and bun, nothing else sadly. Same with my friends, they had mustard, and that's all they tasted.  So word to those going here for a burger, ask for "Light" ketchup, mustard, etc.  I will try it again.
author: illy m.

description: cheeseburger was surprisingly GOOD. downside: no turkey burgers. :(
author: Lisa N.

description: Beep's is a long time favorite. You want a $25 burger got to Bix (that burger is damn good too). You want a $5.00 burger at Beep's and you're getting that and then some. Don't expect 5 star dining here. Expect a parking lot, a window, and a straight up good burger. This place has been around forever too.
author: C G.

description: Graduated from CCSF and never been to Beep's until the other day.  Yes, like most folks say, it's a hole in the wall.  I personally don't think it's that ghetto.  It's actually sorta cool in the retro sense.  Yes, the neighborhood could be better, but that sorta adds to the experience.  I never felt not safe there.  Ordered the pineapple shake based on some Yelp reviews and it was pretty good.  Got the teriyaki chicken burger and fries as well.  Good overall.  Still think the best teriyaki chicken burger is at Irving Street Cafe (716 Irving) but this is a good 2nd or third.  I would definitely go back.  You can wait in the car after ordering and they will call you when your order is ready.  Beats McDonald's down the street any day.
author: Samuel L.

description:
I first saw this place when I started going to city college two years ago.  It looked like one of those grimy little drive-in burger places in a bad part of town, kinda like Qwik Way (for those of you who remember) and Fosters Freeze (although Fosters Freeze tended not to be too grimy and was in an ok part of town).  I tended to be super lazy between classes at school so unless I had more than an hour break I would stay on campus an get gross cafeteria food.  Whatever.  It was something to eat, even though it tasted like cardboard.  
Finally one day I was on my way to McDonald's, (ewwww I know), when I really got way too lazy so I cut across the street to Beep's, since Beep's is all of a block closer to campus.  It was the best occasion of laziness I've ever had in my life.  I ordered a cheeseburger and fries, and though it took a while, the product was so so so good.  Surprisingly, I was expecting the food to be dripping in grease, but you know what?  It wasn't.  It was grilled to perfection and the fries were great! Thick cut, and crispy.  Prices are pretty cheap for the amount of food you get, and the food is a BILLION times better than Micky D's down the street.  Besides it doesn't have all the school kids that pour into McD's after school.  or during their lunchtime.  Yummyyyyy
author: Marley E.

description: Perfect Beeps burgers!!! Tasty, fresh and cheap enough. French fries made from fresh potato, this not potato wheat like in Mcdonalds or in Burger Kings. They have also different kind of meals.
author: Odil B.

description: This place has been here for ever, and I haven't eaten here for over 30 years!  Had the 1/2 cheese burger combo, came with hot, crispy steak fries, and a pineapple shake = HEAVEN!
author: Ed D.

description: Since I grew up not too far from this spot you know I grew up eating some Beep's. I've gotten so many people into this spot and most of you that have eaten a Beep's burger, that it's 2nd to none. Theonly thing I miss from there was their ORANGE DRANK. unless you ate there about 19 -20 years ago none of y'all know about the ORANGE DRANK they had!!!!
author: Richard G.

description: The meals are relatively cheap, their fries are well cooked, and their burger are pretty good. It's a great place to eat when you're on a budget. What is there more to say?
author: Wesley C.

description: I love to stop at Beep's when I'm in the area. The 1/4 lb cheeseburgers are juicy, but not greasy. I would like to add, that they are damn tasty too! The fries are fat, golden, and crispy - the way they should be! They even make rice bowls if you aren't  interested in burgers at the moment.
author: Yvonne C.

description: Ghetto Fab for the whole family. This place is delicious and a hidden gem from most of San Francisco. The steak fries are some of the best i have ever had. The burgers are huge. Beep's is the some of the best classic American food in San Francisco.
author: Bobby P.

description: I like this place, its interesting, everytime i go i just park there and eat in the car since theres not many tables, its a get and go place. Theyre chicken nuggets and root beer floats are awesome:-D
author: Jessica C.

description: as a city college student, this is a good place to go if you want to get some food off campus.  i was told they have the "best burgers ever" so I knew I had to try it out!  Let's just say I got a quarter pound cheese with onion rings complete with some ranch dressing for dipping and i ate the whole thing in one sitting. it was GOOD, fresh and tasty! they do have a pretty good selection of food, some fish dishes and even a veggie burger that's pretty good.  they make the food after you order it so it totally beats any fast food joint.  quick and tasty!
author: Margit H.

description: It's all about the burgers and fries here folks. The other stuff is just mediocre. And ohhh yeah, it's way way better McD's next door!!!! The dbl cheesburger is the shizzits and the fries are like steak fries. Nice and thick just the way I like it. It's a whole in the wall but that der is howzit suppose to be, ya hear!!
author: RICKY C.

description:
Beep's Burgers is a classic landmark in the Ingleside.  I've been coming here since the 80's and not much has changed.  There are still burgers and fries, as well as the teriyaki bowls.  The menu is a strange mix of American standards and Asian lunch specials.  Overall a very solid place for a cheap burger.

There are no tables to speak of, except for a few stools.  It's a take out place and there is a small lot.  I must say that I am disappointed they didn't fix the electric sign.  It's not the same without the glowing satellite.  Also, some guy got shot here a few years back at 3:00 in the afternoon, so the neighborhood hasn't changed, either.
author: John L.

description: Oh Beeps!  I miss you so.  I used to live up the street from you. I ate your burgers and fries at least once a week.  Maybe its not such a bad thing that I moved.
author: Melissa G.

description: Ctfu at the person who says it takes at least ten minutes to get their order. Really? So, you just want the food to be sittin' there cold waiting on you to order? Hilarious
author: S. F.

description: This place is really close to where I live and it looked like Big Dip back where my roommates used to live, so we decided to give it a try. The food's really good here. The pineapple milkshake is good, but not really my thing.
author: Rusty S.

description: Classic style fries, classic style burgers (they are lighter than they should be, but that is part of the classicalism), classic taste of amazing. Grub down!
author: Haz O.

description: Not much to say about this establishment but excellent on all counts and honestly from a drive up restaurant with fair prices reasonable to the current economy, what else could you rate. The food is excellent and is ready quickly
author: Brown D.

description: Thanks to Laura for bringing this place to the front of my mind....I too have been coming here since the day I broke free from the loins that created me....Mom and dad used to come here (aww back when they were all like dating n stuff). Gramma and the family would grab lunch there and many a day I cut school (sorry mama I know you'll read this) and headed out here for a big ole fattie of a burger and a thick chocolate shake. I think this might be the only place in the city where I actually eat the french fries!!!!  Will I continue to endure the "ey yo ma whaddup wit you today."...or "Hey uhhh Miss?? I see you're about to get a burger...You wouldn't happen to have an extra smoke now would ya?" YOU'RE DAMN RIGHT I WILL.......This place has always been constant and for that alone I am grateful
author: Shaunna K.

description: Yo someone better get the plunger cos Beep's is the SHIIIIIT!!!
author: Andrew F.

description:
I love their fries. I am sad to say that I haven't had the time to get food from Beep's lately.

Their burgers are relatively cheap and taste great. The last time I ate there I sat at a red table that's really dirty, but then again, there's nowhere else to sit, so I can't complain. I haven't really tried much, but whatever I've had has been amazing.
author: Connie J.

description: It took 20 minutes to get a very mediocre burger and fries.  I consider McDonalds a good burger and In N Out a great one, so I am not picky.  This place sucks and took forever.  Maybe it's good for the 15 year olds after school but anyone who likes decent food won't be happy.
author: DB C.

description:
I LOVE BEEPS.  I moved to the area a few months ago and was initially a bit sceptical, as it always seemed a bit dodgy, esp. after dark. 
However, I've never had a problem there and food is always bloomin marvellous.  Vanilla shakes are supreme, shrimp basket plentiful, cheesebuger is a classic.  Fish and Chips are also a very good cure for my pining after rainy UK.
The prices are spot on and the girl behind the counter is always really nice and on top of things....GO GO GO!
author: karen M.

description:
hells yeah. $6 for a veggie burger with cheese, fries and drink!? awesome. tasty succelent sexiness.  also, the fact that i used to live a block away didn't hurt, either.

cash only, people.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Oh it's delicious! But it's like ten dollars for a Philly cheese steak sandwich, which honestly, if it doesn't come with a side, is not enough food. Also it's like a ten minute wait for the sandwich.
Despite all that, I'm still stupid/hooked enough to go back for more.
author: Lona Z.

description: Good burgers, great fries, and for a Bostonian like me a nostalgic trip back to when the city had more old school drive up places like this.
author: Mike D.

description: When I was in high school at Lick-Wilmerding down the street, I used to walk down here with friends during all-school assemblies.  I always ordered the chicken nuggets.  I miss them dearly.  I'm going to go back and try them again soon, last time I had them was about sixteen years ago, but I remember them like it was yesterday.
author: Walter K.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place.  

During my stay at CCSF, I use to come here about 2 times a week for like 2 years.  I have tried pretty much everything on their menu.

There are a couple of must eat when I'm chow down here.
1. Cheese burger with grilled onions and bacon.
2. Steak cut fries.
3. The milk shake.

mmmmm...  I'm salivating just thinking about it.

Wait is not long at all.  I'm in and I'm out in about 30 minutes to go to my next class.  

It is definitely better than any other burger place within the area.  Very satisfying grubs.
author: Don H.

description: Not sure if Beeps is good because of the actual burgers or because the atmosphere feels soooooo right.  an outdoor, greasy, eat-in-your-car kind of place.   I just feel more urban in a parking lot dive (in a good way) like this!
author: Bruce R.

description: Ok...the burger, fries and shake was delicious.  I would probably have given 4 stars, but because of the salmonella scare, there were no tomatoes in my burger.  It just seemed kinda flat.  The lettuce wasn't very fresh either.  The least they could do was add more lettuce to compensate for the missing tomato.  The thick fries were really good.  At first I thought there weren't enough fries with my meal but it turned out that it was more than enough, mainly because the fries were really thick, but very yummy.  The strawberry shake was super!!!  I'll definitely go back again.  Can't wait to try to mini corn dogs.
author: Katniss B.

description: Food is pretty good. A step bigger than McDonald's tiny burgers which is a block down. They don't except credit cards though!!! sucksss. But I really like they're chicken nuggets!
author: Katarina V.

description: surprisingly good burgers....maybe it tastes so good because im always so hungry after a long day studying at city college.
author: jon b.

description:
This is a good old American burger stand. 
 I have been hear a few times and i'm always pleased.  On a sunny day you can eat on one of their three stales or share a picnic table with patrons that range from locals from the neighborhood, CCSF students, City Employees, or  local potheads making a pitstop after visiting a nearby Cannabis dispensories. 
On a scale from 1-5
Ambiance: 3, not fancy but convenient
Food:4, Surprising delicious 
Price:3-9 drink and entree
Service: adequate yet indifferent, and they smile 
Advice take a coat or stay in vehicle cuz it gets cold.
author: Rene M.

description: Cheap and delicious. I've been going here ever since I came to CCSF. The burgers here are great. It's only about $5 for a quarter pounder and fries, much better than McDonalds down the block. The cashier girl is also very nice. One downside is the seating. There's only three stools and one bench table so if there's going to be 7 people eating in that area, you better find somewhere else to eat your meal. The parking lot is very convenient though if you need to grab some food and go. If you're in the area, I recommend having lunch here. If you've always walked by it but never bought anything, I suggest you give it a try.
author: Austin C.

description:
this place is okay, i mean don't get me wrong, a quick snack on the go this is the place to go instead of the crappy mcd two blocks away. but i'm so use to eatting at higher ends neighborhoods (away from this junky hole in the corner type-atomsphere) that i find this place unappealing. 

once again, don't get me wrong though. i'm just judgemental and choose to eat as little as possible from places that doesn't seem appealing to my eyes at first glance. but because i go to school @ ccsf, and i live pretty close by, it's a pretty good place if i'm in a rush or just too lazy in general to go elsewhere. 

in general, the food is here much better then your average burger joints. you can probably compare it to in n out, and get similiar if not better quality burgers. fries, are all options, i'm not much of a steak-fries guy, so i won't give my opinion on that, although i've heard and seen other people who've liked it. other stuff on the menu is pretty decent too. philly cheesesteak i liked and if that was the only thing in the menu, i'd give it a 4 star. but the rest is just pretty decent. the price is your average price for lunch on the go. 

the service is slow... that's also preventing me from giving it a 4-5 stars. but what they hey right? if all else fails and you don't want to wait 5-10minutes for a REAL burger, you can go to mcd for the shittiest one dollar burger of ur life 

so give it a shot, even though i gave it 3 stars, i'll highly recommend it if you're in the neighborhood and feeling for a quick grub.
author: Stanley C.

description: Some seriously good fast food. So much better than grabbing a McDonald's that is down the street, huge selection from their nuggets, to rice bowls, and their tacos. Love that there's parking there and the orders come out fast. We'll be back for more.
author: Jane T.

description: Even if you are the ONLY customer, it still takes at least 10 minutes to get your food. Combos do NOT include a drink-you have to pay EXTRA for that!! As mentioned in someones' previous review, the pics of their combos are so faded, it's hard to tell what they even are. And it says that they offer "Outdoor Seating". They only have 1 grungy small picnic table that usually has bird poop on the table portion & the seats. I hardly think that qualifies as "Outdoor Seating"!! Last but certainly not least, they do NOT publicly display their health inspection rating which kinda makes you wonder how bad their score really is. A sign says that you have to request to see their health inspection rating. If their rating was somewhat decent(85% or higher), don't you think they would be proud to visibly display it for the customers?
author: Boyce M.

description: I'm giving Beeps 5 stars because I've always gotten exactly what I was going for. For a greasy hamburger stand it's aces right down to the big fat steak cut fries. I'm a fan of the 1/4 pounder in the basket with fries and the Chicken Fingers in the basket with fries. They also do pineapple shakes.
author: Kirtley W.

description: So far I've had the Veggie Burger Combo, fish and chips, an egg sandwich, and a strawberry milkshake. ALL of which were oh so good and surprisingly cheap. I almost always a big ol bag of fries from here when I'm hungry, low on money, and craving fried potatoey meatiness. I love you beeps. I love you forever.
author: Shirley D.

description: Sometimes when I'm on my way home after a long week, I have to splurge on a 1/2lb cheeseburger at Beeps. It's no gourmet burger but it's oh so sweet for the  price when I need a burger fix. I'll take Beeps over McDonalds any day!
author: Veronica J.

description:
From the street, Beep's doesn't look like anything special--a somewhat run-down-looking relic from an earlier era that may induce waves of childhood drive-in burger nostalgia.  The advertised fare--burgers, shakes, corn dogs, shrimp nuggets, and other deep-fried delights-- may dissuade less adventurous (or carnivorous) souls from venturing up to the order window.  

My wife and I drove past this place for months before finally trying it.  Now it's one of my favorites.  I don't really get the burger jones often; when I do, Beep's is usually the first place that comes to mind.
When it comes to the burger-and-fries combo, Beep's delivers in spades.  There aren't too many places left where one can get a 1/2 pound burger with cheese and fixings and a handful of steak fries for $5 anymore.
author: Jason V.

description: creamy luscious frothy shakes ! the pineapple is magnificent. their burgers and fries are tasty, a nice alternative to Mickey Doo down the street. if you're in the mood, buy their fruit punch and spike it up with some Goose or Absolut -- there's your Friday night happy hour for a fraction of a bar tab
author: Prima D.

description: the strawberry and vanilla milkshake are pretty darn good !! fish & chips are alright . Burgers are okay .
author: Eileen L.

description: amazing!!! such a good old school place, the ppl that work there are super nice, great menu, great prices :] fun for big groups and dates or even a late night snack!!!!!!!!!
author: Selina W.

description: i heart beeps, me likey the french/steak fries. :)
author: Pickle R.

description: The fries here are sooooo good! I also love the Fish n' Chips. I mostly eat them with tartar sauce. If you live somewhere near there, or you go to City College, I recommend you to go to this place.
author: Thao C.

description: Great oldskool burger spot. It's Drive-up so there's no indoor seating but there's a few picnic tables outside. Really just an average burger but I'm addicted.
author: Mike B.

description: Beep's is pretty good, however I don't find it to be that special. Granted, the burger tastes a lot better than McDonalds or other chain restaurants, but it still doesn't have that kick to it that makes me go WOW! That was good! However, it is cheap (I think it was 2.09 + tax for just the burger, no cheese). I like to avoid the fries. They are too potato-ey for my taste, perhaps it's just that I don't have a good ketchup to fry ratio (they only give so little ketchup :( ) I liked the chicken teriyaki burger, though it was a bit dry. Also tried a rice plate. Can't really remember which one...pork with onions? Something like that. It's pretty good for a place that sells burgers and fries. It comes with a special dipping sauce that I personally really liked! But I've yet to try their famous pineapple milkshakes, but I will make it a point to, one day! ALSO, waaaay tastier (and cheaper) than anything you can get on the CCSF campus. No more paying for overpriced chicken bakes!
author: Bub B.

description: Beeps gets a 5 star rating because of their pineapple shake.  Anyone looking for a good hearty burger from a legendary SF hotspot ought to stumble over to Beeps for a vintage old school feel.  Be sure to accompany your cheesburger with the city famed pineapple shake.  I haven't had a shake at a Burger joint that tasted this good since going to Foster's Freeze as a young buck.
author: Rex J.

description: i really like this place.  i first started coming here back when i was still in high school when i took the 29 and got off to transfer buses.  beep's is like right there so me and my friends would always stop and grab something to eat.  the burgers and fish sandwiches are always great.  the chicken strips are good also.  sometimes i just order fries and they always come to you hot and in big portions.  the place may look a little janky but's it's definitely worth your visit
author: Vanessa C.

description: Can't say much about their other selections, but Beep's Burgers gets its specialty done right. At about 5 bucks for a half pounder with cheese, Beep's is a real deal. Sure the place is ghetto, but you get what you pay for, but it goes with my saying that the more dirty something seems, the more tasty it will be (sort of like Pork's status amongst meats). Besides, I'm tired of gentrified foods, because at its heart, a hamburger isn't supposed to be made from the best beef. I think the only problem with the place is that they aren't super fast for fast food, or at least it doesn't seem to be.
author: Derek L.

description: beeps burgers can honestly get pretty shady at times during a late night due to its relative closeness to ingleside/lakeview ghettoness.  the differentiator beeps has with its burgers is that they use liquid smoke.  beers burger i'd classify as a 2nd tier chinese hamburger,  some other chinese hamburgers are HRD cafe, whiz burger, wong's grill, hawaiian drive in #28 and bj's quarter pounder burger.
author: christopher a.

description: gotta love the number 14 ask ofr bacon and call it in!!
author: tony s.

description: Yes, it is delicious.  It is also a bit sketchy with that sign in the window that says something like "chemicals in food products may cause cancer".  Hell, live your life on the edge and take risks.

description: The burgers are great and the steak fries are awesome.  It has that drive thru appeal, however could be updated.  The prices are fair.  Check it out!

description: i ordered the cheeseburger w/ fries.....it  took me 15 mins before i could get my food....the beef is kind of dry, i don't like the fries.  only give a few bags of ketchup are not enough.  will not come back again
